en: His manner was not effusive. It seldom was; but he was glad, I think, to see me. With hardly a word spoken, but with a kindly eye, he waved me to an armchair, threw across his case of cigars, and indicated a spirit case and a gasogene in the corner. Then he stood before the fire and looked me over in his singular introspective fashion.
vi: Thái độ của anh có vẻ không nồng nhiệt lắm. Anh vẫn thường tỏ ra như vậy, nhưng tôi nghĩ anh vui khi thấy tôi. Không nói lấy một lời nhưng với ánh mắt ân cần, anh vẫy tay ra chiều bảo tôi ngồi xuống ghế, ném cho tôi hộp xì gà và chỉ vào một két rượu mạnh và bình tạo soda nằm ở góc phòng. Đoạn, anh ra đứng trước lò sưởi và ngắm nghía tôi theo cách quan sát đánh giá kì quặc của mình.
tr: Beni coşkuyla karşılamadı. Zaten nadiren öyle olurdu; ama sanırım beni gördüğüne sevinmişti. Tek laf etmeden ama dostane bir bakışla bana koltuğu işaret etti. Bir kutu sigara fırlatırken kül tablası ile çakmağın yerini gösterdi. Sonra şöminenin önünde durarak, kendine özgü bakışlarıyla beni tepeden tırnağa dikkatlice süzdü.
es: Sus modales no eran efusivos. Rara vez lo eran, pero creo que se alegró de verme. Sin pronunciar apenas una palabra, pero con una mirada amable, me hizo un gesto para que me acercara a un sillón, me lanzó su caja de puros y me indicó una caja de licores y un gasógeno en un rincón. Luego se paró frente al fuego y me miró con su singular estilo introspectivo.
vi_translation: Your attitude doesn't seem very enthusiastic. You often act that way, but I think you're happy to see me. Without saying a word but with a kind look, you waved your hand indicating for me to sit down, tossed me a box of cigars, and pointed to a crate of strong liquor and a soda maker in the corner of the room. Then, you stood in front of the fireplace and observed me with your peculiar evaluative gaze.
tr_translation: He did not greet me with enthusiasm. That rarely happened anyway; but I think he was happy to see me. Without saying a word but with a friendly look, he pointed to the chair. While tossing a pack of cigarettes, he indicated the location of the ashtray and lighter. Then, standing in front of the fireplace, he carefully examined me from head to toe with his characteristic gaze.
es_translation: His manners were not effusive. They rarely were, but I think he was glad to see me. Without uttering barely a word, but with a kind look, he gestured for me to approach an armchair, tossed me his cigar box, and pointed to a box of liquors and a soda siphon in a corner. Then he stood in front of the fire and looked at me with his unique introspective style.

en: “It is simplicity itself,” said he; “my eyes tell me that on the inside of your left shoe, just where the firelight strikes it, the leather is scored by six almost parallel cuts. Obviously they have been caused by someone who has very carelessly scraped round the edges of the sole in order to remove crusted mud from it. Hence, you see, my double deduction that you had been out in vile weather, and that you had a particularly malignant boot-slitting specimen of the London slavey. As to your practice, if a gentleman walks into my rooms smelling of iodoform, with a black mark of nitrate of silver upon his right forefinger, and a bulge on the right side of his top-hat to show where he has secreted his stethoscope, I must be dull, indeed, if I do not pronounce him to be an active member of the medical profession.”
vi: Anh cười tủm tỉm và xoa hai bàn tay dài vào nhau. “Rất dễ dàng”, anh nói, “đôi mắt bảo tôi rằng tại phần da má trong của chiếc giày bên trái của anh, ngay chỗ ánh lửa chiếu vào, có sáu vết xước gần như song song. Rõ ràng chúng là do ai đó bất cẩn khi chà bùn khô quanh mép gót giày gây ra. Như thế chứng tỏ anh vừa gặp thời tiết xấu vừa có một cô hầu gái chăm rạch giày chủ nhất London. Còn về chuyện hành nghề của anh thì, nếu một quý ông bước vào nhà tôi sực nức mùi iốt, có một chấm bạc nitrat trên ngón trỏ bàn tay phải và một chỗ phình ở bên phải cái mũ chóp cao - đó là nơi anh ta giấu ống nghe - thì tôi hẳn phải tối dạ lắm mới không biết anh ta là đồ đệ của Hippocrates.”
tr: "Çok basit," dedi. "Gözlerim bana, sol ayağındaki ayakkabının iç tarafında, tam şömine ışığının vurduğu yerde, ayakkabı derisinin üzerinde birbirine neredeyse paralel altı çizik bulunduğunu söylüyor. Kurumuş çamuru çıkarmak için kazımaya çalışmış beceriksiz birinin elinden çıktıkları açık. Gördüğün gibi, akıl yürütmeyle, yağmurlu bir havaya yakalandığını ve Londra'nın en kötü çizme temizleyicisine sahip olduğunu çıkarabiliyorum. Muayenehanende çalışmakta olduğunu ise şundan çıkardım: Bir beyefendi odama girdiğinde tentürdiyot kokuyorsa, sağ elinin işaret parmağında siyah bir gümüş nitrat lekesi varsa ve paltosunun sağ cebinde, stetoskopunu saklamış olduğu yeri belli eden bir kabarıklık varsa, onun faal bir hekim olduğunu anlayamamam için aptal olmam gerekir.
es: "Es muy sencillo", dijo, "mis ojos me dicen que en el interior de su zapato izquierdo, justo donde la luz del fuego incide, el cuero está marcado con seis cortes casi paralelos. Evidentemente, han sido causados por alguien que ha raspado con mucho descuido los bordes de la suela para quitarle el barro encostrado. De ahí, como ve, mi doble deducción de que usted había salido a la calle con mal tiempo, y de que tenía un ejemplar especialmente dañino de Londres que rasca las botas de mala forma. En cuanto a su práctica, si un caballero entra en mis habitaciones oliendo a yodoformo, con una marca negra de nitrato de plata en su dedo índice derecho, y un bulto en el lado derecho de su sombrero de copa para mostrar dónde ha segregado su estetoscopio, debo ser torpe, en verdad, si no lo pronuncio como un miembro activo de la profesión médica."
vi_translation: "Very easy," he said, "the eyes tell me that on the inner cheek of the left shoe, right where the firelight hits, there are six almost parallel scratches. Clearly, they were caused by someone carelessly scraping off dry mud around the edge of the heel. This indicates that you have recently encountered bad weather and have the most diligent shoe-cleaning maid in London. As for your profession, if a gentleman walks into my house reeking of iodine, with a spot of silver nitrate on the index finger of his right hand and a bulge on the right side of his top hat - that's where he hides his stethoscope - then I would have to be very dim-witted not to know that he is a disciple of Hippocrates."
tr_translation: "Very simple," he said. "My eyes tell me that on the inside of your left shoe, right where the light from the fireplace hits, there are six almost parallel scratches on the leather of the shoe. It's clear they were made by someone clumsy trying to scrape off dried mud. As you can see, through reasoning, I can deduce that you were caught in rainy weather and that you have the worst boot cleaner in London. As for deducing that you work in your clinic: If a gentleman enters my room smelling of iodine, has a black silver nitrate stain on the index finger of his right hand, and has a bulge in the right pocket of his coat indicating where he has hidden his stethoscope, I would have to be an idiot not to understand that he is an active physician."
es_translation: "It's very simple," he said, "my eyes tell me that inside your left shoe, right where the firelight hits, the leather is marked with six almost parallel cuts. Evidently, they have been caused by someone who has very carelessly scraped the edges of the sole to remove the encrusted mud. Hence, as you see, my double deduction that you had gone out in bad weather, and that you had a particularly harmful specimen of London that scrapes boots in a bad way. As for your practice, if a gentleman enters my rooms smelling of iodoform, with a black mark of silver nitrate on his right index finger, and a bulge on the right side of his top hat to show where he has stored his stethoscope, I must be clumsy indeed if I do not pronounce him an active member of the medical profession."

en: I could not help laughing at the ease with which he explained his process of deduction. “When I hear you give your reasons,” I remarked, “the thing always appears to me to be so ridiculously simple that I could easily do it myself, though at each successive instance of your reasoning I am baffled until you explain your process. And yet I believe that my eyes are as good as yours.”
vi: Tôi không thể nhịn cười trước cách Holmes giảng giải. “Khi tôi nghe các suy luận của anh”, tôi nhận xét, “tôi luôn thấy sự việc quá ư đơn giản, ngay đến tôi cũng suy đoán được. Nhưng hễ anh đưa ra ví dụ mới, tôi lại mù tịt tới khi được nghe anh giảng giải. Tuy vậy, tôi vẫn cho là mắt tôi tốt chẳng kém gì mắt anh.”
tr: Akıl yürütme sürecini açıklamadaki rahatlığı üzerine gülmekten kendimi alamadım. "İleri sürdüğün delilleri dinledikçe," dedim, "çözümün gülünç ölçüde kolay olduğunu, benim bile bunu aynı kolaylıkla yapabileceğimi görüyorum. Fakat yeni bir örnekle karşılaştığımda sen çözümü açıklayana kadar şaşkınlığım geçmiyor. Oysa benim gözlerim de seninkiler kadar iyi.
es: No pude evitar reírme de la facilidad con la que explicó su proceso de deducción. "Cuando le oigo dar sus razones", comenté, "la cosa siempre me parece tan ridículamente simple que yo mismo podría hacerlo fácilmente, aunque en cada instancia sucesiva de su razonamiento me siento desconcertado hasta que usted explica su proceso. Y sin embargo, creo que mis ojos son tan buenos como los tuyos".
vi_translation: I couldn't help but laugh at the way Holmes explained. "When I hear your deductions," I remarked, "everything seems so simple that even I could deduce it. But whenever you present a new example, I am completely in the dark until I hear your explanation. However, I still believe that my eyes are just as good as yours."
tr_translation: I couldn't help but laugh at the ease with which he explained the reasoning process. "As I listen to the evidence you present," I said, "I see that the solution is absurdly simple, and that I could do it just as easily. But when I encounter a new example, my bewilderment doesn't fade until you explain the solution. Yet my eyes are as good as yours.""
es_translation: I couldn't help but laugh at the ease with which he explained his deduction process. "When I hear you give your reasons," I commented, "it always seems so ridiculously simple that I could easily do it myself, although in each successive instance of your reasoning I feel baffled until you explain your process. And yet, I believe my eyes are as good as yours."

en: “Quite so,” he answered, lighting a cigarette, and throwing himself down into an armchair. “You see, but you do not observe. The distinction is clear. For example, you have frequently seen the steps which lead up from the hall to this room.”
vi: “Quả vậy”, anh đốt một điếu thuốc và buông mình ngồi xuống ghế. “Anh nhìn thấy, nhưng anh không quan sát. Đó là hai vấn đề hoàn toàn khác biệt. Ví dụ nhé, anh thường trông thấy những bậc thang dẫn từ tiền sảnh lên căn phòng này chứ?”
tr: "Doğru," diye cevap verdi. Bir sigara yaktı ve koltuğa gömüldü. "Bakıyorsun ama gözlemlemiyorsun. Aramızdaki fark belli. Mesela, antreden bu odaya çıkan merdivenleri sık sık görmüşsündür.
es: "Así es", contestó él, encendiendo un cigarrillo y tirándose en un sillón. "Usted ve, pero no observa. La distinción es clara. Por ejemplo, usted ha visto con frecuencia los escalones que suben desde el vestíbulo hasta esta habitación".
vi_translation: “Indeed,” he lit a cigarette and let himself fall into the chair. “You see, but you do not observe. Those are two entirely different things. For instance, you often see the steps leading from the hall to this room, don't you?”
tr_translation: "Correct," he replied. He lit a cigarette and sank into the armchair. "You look, but you don't observe. The difference between us is clear. For instance, you must have often seen the stairs leading from the hallway to this room."
es_translation: "That's right," he replied, lighting a cigarette and throwing himself into an armchair. "You see, but you do not observe. The distinction is clear. For example, you have frequently seen the steps that lead up from the hall to this room."

en: “Quite so! You have not observed. And yet you have seen. That is just my point. Now, I know that there are seventeen steps, because I have both seen and observed. By the way, since you are interested in these little problems, and since you are good enough to chronicle one or two of my trifling experiences, you may be interested in this.” He threw over a sheet of thick, pink-tinted notepaper which had been lying open upon the table. “It came by the last post,” said he. “Read it aloud.”
vi: “Đó! Anh nhìn thấy nhưng anh không quan sát. Ý của tôi là vậy đấy. Về phần tôi, tôi biết có mười bảy bậc thang, bởi tôi vừa nhìn vừa quan sát. Nhân tiện, vì anh quan tâm đến những vấn đề nho nhỏ này và thường ghi chép một hai lần phá án lặt vặt của tôi nên có lẽ anh sẽ quan tâm đến cái này.” Anh ném cho tôi một tờ giấy màu hồng dày dặn để mở sẵn trên bàn từ trước. “Nó vừa được đưa tới”, anh nói. “Hãy đọc to lên.”
tr: "Tam da bu işte! Çünkü gözlemlemedin. Ama baktın. Benim demek istediğim de bu. Ben on yedi basamak olduğunu biliyorum çünkü ben hem baktım hem de gözlemledim. Bu arada, küçük problemlerle ilgilendiğin ve benim bazı önemsiz deneyimlerimi kaleme alma meziyetine sahip olduğun için şu mesele ilgini çekebilir" dedi. Masanın üzerinde duran pembe renkli ve kalın bir mektup zarfını bana uzattı. "Postayla yeni geldi," dedi. "Yüksek sesle oku.
es: "¡Claro que sí! No has observado. Y, sin embargo, has visto. Ese es mi punto de vista. Ahora, sé que hay diecisiete pasos, porque he visto y observado. Por cierto, ya que te interesan estos pequeños problemas, y ya que eres lo suficientemente bueno como para hacer una crónica de una o dos de mis insignificantes experiencias, puede que te interese esto". Arrojó una hoja de papel grueso, de color rosa, que estaba abierta sobre la mesa. "Me llegó por el último correo", dijo. "Léala en voz alta".
vi_translation: "There! You see, but you do not observe. That is what I mean. As for me, I know there are seventeen steps, because I both look and observe. By the way, since you are interested in these little matters and often jot down one or two of my trivial cases, you might be interested in this." He tossed me a thick pink paper that had been lying open on the table. "It just arrived," he said. "Read it aloud."
tr_translation: "That's exactly it! Because you didn't observe. But you looked. That's what I mean. I know there are seventeen steps because I both looked and observed. By the way, since you are interested in small problems and have the skill to write down some of my trivial experiences, this matter might interest you," he said. He handed me a thick, pink-colored envelope that was on the table. "It just arrived by mail," he said. "Read it out loud.""
es_translation: "Of course!" You haven't observed. And yet, you have seen. That is my point of view. Now, I know there are seventeen steps, because I have seen and observed. By the way, since you are interested in these little problems, and since you are good enough to chronicle one or two of my insignificant experiences, you might be interested in this." He threw a thick, pink sheet of paper, which was open, onto the table. "It came to me by the last post," he said. "Read it aloud."

en: “I have no data yet. It is a capital mistake to theorise before one has data. Insensibly one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts. But the note itself. What do you deduce from it?”
vi: “Tôi chưa có dữ kiện. Đưa ra giả thuyết trước khi có dữ kiện là một lỗi vô cùng tai hại, khiến ta vô tình bóp méo sự việc cho phù hợp với giả thuyết, thay vì ngược lại. Nhưng anh có suy đoán gì về bản thân tờ giấy này không?”
tr: "Henüz elimde bir bilgi yok. Elinde bilgi olmadan bir teori üretmek büyük bir hata olur. İnsan teorileri gerçeklere uyduracağına, farkında olmadan gerçekleri teorilere uydurmaya çalışır. Gelelim mektuba; ondan ne çıkarıyorsun?
es: "Todavía no tengo datos. Es un error capital teorizar antes de tener datos. Insensiblemente uno empieza a retorcer los hechos para adaptarlos a las teorías, en lugar de que las teorías se adapten a los hechos. Pero la nota en sí misma. ¿Qué deduce usted de ella?"
vi_translation: “I don't have the data yet. Formulating a hypothesis before having the data is a very harmful mistake, as it unintentionally distorts the facts to fit the hypothesis, instead of the other way around. But do you have any guesses about the paper itself?”
tr_translation: "I don't have any information yet. It would be a big mistake to produce a theory without having information. Instead of fitting theories to facts, people unconsciously try to fit facts to theories. Let's get to the letter; what do you make of it?"
es_translation: "I still don't have data. It is a capital mistake to theorize before having data. Insensibly, one begins to twist facts to suit theories, instead of theories to suit facts. But the note itself. What do you deduce from it?"

en: “Precisely. And the man who wrote the note is a German. Do you note the peculiar construction of the sentence—‘This account of you we have from all quarters received.’ A Frenchman or Russian could not have written that. It is the German who is so uncourteous to his verbs. It only remains, therefore, to discover what is wanted by this German who writes upon Bohemian paper and prefers wearing a mask to showing his face. And here he comes, if I am not mistaken, to resolve all our doubts.”
vi: “Chính xác. Và người viết thư là người Đức. Anh để ý thấy cấu trúc kì lạ của câu: ‘Thành tích này của ông chúng tôi đã từ khắp nơi nghe thấy’ này chứ? Người Pháp hay người Nga sẽ không viết thế. Chỉ có người Đức mới dùng động từ ở cuối câu. Vậy chúng ta chỉ còn phải tìm hiểu xem cái ông người Đức sử dụng loại giấy xuất xứ Bohemia và thích đeo mặt nạ này muốn gì. Và nếu như tôi không lầm thì ông ta đã tới giải đáp mọi nghi vấn của chúng ta rồi.”
tr: "Kesinlikle. Ve mektubu yazan adam bir Alman. Garip cümle yapısına baksana: ‘Her kesimden sizinle ilgili edindiğimiz bilgiler.' Bir Fransız ya da Rus bunu bu şekilde yazmazdı. Sadece Almanlar fiilleri böyle kaba kullanır. Öyleyse yapılacak tek birşey kalıyor; Bohemya malı kâğıdına yazan ve yüzünü göstermemek için maske takan bu Alman'ın ne istediğini bulmak. Ve yanılmıyorsam, kendisi bütün şüphelerimizi gidermek üzere şimdi buraya geliyor.
es: "Precisamente. Y el hombre que escribió la nota es alemán. Fíjese en la peculiar construcción de la frase: "Hemos recibido de todas partes este informe sobre usted". Un francés o un ruso no podrían haber escrito eso. Es el alemán quien es tan descortés con sus verbos. Por lo tanto, sólo queda descubrir qué es lo que quiere este alemán que escribe en papel de Bohemia y que prefiere llevar una máscara a mostrar su rostro. Y aquí viene, si no me equivoco, a resolver todas nuestras dudas".
vi_translation: “Exactly. And the letter writer is German. Did you notice the strange structure of the sentence: ‘This achievement of yours we have heard from all over’? A French or Russian person wouldn't write like that. Only Germans put the verb at the end of the sentence. So we just need to find out what this German man who uses Bohemian paper and likes to wear masks wants. And if I'm not mistaken, he has come to answer all our questions already.”
tr_translation: "Absolutely. And the man who wrote the letter is a German. Look at the strange sentence structure: 'The information we have gathered about you from all walks of life.' A French or Russian person wouldn't write it this way. Only Germans use verbs so crudely. So, there's only one thing left to do; find out what this German, who wrote on Bohemian paper and wore a mask to hide his face, wants. And if I'm not mistaken, he is coming here now to dispel all our doubts."
es_translation: "Precisely. And the man who wrote the note is German. Notice the peculiar construction of the sentence: "We have received from all quarters this report about you." A Frenchman or a Russian could not have written that. It is the German who is so discourteous with his verbs. Therefore, it only remains to discover what this German, who writes on Bohemian paper and prefers to wear a mask rather than show his face, wants. And here he comes, if I am not mistaken, to resolve all our doubts."

en: “Never mind him. I may want your help, and so may he. Here he comes. Sit down in that armchair, Doctor, and give us your best attention.”
vi: “Đừng để ý đến ông ta. Có thể tôi, và có lẽ cả ông ta đều cần sự trợ giúp của anh. Ông ta đến rồi. Bác sĩ hãy ngồi vào cái ghế đó và tập trung nhé.”
tr: "Onu kafana takma. Yardımına ihtiyacım olabilir. İşte geliyor. Şu koltuğa otur doktor ve gözlerini dört aç.
es: "No te preocupes por él. Puede que yo quiera su ayuda, y él también. Aquí viene. Siéntese en ese sillón, doctor, y preste su mejor atención".
vi_translation: "Don't pay attention to him. Perhaps I, and maybe even he, need your help. He has arrived. Doctor, please sit in that chair and focus."
tr_translation: "Don't worry about it. I might need your help. Here he comes. Sit on that chair, doctor, and keep your eyes peeled."
es_translation: "Don't worry about him. I might want his help, and he might too. Here he comes. Have a seat in that armchair, doctor, and pay your best attention."

en: A slow and heavy step, which had been heard upon the stairs and in the passage, paused immediately outside the door. Then there was a loud and authoritative tap.
vi: Có tiếng bước chân chậm rãi và nặng nề vang lên trên cầu thang và trong hành lang rồi ngừng lại ngay ngoài cửa phòng. Sau đó chúng tôi nghe thấy một tiếng gõ cửa mạnh mẽ và uy quyền.
tr: Merdivenleri çıkan ve koridora kadar gelen yavaş ve ağır ayak sesleri, oda kapımızın önünde kesildi. Ve sert bir şekilde kapıya vuruldu.
es: Un paso lento y pesado, que se había escuchado en las escaleras y en el pasillo, se detuvo inmediatamente frente a la puerta. Luego se oyó un golpe fuerte y autoritario.
vi_translation: There were slow and heavy footsteps echoing on the stairs and in the hallway, then they stopped right outside the door of the room. After that, we heard a strong and authoritative knock on the door.
tr_translation: The slow and heavy footsteps that climbed the stairs and reached the corridor stopped in front of our room door. And there was a hard knock on the door.
es_translation: A slow and heavy step, which had been heard on the stairs and in the hallway, stopped immediately in front of the door. Then a loud and authoritative knock was heard.

en: The Count shrugged his broad shoulders. “Then I must begin,” said he, “by binding you both to absolute secrecy for two years; at the end of that time the matter will be of no importance. At present it is not too much to say that it is of such weight it may have an influence upon European history.”
vi: Ông bá tước nhún đôi vai rộng. “Vậy trước hết”, ông ta nói, “tôi buộc phải yêu cầu cả hai ông tuyệt đối giữ bí mật trong hai năm; sau thời gian đó, vấn đề sẽ không còn quan trọng. Còn hiện tại, nếu tôi nói nó có thể ảnh hưởng tới lịch sử của toàn Âu châu cũng không ngoa.
tr: Kont geniş omuzlarını silkti. "O halde başlayayım," dedi. "Fakat öncelikle anlatacaklarımın iki yıl süre ile sır olarak kalmasını size, şart koştuğumu bilmenizi isterim; bu sürenin sonunda anlatacaklarımın bir önemi kalmayacaktır, ama şu an için Avrupa tarihini etkileyecek bir olay olduğunu söylersem abartmış olmam.
es: El Conde se encogió de hombros. "Entonces debo empezar -dijo- por obligaros a ambos a guardar absoluto secreto durante dos años; al cabo de ese tiempo el asunto no tendrá ninguna importancia. Por el momento no es excesivo decir que es de tal peso que puede tener una influencia en la historia europea."
vi_translation: The count shrugged his broad shoulders. “So first,” he said, “I must insist that both of you absolutely keep this secret for two years; after that time, the matter will no longer be important. For now, if I say it could affect the history of all of Europe, it would not be an exaggeration.”
tr_translation: Kont shrugged his broad shoulders. "Then I shall begin," he said. "But first, I want you to know that I insist on what I am about to tell you remaining a secret for two years; at the end of this period, what I will tell you will no longer matter, but if I say that it will affect European history at this moment, I would not be exaggerating."
es_translation: The Count shrugged his shoulders. "Then I must begin," he said, "by obliging you both to keep absolute secrecy for two years; after that time, the matter will have no importance." "For the moment, it is not excessive to say that it is of such weight that it could have an influence on European history."

en: The man sprang from his chair and paced up and down the room in uncontrollable agitation. Then, with a gesture of desperation, he tore the mask from his face and hurled it upon the ground. “You are right,” he cried; “I am the King. Why should I attempt to conceal it?”
vi: Người đàn ông bật khỏi ghế và sải bước đi lại trong phòng với vẻ bối rối không kiểm soát nổi. Rồi, ông ta buồn bực giật chiếc mặt nạ và ném mạnh xuống sàn nhà. “Ông nói đúng”, ông ta hét lên. “Ta là vua kia mà. Sao ta phải giấu thân phận chứ?”
tr: Adam yerinden fırlayarak sıkıntıyla odada ileri geri yürümeye başladı. Ümidi kırılmış gibiydi; yüzündeki maskeyi çıkarıp yere fırlattı. "Haklısınız," diye bağırdı; "kral benim. Neden gizlemeye çalışayım ki?
es: El hombre saltó de su silla y se paseó por la habitación con una agitación incontrolable. Luego, con un gesto de desesperación, se arrancó la máscara de la cara y la arrojó al suelo. "Tienes razón", gritó, "soy el Rey. ¿Por qué debería intentar ocultarlo?"
vi_translation: The man jumped out of his chair and paced back and forth in the room with uncontrollable confusion. Then, he angrily tore off the mask and threw it forcefully onto the floor. “You are right,” he shouted. “I am the king after all. Why should I hide my identity?” “That's right, why would Your Majesty need to hide it?”
tr_translation: Adam jumped up from his seat and started pacing back and forth in the room with anxiety. He seemed to have lost hope; he took off the mask on his face and threw it to the ground. "You are right," he shouted; "I am the king. Why should I try to hide it?"
es_translation: The man jumped from his chair and paced around the room with uncontrollable agitation. Then, with a gesture of despair, he tore the mask from his face and threw it to the ground. "You are right," he shouted, "I am the King. Why should I try to hide it?"

en: “Then I fail to follow your Majesty. If this young person should produce her letters for blackmailing or other purposes, how is she to prove their authenticity?”
vi: “Thế thì tôi không hiểu nổi, thưa bệ hạ. Nếu cô gái muốn dùng những lá thư đó để tống tiền hoặc cho những mục đích nào khác, làm sao cô ta có thể chứng minh tính xác thực của chúng?”
tr: "O zaman Majesteleri'ni tam takip edemiyorum. Eğer bu genç kadın, mektuplarını şantaj veya başka amaçlar için kullanacaksa onların orijinal olduklarını nasıl ispat edebilir?
es: "Entonces no entiendo a su Majestad. Si esta joven presentara sus cartas para chantaje u otros fines, ¿cómo va a probar su autenticidad?"
vi_translation: "Then I can't understand, Your Majesty. If the girl wants to use those letters for blackmail or other purposes, how can she prove their authenticity?"
tr_translation: "In that case, I do not fully understand Your Majesty." "If this young woman is going to use her letters for blackmail or other purposes, how can she prove that they are original?""
es_translation: "Then I do not understand Your Majesty. If this young woman were to present her letters for blackmail or other purposes, how would she prove their authenticity?"

en: “He was in the house about half an hour, and I could catch glimpses of him in the windows of the sitting-room, pacing up and down, talking excitedly, and waving his arms. Of her I could see nothing. Presently he emerged, looking even more flurried than before. As he stepped up to the cab, he pulled a gold watch from his pocket and looked at it earnestly, ‘Drive like the devil,’ he shouted, ‘first to Gross & Hankey’s in Regent Street, and then to the Church of St. Monica in the Edgeware Road. Half a guinea if you do it in twenty minutes!’
vi: Anh ta ở trong nhà độ nửa giờ, và qua các cửa sổ phòng khách, tôi có thể thoáng thấy anh ta đi tới đi lui, nói liến thoắng và vung tay. Còn về cô ta, tôi chẳng thấy gì cả. Một lúc sau, anh ta ra ngoài, trông còn vội hơn trước. Khi bước lên xe, anh ta móc chiếc đồng hồ vàng trong túi ra và chăm chú xem giờ. ‘Phóng hết tốc lực đi,’ anh ta kêu to, ‘trước tiên hãy đến Gross & Hankey ở phố Regent, rồi sau đó tới nhà thờ St. Monica ở đường Edgeware. Thưởng nửa guinea nếu anh đến đó trong vòng hai mươi phút!
tr: "Eve gireli aşağı yukarı yarım saat olmuştu. Oturma odasının penceresinden onu görebiliyordum. Büyük adımlarla bir aşağı bir yukarı dolaşıyor, konuşurken de heyecan içinde ellerini kollarını sallıyordu. Kadını göremedim ama adam geldiğinden daha aceleci bir şekilde dışarı çıktı. Faytona binerken cebinden altın saatini çıkarıp baktı, ‘Çılgınlar gibi sür,' diye bağırdı, ‘önce Regent Sokağı'nda Gross ve Hankey Firması'na, sonra da Edgeware Yolu'ndaki St. Monica Kilisesi'ne. Yirmi dakikada gidersen bir altın alırsın, 'dedi.
es: "Estuvo en la casa alrededor de media hora, y pude verle en las ventanas del salón, caminando de un lado a otro, hablando con entusiasmo y agitando los brazos. De ella no pude ver nada. Al cabo de un rato salió, con un aspecto aún más nervioso que antes. Cuando se acercó al taxi, sacó un reloj de oro del bolsillo y lo miró seriamente. "Conduce a toda prisa -gritó-, primero a Gross & Hankey's en Regent Street, y luego a la iglesia de Santa Mónica en Edgeware Road. Media guinea si lo haces en veinte minutos".
vi_translation: He stayed in the house for about half an hour, and through the living room windows, I could catch glimpses of him pacing back and forth, talking rapidly and gesticulating. As for her, I didn't see anything at all. A while later, he came out, looking even more hurried than before. As he got into the car, he pulled a gold watch out of his pocket and checked the time intently. 'Drive at full speed,' he shouted, 'first to Gross & Hankey on Regent Street, then to St. Monica's Church on Edgeware Road. Half a guinea reward if you get there in twenty minutes!'
tr_translation: "It had been roughly half an hour since he arrived. I could see him from the window of the living room. He was pacing back and forth with large strides, waving his hands and arms excitedly as he talked. I couldn't see the woman, but the man came out more hurriedly than he had arrived. As he got into the carriage, he took out his gold watch from his pocket and looked at it, shouting, 'Drive like mad,' 'first to the firm of Gross and Hankey on Regent Street, then to St. Monica's Church on Edgeware Road.' 'If you get there in twenty minutes, you'll get a gold coin,' he said.
es_translation: "He was in the house for about half an hour, and I could see him in the living room windows, walking back and forth, talking enthusiastically and waving his arms. I couldn't see anything of her. After a while, he came out, looking even more nervous than before. When he approached the taxi, he took a gold watch out of his pocket and looked at it seriously. "Drive quickly," he shouted, "first to Gross & Hankey's on Regent Street, and then to St. Monica's Church on Edgeware Road. Half a guinea if you do it in twenty minutes."

en: “Away they went, and I was just wondering whether I should not do well to follow them when up the lane came a neat little landau, the coachman with his coat only half-buttoned, and his tie under his ear, while all the tags of his harness were sticking out of the buckles. It hadn’t pulled up before she shot out of the hall door and into it. I only caught a glimpse of her at the moment, but she was a lovely woman, with a face that a man might die for.
vi: Họ phóng ào đi, và khi tôi còn đang băn khoăn xem mình có nên đi theo họ không thì một chiếc xe ngựa bốn bánh mui gập xinh xắn phóng tới. Người xà ích mặc cái áo khoác mới cài cúc phân nửa, cà vạt thì vắt lên cổ, còn bộ yên ngựa cũng chưa đóng xong. Cỗ xe chưa kịp dừng thì cô Irene Adler đã chạy vụt ra từ cửa trước và chui vào xe. Chỉ kịp nhìn thoáng qua nhưng tôi cũng nhận thấy cô ta rất khả ái với khuôn mặt có thể khiến cánh đàn ông nguyện chết.
tr: "Gözden uzaklaştılar. Onları takip etsem mi diye düşünürken, evin önüne küçük bir fayton yanaştı. Ceketinin düğmeleri çözülmüş, kravatı kulağının arkasına düşmüş bir sürücüsü vardı.. Fayton evin önünde daha durmamıştı ki genç kadın dışarı fırladı. Arabaya binerken bir an için onu gördüm, bir erkeğin uğrunda ölebileceği kadar güzel yüzlü hoş bir kadındı.
es: "Se pusieron en marcha, y yo me preguntaba si no haría bien en seguirlos, cuando subió por la calle un pequeño y elegante landó (un tipo de coche de caballos), cuyo cochero llevaba el abrigo sólo a medio abrochar y la corbata bajo la oreja, mientras todas las etiquetas de su arnés sobresalían de las hebillas. No se había detenido antes de que ella saliera disparada por la puerta del vestíbulo y entrara en él. Sólo la vislumbré en ese momento, pero era una mujer encantadora, con un rostro por el que un hombre podría morir.
vi_translation: They dashed away, and while I was still wondering whether I should follow them, a cute four-wheeled horse-drawn carriage with a folding top sped up. The coachman was wearing a new coat buttoned halfway, with a tie draped over his neck, and the harness was not yet fully fastened. The carriage had barely stopped when Miss Irene Adler rushed out from the front door and jumped into the carriage. Though I only caught a glimpse, I could see that she was very charming, with a face that could make men willing to die for her.
tr_translation: "They disappeared from sight. As I was wondering whether to follow them, a small carriage pulled up in front of the house. Its driver had his jacket unbuttoned and his tie hanging behind his ear. The carriage had not yet come to a stop in front of the house when a young woman rushed out. For a moment, as she was getting into the carriage, I saw her; she was a beautiful woman with a face that a man could die for.
es_translation: "They set off, and I was wondering if it would be wise to follow them, when a small and elegant landau (a type of horse-drawn carriage) came up the street, whose coachman wore his coat only half-buttoned and his tie under his ear, while all the tags of his harness stuck out of the buckles. It had not stopped before she darted out of the lobby door and got into it. I only caught a glimpse of her at that moment, but she was a charming woman, with a face a man could die for.

en: “To do nothing whatever. There will probably be some small unpleasantness. Do not join in it. It will end in my being conveyed into the house. Four or five minutes afterwards the sitting-room window will open. You are to station yourself close to that open window.”
vi: “Không làm bất cứ điều gì. Có thể sẽ có một vụ ẩu đả nho nhỏ. Đừng can dự vào. Nó sẽ kết thúc khi tôi được đưa vào trong nhà. Bốn hay năm phút sau, cửa sổ phòng khách sẽ mở. Anh phải đứng gần đó.”
tr: "Hiçbir şey yapmayacaksın. Muhtemelen bazı küçük tatsızlıklar çıkacak. Sen müdahale etme. Tartışmanın sonunda beni eve sokacaklar. Dört beş dakika sonra oturma odasının penceresi açılacak. Sen tam pencerenin yakınında durup bekleyeceksin.
es: "No debes hacer nada. Probablemente habrá algún pequeño disgusto. No participes en él. Terminará cuando me lleven a la casa. Cuatro o cinco minutos después se abrirá la ventana del salón. Debes colocarte cerca de esa ventana abierta".
vi_translation: “Do not do anything. There might be a small scuffle. Do not get involved. It will end when I am taken inside the house. Four or five minutes later, the living room window will open. You must stand nearby.”
tr_translation: "You will do nothing. Probably some minor unpleasantness will arise. Do not intervene. At the end of the argument, they will let me into the house. Four or five minutes later, the living room window will open. You will stand and wait right near the window."
es_translation: "You must not do anything. There will probably be some small upset. Do not participate in it. It will end when they take me to the house. Four or five minutes later, the living room window will open. You must position yourself near that open window."

en: “And when I raise my hand—so—you will throw into the room what I give you to throw, and will, at the same time, raise the cry of fire. You quite follow me?”
vi: “Khi tôi giơ tay lên, anh sẽ ném vật mà tôi giao vào phòng và hô có cháy. Anh hiểu ý tôi chứ?”
tr: "Elimi yukarıya doğru kaldırdığım anda - aynen böyle – sana şimdi vereceğim şeyi pencereden içeri fırlatacaksın. Aynı anda ‘yangın var!' diye bağırmaya başlayacaksın. Sözlerimi takip edebildin mi?
es: "Y cuando yo levante la mano, arrojarás a la habitación lo que yo te dé para arrojar y, al mismo tiempo, lanzarás el grito de fuego. ¿Me sigues completamente?"
vi_translation: "When I raise my hand, you will throw the object I give you into the room and shout that there's a fire. Do you understand me?"
tr_translation: "The moment I raise my hand up - just like this - you will throw the thing I'm going to give you inside through the window. At the same time, you will start shouting 'fire!'. Did you follow my words?"
es_translation: "And when I raise my hand, you will throw into the room what I give you to throw, and at the same time, you will shout the word 'fire.' Do you follow me completely?"

en: There were several people on the pavement at the time, but the greeting appeared to come from a slim youth in an ulster who had hurried by.
vi: Khi anh đang lục túi tìm chìa khóa, bỗng có ai đó đi ngang qua và nói: “Chào ông Sherlock Holmes.” Lúc đó có vài người đang đứng trên vỉa hè, nhưng hình như nói lời chào đến từ một chàng trai mảnh dẻ mặc áo bành tô vừa rảo bước qua.
tr: Kaldırımda bir sürü insan vardı fakat bu ses, oradan hızla geçmekte olan bir genç ve zayıf bir adamdan geliyordu.
es: Había varias personas en la acera en ese momento, pero el saludo parecía provenir de un joven delgado con un ulster que se había apresurado a pasar.
vi_translation: At that moment, there were a few people standing on the sidewalk, but it seemed the greeting came from a slender young man in an overcoat who had just walked past.
tr_translation: There were a lot of people on the sidewalk, but this sound was coming from a young and thin man who was passing by quickly.
es_translation: There were several people on the sidewalk at that moment, but the greeting seemed to come from a slender young man in an ulster who had hurried past.

en: The stout gentleman half rose from his chair and gave a bob of greeting, with a quick little questioning glance from his small fat-encircled eyes.
vi: Người đàn ông hơi nhổm người dậy khỏi chiếc ghế, khẽ cúi đầu chào với vẻ dò hỏi thoáng xuất hiện qua cái liếc từ đôi mắt ti hí giữa những bọng mỡ.
tr: Ciddi görünüşlü adam oturduğu yerden yarı kalkarak belli belirsiz bir selam verdi ve şişkin göz kapaklarının çevrelediği küçük gözleriyle beni süzmeye başladı.
es: El corpulento caballero se levantó a medias de su silla y saludó con un movimiento de cabeza, con una rápida mirada interrogativa desde sus pequeños ojos rodeados de grasa.
vi_translation: The man slightly lifted himself from the chair, gently bowed his head in greeting with a questioning look briefly appearing through a glance from his small, beady eyes amidst the fat folds.
tr_translation: The serious-looking man gave a barely noticeable salute as he half rose from his seat and began to scrutinize me with his small eyes surrounded by puffy eyelids.
es_translation: The corpulent knight half-rose from his chair and greeted with a nod, casting a quick, questioning glance from his small eyes surrounded by fat.

en: “What else can be indicated by that right cuff so very shiny for five inches, and the left one with the smooth patch near the elbow where you rest it upon the desk?”
vi: “Tôi còn biết suy ra điều gì khác từ cổ tay áo bên phải bóng loáng khoảng năm inch còn bên tay trái thì có một mảng mòn nhẵn gần phía khuỷu tay chỗ ông tì lên bàn?”
tr: "Ceketinizin sağ ön kolu öylesine parlak ki, ayrıca sol kolunuzun dirseğe kadar olan kısmı dümdüz; demek ki kolunuzu devamlı masaya dayamışsınız.
es: "¿Qué otra cosa puede indicar ese puño derecho tan reluciente por cinco pulgadas, y el izquierdo con el parche liso cerca del codo donde lo apoyas sobre el escritorio?"
vi_translation: “What else can I deduce from the fact that the right cuff is shiny for about five inches while the left sleeve has a smooth worn patch near the elbow where you lean on the table?”
tr_translation: "The right front sleeve of your jacket is so shiny, and also the part of your left sleeve up to the elbow is completely flat; which means you have been constantly resting your arm on the table."
es_translation: "What else can that right fist so shiny for five inches indicate, and the left one with the smooth patch near the elbow where you rest it on the desk?"

en: “Why, indeed? You seem most fortunate in having an employé who comes under the full market price. It is not a common experience among employers in this age. I don’t know that your assistant is not as remarkable as your advertisement.”
vi: “Đúng vậy, cần gì phải thế? Có vẻ như ông là người vô cùng may mắn khi có được một employé[81] chấp nhận mức lương dưới giá thị trường. Khó mà tìm được nhân công như vậy vào thời buổi này. Theo tôi thấy thì người phụ tá của ông không đặc biệt bằng mẩu rao vặt.”
tr: "Sahiden neden yapasınız ki? Piyasa fiyatından daha düşük bir maaşa çalışan bir elemanınız olduğu için şanslısınız. Böyle ucuz işçi bulmak bugün için hiç de kolay değil. Şu sizin çırak da aynen şu ilan gibi ilginç geldi bana.
es: "¿Por qué, en efecto? Parece usted muy afortunado por tener un empleado que se encuentra por debajo del precio de mercado. No es una experiencia común entre los empresarios de esta época. No sé si su asistente no es tan notable como su anuncio".
vi_translation: “That's right, why bother? It seems that you are extremely lucky to have an employé[81] who accepts a salary below the market rate. It's hard to find such workers these days. In my opinion, your assistant is not as special as the advertisement suggests.”
tr_translation: "Why would you really do that? You are lucky to have an employee working for a salary lower than the market rate. Finding such cheap labor is not easy at all today. Your apprentice seemed just as interesting to me as this ad."
es_translation: "Why, indeed?" "You seem very fortunate to have an employee who is below the market price." "It is not a common experience among businessmen of this era." "I don't know if your assistant is not as remarkable as your advertisement."

en: “Yes, sir. He and a girl of fourteen, who does a bit of simple cooking and keeps the place clean—that’s all I have in the house, for I am a widower and never had any family. We live very quietly, sir, the three of us; and we keep a roof over our heads and pay our debts, if we do nothing more.
vi: “Vâng, đúng vậy. Anh ta và một cô bé mười bốn tuổi làm công việc nấu nướng và dọn dẹp nhà cửa - chỉ có bấy nhiêu người trong nhà vì tôi góa vợ và gia đình cũng không còn ai khác. Chúng tôi sống rất bình lặng, thưa ông, cả ba người; chúng tôi không làm gì ngoài việc giữ một mái nhà che nắng mưa và đủ tiền để thanh toán các khoản chi tiêu.
tr: "Evet, beyefendi. Bir o, bir de ara sıra yemek yapıp ortalığı temizleyen on dört yaşında bir kız. Evimdeki bütün insanlar bunlar. Ben dulum ve hiç çocuğum olmadı. Üçümüz sessiz sakin yaşayıp gidiyoruz; başımızı sokacak bir evimiz var; eh, borçlarımızı da ödeyebiliyoruz, bundan iyisi can sağlığı.
es: "Sí, señor. Él y una chica de catorce años, que hace un poco de cocina sencilla y mantiene el lugar limpio; eso es todo lo que tengo en la casa, pues soy viudo y nunca tuve familia. Vivimos muy tranquilos, señor, los tres; y mantenemos un techo sobre nuestras cabezas y pagamos nuestras deudas, si no hacemos nada más.
vi_translation: “Yes, that's right. He and a fourteen-year-old girl do the cooking and house cleaning - there are only that many people in the house because I am a widower and have no other family. We live very quietly, sir, all three of us; we do nothing but keep a roof over our heads and enough money to pay the expenses.
tr_translation: "Yes, sir. One is him, and the other is a fourteen-year-old girl who occasionally cooks and cleans. These are all the people in my house. I am a widower and have never had children. The three of us live quietly and peacefully; we have a roof over our heads; well, we can pay our debts, and that's all that matters.
es_translation: "Yes, sir." "Him and a fourteen-year-old girl, who does a bit of simple cooking and keeps the place clean; that's all I have in the house, as I am a widower and never had a family." "We live very quietly, sir, the three of us; and we keep a roof over our heads and pay our debts, if we do nothing else."

en: “‘Oh, at his new offices. He did tell me the address. Yes, 17 King Edward Street, near St. Paul’s.’
vi: ‘À, tại văn phòng mới của ông ta. Ông ta có cho tôi địa chỉ. Phải, số 17 phố King Edward, gần thánh đường St. Paul.
tr: " ‘Yeni bürosunda. Bana adresi vermişti. Evet, King Edward Sokağı 17 Numara,St. Paul civarı.
es: " Oh, en sus nuevas oficinas. Me dijo la dirección. Sí, el 17 de King Edward Street, cerca de St. Paul".
vi_translation: ‘Ah, at his new office. He gave me the address. Yes, 17 King Edward Street, near St. Paul's Cathedral.’
tr_translation: " 'In his new office. He had given me the address. Yes, Number 17 King Edward Street, near St. Paul.'
es_translation: "Oh, in their new offices. He told me the address. Yes, 17 King Edward Street, near St. Paul."

en: “To smoke,” he answered. “It is quite a three pipe problem, and I beg that you won’t speak to me for fifty minutes.” He curled himself up in his chair, with his thin knees drawn up to his hawk-like nose, and there he sat with his eyes closed and his black clay pipe thrusting out like the bill of some strange bird. I had come to the conclusion that he had dropped asleep, and indeed was nodding myself, when he suddenly sprang out of his chair with the gesture of a man who has made up his mind and put his pipe down upon the mantelpiece.
vi: “Hút thuốc”, anh trả lời. “Đây là một vấn đề cần tới ba tẩu thuốc, và xin anh đừng nói gì với tôi trong năm mươi phút.” Anh ngồi thu lu trên ghế, hai đầu gối gầy guộc nhô lên đến tận cái mũi diều hâu, mắt nhắm nghiền, cái tẩu bằng đất sét đen thò ra phía trước trông giống như cái mỏ của một loài chim kì lạ. Tôi ngỡ là anh đã ngủ thiếp đi và đến lượt mình, tôi cũng đang gà gật thì đột nhiên anh nhảy vọt ra khỏi ghế, vẻ như đã đi đến quyết định và đặt cái tẩu thuốc lên mặt lò sưởi.
tr: "Pipo içmeyi," diye cevap verdi. "Bu, en az üç pipoluk bir problem. Senden ricam, elli dakika boyunca ağzını açmaman." Ayaklarını sandalyeden çekti, ince dizlerini şahin gagasını andıran burnuna yaklaştırdı ve gözlerini kapatarak orada öylece oturdu. Ağzındaki siyah piposu garip bir kuşun gagası gibi duruyordu. Bir süre sonra, uyuyakaldığını düşünmeye başlamıştım ki birden sandalyesinden fırladı; kesin bir karara varmış gibiydi. Piposunu şöminenin üstüne koyarak konuşmaya başladı:
es: "Fumar", respondió. "Es un problema de tres pipas, y le ruego que no me hable durante cincuenta minutos". Se acurrucó en su silla, con sus delgadas rodillas recogidas hasta su nariz de halcón, y allí se sentó con los ojos cerrados y su pipa de arcilla negra sobresaliendo como el pico de un extraño pájaro. Yo había llegado a la conclusión de que se había quedado dormido y, de hecho, yo mismo estaba cabeceando, cuando de repente se levantó de la silla con el gesto de un hombre que ha tomado una decisión y dejó la pipa sobre la repisa de la chimenea.
vi_translation: “Smoking,” he replied. “This is a three-pipe problem, and please don't speak to me for fifty minutes.” He curled up in his chair, his bony knees drawn up to his hawk-like nose, eyes closed, with a black clay pipe jutting out like the beak of some strange bird. I thought he had fallen asleep, and I was dozing off myself when suddenly he sprang out of his chair, seeming to have reached a decision, and placed the pipe on the mantelpiece.
tr_translation: "Don't smoke the pipe," he replied. "This is at least a three-pipe problem. My request to you is not to open your mouth for fifty minutes." He drew his feet from the chair, brought his thin knees close to his nose that resembled a hawk's beak, and sat there with his eyes closed. The black pipe in his mouth looked like the beak of a strange bird. After a while, just as I began to think he had fallen asleep, he suddenly sprang from his chair; he seemed to have reached a definite conclusion. Placing his pipe on the mantelpiece, he began to speak:
es_translation: "To smoke," he replied. "It is a three-pipe problem, and I beg you not to speak to me for fifty minutes." He curled up in his chair, with his thin knees drawn up to his hawk-like nose, and there he sat with his eyes closed and his black clay pipe sticking out like the beak of a strange bird. I had concluded that he had fallen asleep and, in fact, I was nodding off myself when he suddenly sprang out of his chair with the gesture of a man who has made a decision and placed the pipe on the mantelpiece.

en: “Then put on your hat and come. I am going through the City first, and we can have some lunch on the way. I observe that there is a good deal of German music on the programme, which is rather more to my taste than Italian or French. It is introspective, and I want to introspect. Come along!”
vi: “Thế thì đội mũ vào và đi thôi. Ta sẽ ra khu City trước và ăn trưa trên đường đi. Tôi thấy tờ chương trình thông báo là sẽ có nhiều tiết mục âm nhạc Đức vốn hợp với sở thích của tôi hơn là nhạc Ý hay Pháp. Loại nhạc này mang tính nội tâm và tôi đang muốn xem xét nội tâm đây. Lên đường thôi!”
tr: "O halde şapkanı alıp benimle gel. Önce şehir merkezine gideceğim, yolda öğlen yemeği yiyebiliriz. Bugünkü programda Alman müziği var, bunu İtalyan veya Fransız müziğine tercih ettiğimi bilirsin. O müziği dinlerken, insan içine kapanıveriyor, benim de şu sırada buna ihtiyacım var. Gidelim!
es: "Entonces póngase el sombrero y venga. Voy a pasar primero por la ciudad y podemos almorzar por el camino. Observo que hay mucha música alemana en el programa, que es más de mi gusto que la italiana o la francesa. Es introspectiva, y yo quiero introspección. Acompáñame".
vi_translation: "Then put on your hat and let's go. We'll head to the City area first and have lunch on the way. I saw the program announcement stating that there will be many German musical performances, which align more with my preferences than Italian or French music. This type of music is introspective, and I'm in the mood for some introspection. Let's hit the road!"
tr_translation: "Then take your hat and come with me. First, I will go to the city center, we can have lunch on the way. Today's program features German music, you know I prefer it over Italian or French music. When listening to that music, one becomes introspective, and I need that right now. Let's go!"
es_translation: "Then put on your hat and come along. I'm going to pass through the city first and we can have lunch on the way. I notice that there is a lot of German music in the program, which I prefer over Italian or French music. It's introspective, and I want introspection. Accompany me."

en: The road in which we found ourselves as we turned round the corner from the retired Saxe-Coburg Square presented as great a contrast to it as the front of a picture does to the back. It was one of the main arteries which conveyed the traffic of the City to the north and west. The roadway was blocked with the immense stream of commerce flowing in a double tide inward and outward, while the footpaths were black with the hurrying swarm of pedestrians. It was difficult to realise as we looked at the line of fine shops and stately business premises that they really abutted on the other side upon the faded and stagnant square which we had just quitted.
vi: Con đường mà chúng tôi đến sau khi rẽ ngoặt lại ở góc khu quảng trường Saxe Coburg vắng lặng lại bày ra một sự tương phản to lớn như là mặt trước và sau của một bức tranh. Đó là một trong những nhánh giao thông chính nối khu City với khu vực phía bắc và phía tây. Lòng đường kín đặc bởi một dòng chuyển động khổng lồ đang chảy theo hai chiều vào và ra, còn lối đi bộ thì đen nghịt những đám khách bộ hành đang vội vã bước. Khó mà hình dung được con đường có những cửa hiệu đẹp đẽ và những tòa văn phòng uy nghi nơi chúng tôi đang nhìn thấy lại là mặt sau của cái quảng trưởng ảm đạm mà chúng tôi vừa mới rời khỏi.
tr: Saxe-Coburg Meydanı'ndan köşeyi döndükten sonra karşılaştığımız görüntü, bir resmin ön yüzüyle arka yüzü arasındaki fark kadar dikkat çekiciydi. Şehir merkezinin trafiğini kuzeye ve batıya bağlayan ana caddelerden birinin üzerindeydik şimdi. Çevredeki ticaret merkezleri, gelip gideniyle sürekli bir hareket halindeydi ve kaldırımlar, koşuşturan yayaların ayak izlerinden kapkara olmuştu. Gösterişli dükkânların oluşturduğu sıraya ve büyük iş hanlarına bakarak bunların arka tarafına düşen sokağın, demin ayrıldığımız solgun ve hareketsiz yer olduğuna inanmak güçtü.
es: La calle en la que nos encontrábamos al doblar la esquina de la retirada Saxe-Coburg Square presentaba un contraste tan grande con ella como el frente de un cuadro con el fondo. Era una de las principales arterias que conducían el tráfico de la ciudad hacia el norte y el oeste. La calzada estaba bloqueada por la inmensa corriente de comercio que fluía en una doble marea hacia el interior y el exterior, mientras que las aceras estaban ennegrecidas por el apresurado enjambre de peatones. Resultaba difícil darse cuenta, al contemplar la hilera de tiendas elegantes y locales comerciales majestuosos, de que realmente colindaban al otro lado con la plaza descolorida y estancada que acabábamos de abandonar.
vi_translation: The road we arrived at after turning at the corner of Saxe Coburg Square presented a stark contrast, like the front and back of a painting. It is one of the main traffic arteries connecting the City with the northern and western areas. The roadway was packed with a massive flow of traffic moving in both directions, while the sidewalks were crowded with hurried pedestrians. It was hard to imagine that the street with its beautiful shops and imposing office buildings we were looking at was the back of the dreary square we had just left.
tr_translation: The scene we encountered after turning the corner from Saxe-Coburg Square was as striking as the difference between the front and back of a painting. We were now on one of the main streets connecting the city's traffic to the north and west. The surrounding commercial centers were in constant motion with people coming and going, and the sidewalks had turned black from the footprints of rushing pedestrians. Looking at the row of flashy shops and large office buildings, it was hard to believe that the street behind them was the pale and motionless place we had just left.
es_translation: The street we found ourselves on after turning the corner from the secluded Saxe-Coburg Square presented as stark a contrast with it as the front of a painting with the background. It was one of the main arteries that directed city traffic towards the north and west. The roadway was blocked by the immense flow of commerce that surged in a double tide inward and outward, while the sidewalks were darkened by the hurried swarm of pedestrians. It was difficult to realize, upon contemplating the row of elegant shops and majestic commercial establishments, that they actually bordered on the other side with the faded and stagnant square we had just left.

en: At first it was but a lurid spark upon the stone pavement. Then it lengthened out until it became a yellow line, and then, without any warning or sound, a gash seemed to open and a hand appeared, a white, almost womanly hand, which felt about in the centre of the little area of light. For a minute or more the hand, with its writhing fingers, protruded out of the floor. Then it was withdrawn as suddenly as it appeared, and all was dark again save the single lurid spark which marked a chink between the stones.
vi: Lúc đầu đó chỉ là một đốm sáng nhợt nhạt ló ra trên nền đá. Dần dần nó kéo dài ra đến khi trở thành một vệt màu vàng, và rồi bất thình lình, không hề có một dấu hiệu hay tiếng động nào báo trước, một vết cắt mở ra và xuất hiện một bàn tay trắng trẻo, gần giống như tay phụ nữ, đang sờ soạng ở chính giữa vùng sáng hẹp. Trong khoảng một phút hay hơn, bàn tay đó chậm rãi cử động, thò ra khỏi sàn nhà. Rồi nó chợt rút về cũng đột ngột như khi xuất hiện, tất cả tối sầm trở lại, chỉ trừ đốm sáng nhợt nhạt đơn độc đánh dấu một khe hở giữa những viên đá.
tr: İlk başta döşemenin taşına yansıyan parlak bir leke şeklindeydi, sonra gittikçe uzayarak sarı bir çizgi haline geldi. O anda döşemenin taşları usulca yarıldı ve aralarından bir el çıkıverdi. Işığın aydınlattığı döşemeye parmaklarıyla dokunan, kadın elini andıran beyazlıkta bir eldi bu. Bir dakika, belki bir dakikadan da fazla bir süre çarpık parmaklarıyla eli dışarı uzanıverdi. Sonra ortaya çıktığı gibi hızla gözden kayboldu.
es: Al principio no era más que una chispa escabrosa sobre el pavimento de piedra. Luego se alargó hasta convertirse en una línea amarilla, y entonces, sin ninguna advertencia ni sonido, pareció abrirse un corte y apareció una mano, una mano blanca, casi femenina, que palpó en el centro de la pequeña zona de luz. Durante un minuto o más, la mano, con sus dedos retorcidos, sobresalió del suelo. Luego se retiró tan súbitamente como había aparecido, y todo volvió a estar oscuro, salvo la única chispa escurridiza que marcaba un resquicio entre las piedras.
vi_translation: At first, it was just a pale spot of light emerging on the stone surface. Gradually, it extended until it became a streak of yellow, and then suddenly, without any sign or sound of warning, a cut opened up and a fair hand, almost like a woman's hand, appeared, groping in the middle of the narrow light. For about a minute or more, that hand moved slowly, protruding from the floor. Then it suddenly withdrew as abruptly as it had appeared, everything went dark again, except for the solitary pale spot marking a gap between the stones.
tr_translation: At first, it was like a bright spot reflected on the stone of the floor, then it gradually elongated into a yellow line. At that moment, the stones of the floor gently split apart and a hand emerged from between them. It was a hand, white like a woman's hand, touching the floor illuminated by the light with its fingers. For a minute, maybe more than a minute, the hand with crooked fingers extended outward. Then, just as it had appeared, it quickly vanished from sight.
es_translation: At first, it was nothing more than a rough spark on the stone pavement. Then it stretched into a yellow line, and then, without any warning or sound, it seemed to open a cut and a hand appeared, a white hand, almost feminine, that groped in the center of the small area of light. For a minute or more, the hand, with its twisted fingers, protruded from the ground. Then it withdrew as suddenly as it had appeared, and everything returned to darkness, except for the single elusive spark that marked a crack between the stones.

en: Its disappearance, however, was but momentary. With a rending, tearing sound, one of the broad, white stones turned over upon its side and left a square, gaping hole, through which streamed the light of a lantern. Over the edge there peeped a clean-cut, boyish face, which looked keenly about it, and then, with a hand on either side of the aperture, drew itself shoulder-high and waist-high, until one knee rested upon the edge. In another instant he stood at the side of the hole and was hauling after him a companion, lithe and small like himself, with a pale face and a shock of very red hair.
vi: Tuy vậy, bàn tay chỉ biến mất trong thoáng chốc. Một tiếng động mạnh và sắc vang lên, một trong những tảng đá trắng to rộng bị lật sang bên để lộ ra một lỗ hình vuông, qua đó hắt lên ánh sáng của một ngọn đèn. Qua mép hố, một khuôn mặt sáng sủa và trẻ trung như một thiếu niên nhô lên, khuôn mặt đó quan sát chung quanh với cái nhìn sắc bén, rồi gã bám một bàn tay vào mép hố và tự nâng mình lên. Bắt đầu là hai vai và hông đến khi đặt được một đầu gối lên mép hố. Chỉ một khoảnh khắc hắn đã đứng lên bên miệng hố và kéo theo sau một đồng bọn, cũng mảnh mai và nhỏ nhắn giống như hắn, mặt nhợt nhạt và đầu tóc bù xù đỏ rực.
tr: Sonra ortaya çıktığı gibi hızla gözden kayboldu. Taşların arasından sızan donuk ışığın dışında yine karanlığa gömülmüştük. Fakat çok geçmeden, beyaz taşlardan biri, gıcırtılı bir sesle yana doğru kaydırıldı; dört köşeli bir delik ortaya çıktı ve bu delikten bir fener ışığı sızmaya başladı. Aradaki boşluktan, küstah bakışlı, genç bir erkek yüzü çıktı ve çevresine dikkatle baktıktan sonra kendini yukarı çekti. Deliğin her iki tarafından önce birer el, sonra omuzlar, kalça ve dizler göründü. Adam hemen deliğin başında durarak bir eliyle aşağıdan yardımcısını çekti çıkardı; o da kendi gibi esnek ve kısa boyluydu, soluk bir yüzü ve kıpkızıl saçları vardı.
es: Su desaparición, sin embargo, fue momentánea. Con un sonido desgarrador, una de las anchas y blancas piedras se volcó sobre su lado y dejó un agujero cuadrado y abierto, a través del cual fluía la luz de una linterna. Por encima del borde se asomó un rostro limpio y juvenil, que miró atentamente a su alrededor y luego, con una mano a cada lado de la abertura, se acercó a la altura de los hombros y de la cintura, hasta que una rodilla se apoyó en el borde. En otro instante se situó al lado del agujero y arrastró tras de sí a un compañero, ágil y pequeño como él, con la cara pálida y un mechón de pelo muy rojo.
vi_translation: However, the hand disappeared only for a moment. A sharp, loud noise rang out, one of the large white stones was flipped aside to reveal a square hole, through which the light of a lamp shone. Over the edge of the hole, a bright and youthful face like that of a teenager emerged, that face surveyed the surroundings with a sharp gaze, then he grasped the edge of the hole with one hand and lifted himself up. First his shoulders and hips, until he placed one knee on the edge of the hole. In just a moment, he stood up at the edge of the hole and pulled up a companion after him, also slender and small like him, with a pale face and a shock of bright red hair.
tr_translation: Then, just as it had appeared, it quickly vanished from sight. We were once again plunged into darkness, except for the dull light seeping through the stones. But soon, one of the white stones was slid aside with a creaky sound; a square hole appeared, and light from a lantern began to seep through this hole. From the gap, a young man's face with a haughty look emerged and, after carefully looking around, he pulled himself up. From both sides of the hole, first a hand, then shoulders, hips, and knees appeared. The man immediately stood at the edge of the hole and pulled his assistant up with one hand; he was also flexible and short like himself, with a pale face and bright red hair.
es_translation: His disappearance, however, was momentary. With a tearing sound, one of the wide, white stones tipped over on its side and left a square, open hole, through which the light of a lantern flowed. Above the edge appeared a clean and youthful face, which looked around attentively and then, with a hand on each side of the opening, pulled itself up to shoulder and waist height, until a knee rested on the edge. In another instant, he was beside the hole and dragged up a companion, agile and small like him, with a pale face and a tuft of very red hair.

en: “So I see,” the other answered with the utmost coolness. “I fancy that my pal is all right, though I see you have got his coat-tails.”
vi: “Tôi cũng thấy vậy”, gã kia vô cùng bình tĩnh đáp trả. “Tôi cho rằng bạn của tôi đã thoát rồi, cho dù ông đã chộp được vạt áo sau của hắn.”
tr: "Görüyorum," diye cevap verdi adam tam bir kayıtsızlık içinde. "Ama anladığım kadarıyla arkadaşım yakayı kurtarmış. Kaçarken ceketini size hatıra bıraktı galiba.
es: "Ya veo", respondió el otro con la mayor frialdad. "Me imagino que mi amigo está bien, aunque veo que tú le has cogido el tranquillo".
vi_translation: “I think so too,” the other guy responded very calmly. “I believe my friend has escaped, even though you managed to grab the back of his shirt.”
tr_translation: "I see," the man replied with complete indifference. "But as far as I understand, my friend has escaped. It seems he left his jacket as a souvenir for you while fleeing."
es_translation: "I see," replied the other with the utmost coldness. "I imagine my friend is fine, although I see that you have gotten the hang of it."

en: “So far I had got when we went to visit the scene of action. I surprised you by beating upon the pavement with my stick. I was ascertaining whether the cellar stretched out in front or behind. It was not in front. Then I rang the bell, and, as I hoped, the assistant answered it. We have had some skirmishes, but we had never set eyes upon each other before. I hardly looked at his face. His knees were what I wished to see. You must yourself have remarked how worn, wrinkled, and stained they were. They spoke of those hours of burrowing. The only remaining point was what they were burrowing for. I walked round the corner, saw the City and Suburban Bank abutted on our friend’s premises, and felt that I had solved my problem. When you drove home after the concert I called upon Scotland Yard and upon the chairman of the bank directors, with the result that you have seen.”
vi: Tôi suy ra đến đó khi chúng ta đến xem hiện trường. Tôi khiến anh ngạc nhiên khi dùng gậy gõ lên lề đường. Tôi phải xác định xem căn hầm trổ ra phía trước hay phía sau căn nhà. Nó không trổ ra trước. Thế rồi tôi bấm chuông, đúng như tôi hi vọng, gã phụ tá ra mở cửa. Trước đó, chúng tôi đã đụng độ nhau mấy lần, nhưng cả hai đều chưa từng nhìn tận mặt nhau. Tôi hầu như không nhìn vào mặt hắn. Cái tôi cần quan sát chính là hai đầu gối của hắn. Chắc là anh trông thấy tận mắt đầu gối quần của hắn xơ mòn, nhăn nhúm và lấm bẩn như thế nào. Điều đó chứng minh công việc đào bới kéo dài hàng giờ. Điểm duy nhất còn lại là chúng đào như thế để làm gì. Tôi bước vòng qua góc đường và nhìn thấy chi nhánh Nhà băng City & Suburban giáp với căn nhà của ông bạn chúng ta, và cảm thấy là mình đã tìm được lời giải. Khi anh trở về nhà sau buổi hòa nhạc, tôi yêu cầu Sở Cảnh sát London hỗ trợ và mời ông chủ tịch hội đồng quản trị của nhà băng, và kết quả là như anh đã thấy.”
tr: "Seninle olay yerine gittiğimizde buraya kadarını biliyordum. Bastonumla kaldırıma vurunca sen şaşırmıştın.. Mahzenin öne mi yoksa arkaya doğru mu genişletildiğini öğrenmek için yaptım bunu. Öne doğru değildi. Sonra zili çaldım ve tam beklediğim gibi, kapıyı çırak açtı. Daha önce de birkaç kez karşıma çıkmıştı ama hiç göz göze gelmemiştik. Yüzüne pek bakmadım bile. Görmek istediğim dizleriydi. Ne kadar yıpranmış, kırışmış ve lekeli olduklarını sen de fark etmişsindir herhalde. Bu hali, saatler süren köstebekliğini gösteriyordu. Geriye tek bir soru kalmıştı, bunu ne için yaptıkları. Köşeyi döndüğümde City and Suburban Bankası'nın dostumuzun eviyle sırt sırta olduğunu gördüm. Artık problemi çözdüğümden emindim. Sen konserden eve dönerken, ben hem Scotland Yard'ı hem de banka müdürünü aradım; sonrasında neler olduğunu biliyorsun.
es: "Hasta aquí había llegado cuando fuimos a visitar el lugar de la acción. Te sorprendí golpeando el pavimento con mi bastón. Estaba averiguando si el sótano se extendía por delante o por detrás. No estaba delante. Entonces toqué el timbre y, como esperaba, el ayudante respondió. Habíamos tenido algunas escaramuzas, pero nunca nos habíamos visto antes. Apenas le miré a la cara. Sus rodillas eran lo que deseaba ver. Usted mismo habrá observado lo gastadas, arrugadas y manchadas que estaban. Hablaban de aquellas horas de excavación. Lo único que faltaba era saber para qué escarbaban. Doblé la esquina, vi que el City and Suburban Bank colindaba con los locales de nuestro amigo, y sentí que había resuelto mi problema. Cuando volviste a casa después del concierto, llamé a Scotland Yard y al presidente de los directores del banco, con el resultado que has visto".
vi_translation: I deduced that when we went to inspect the scene. I surprised him by tapping the curb with a stick. I had to determine whether the cellar opened out to the front or the back of the house. It did not open to the front. Then I rang the bell, and as I had hoped, the assistant came to open the door. Before that, we had encountered each other a few times, but neither of us had ever seen the other's face clearly. I barely looked at his face. What I needed to observe were his knees. Surely you saw with your own eyes how worn, wrinkled, and dirty the knees of his trousers were. That proved the digging work lasted for hours. The only remaining point was why they were digging like that. I walked around the corner and saw the City & Suburban Bank branch adjacent to our friend's house, and I felt I had found the answer. When you returned home after the concert, I requested assistance from the London Police Department and invited the chairman of the bank's board of directors, and the result is as you have seen.”
tr_translation: "When we went to the scene together, I knew this much. You were surprised when I struck the pavement with my cane. I did this to find out whether the cellar had been extended forward or backward. It wasn't extended forward. Then I rang the bell and, just as I expected, the door was opened by the apprentice. He had come across my path a few times before, but we had never made eye contact. I barely looked at his face. What I wanted to see were his knees. You must have noticed how worn, wrinkled, and stained they were. This condition indicated his hours of mole-like activity. Only one question remained, what they were doing this for. When I turned the corner, I saw that the City and Suburban Bank backed onto our friend's house. I was now sure I had solved the problem. While you were returning home from the concert, I contacted both Scotland Yard and the bank manager; you know what happened next."
es_translation: "I had gotten this far when we went to visit the scene of the action. I caught you tapping the pavement with my cane. I was trying to find out if the basement extended to the front or the back. It was not in the front. Then I rang the bell and, as I expected, the assistant answered. We had had some skirmishes, but we had never seen each other before. I barely looked at his face. It was his knees that I wanted to see. You yourself must have noticed how worn, wrinkled, and stained they were. They spoke of those hours of digging. The only thing left to find out was what they were digging for. I turned the corner, saw that the City and Suburban Bank adjoined our friend's premises, and felt that I had solved my problem. When you returned home after the concert, I called Scotland Yard and the president of the bank's directors, with the result you have seen."

en: “It was from the reigning family of Holland, though the matter in which I served them was of such delicacy that I cannot confide it even to you, who have been good enough to chronicle one or two of my little problems.”
vi: “Đó là do hoàng tộc Hà Lan ban thưởng, nhưng vụ việc mà tôi giúp đỡ họ vô cùng tế nhị khiến tôi không thể tiết lộ, ngay cả với anh, người đã tử tế ghi chép lại một vài vụ án của tôi.”
tr: "O, Hollanda kraliyet ailesinden. Fakat çok hassas bir mesele olduğu için bir iki vakamı kayda geçme iyiliğinde bulunmuş sana bile anlatamam.
es: "Era de la familia reinante de Holanda, aunque el asunto en el que les serví era de tal delicadeza que no puedo confiárselo ni siquiera a usted, que ha tenido la bondad de hacer la crónica de uno o dos de mis pequeños problemas".
vi_translation: “That was bestowed by the Dutch royal family, but the matter in which I assisted them is so delicate that I cannot disclose it, even to you, who have kindly documented some of my cases.”
tr_translation: "Oh, from the Dutch royal family. But because it is a very delicate matter, I cannot even tell you, though I have recorded a couple of my cases."
es_translation: "He was from the reigning family of Holland, although the matter in which I served them was of such delicacy that I cannot confide it even to you, who have kindly chronicled one or two of my little problems."

en: “Well, you know father didn’t like anything of the sort. He wouldn’t have any visitors if he could help it, and he used to say that a woman should be happy in her own family circle. But then, as I used to say to mother, a woman wants her own circle to begin with, and I had not got mine yet.”
vi: “Vâng, thì ông cũng biết là cha tôi không thích những chuyện như thế mà. Nếu có thể tránh được thì ông ta sẽ chẳng mời khách khứa gì cả, và ông ta thường nói là phụ nữ nên hài lòng với cuộc sống trong phạm vi gia đình của mình. Nhưng mặt khác, như tôi vẫn thường nói với mẹ tôi, muốn thế thì phụ nữ phải có gia đình riêng đã chứ, thế mà đến giờ tôi vẫn chưa có.”
tr: "Şey, babam böyle şeylerden hoşlanmaz. Elinden gelse hiç ziyaretçi kabul etmeyecek. Bir kadının kendi aile çevresi içinde mutlu olması gerektiğini söyler hep. Oysa anneme de hep dediğim gibi, bence bir kadın kendi çevresini oluşturmalı. Benin de henüz çevrem olmayınca...
es: "Bueno, usted sabe que a padre no le gustaba nada de eso. No quería recibir visitas si podía evitarlo, y solía decir que una mujer debía ser feliz en su propio círculo familiar. Pero entonces, como yo le solía decirle a mi madre, una mujer quiere su propio círculo para poder empezar, y yo todavía no había conseguido el mío."
vi_translation: “Well, you know that my father doesn't like such things. If he could avoid it, he wouldn't invite any guests at all, and he often says that women should be content with life within their own family. But on the other hand, as I often tell my mother, for that to happen, women need to have their own family first, and I still don't have one yet.”
tr_translation: "Well, my father doesn't like such things. If he could, he wouldn't accept any visitors at all. He always says that a woman should be happy within her own family circle. However, as I always tell my mother, I think a woman should create her own circle. Since I don't have my own circle yet..."
es_translation: "Well, you know that father didn't like any of that. He didn't want to receive visitors if he could avoid it, and he used to say that a woman should be happy in her own family circle. But then, as I used to tell my mother, a woman wants her own circle to be able to start, and I still hadn't gotten mine."

en: “Oh, no, sir! He was too good and kind to leave me so. Why, all the morning he was saying to me that, whatever happened, I was to be true; and that even if something quite unforeseen occurred to separate us, I was always to remember that I was pledged to him, and that he would claim his pledge sooner or later. It seemed strange talk for a wedding-morning, but what has happened since gives a meaning to it.”
vi: “Ồ, không đâu, thưa ông! Anh ấy quá tốt và tử tế nên sẽ không bỏ rơi tôi như vậy đâu. Tại sao ư? Suốt buổi sáng hôm đó, anh ấy cứ luôn miệng bảo tôi rằng, nếu có điều gì xảy ra thì tôi phải luôn chung thủy với anh ấy; và nếu có chuyện gì bất ngờ chia rẽ hai chúng tôi thì tôi hãy luôn nhớ rằng tôi đã thề nguyền với anh ấy, và trước sau gì anh ấy cũng sẽ cùng tôi thực hiện lời thề. Nói chuyện như thế vào buổi sáng ngày cưới thì có vẻ kì lạ quá, nhưng những gì xảy ra sau đó đã đem lại cho chuyện đó một vài ý nghĩa.”
tr: "Ah hayır bayım! Beni böyle ortada bırakamayacak kadar iyi ve nazik bir insandı. Bütün sabah boyunca, ne olursa olsun ona sadık kalmam gerektiğini söyleyip durmuştu. Bizi ayıracak beklenmedik bir şey olsa bile yemin ettiğimizi, bu yemini hiç unutmamamı ve kendisinin er ya da geç bu yemini yerine getireceğini söylemişti. Düğün sabahı için garip konuşmalardı ama sonrasında olanlar bu konuşmaların anlamlı olduğunu gösteriyor.
es: "¡Oh, no, señor! Era demasiado bueno y amable para dejarme así. Durante toda la mañana me dijo que, pasara lo que pasara, yo debía ser fiel; y que aunque ocurriera algo imprevisto que nos separara, yo debía recordar siempre que estaba comprometida con él, y que él reclamaría su compromiso tarde o temprano. Parecía un discurso extraño para una mañana de bodas, pero lo que ha sucedido desde entonces le da un significado".
vi_translation: "Oh, no, sir! He is too good and kind to abandon me like that." "Why? All that morning, he kept telling me that if anything happened, I must always be faithful to him; and if something unexpectedly separated us, I should always remember that I had vowed to him, and eventually, he would fulfill that vow with me." "Talking like that on the morning of the wedding seems strange, but what happened afterward gave it some meaning."
tr_translation: "Oh no, sir! He was too good and kind a person to leave me in the lurch like this. All morning long, he kept telling me that no matter what, I had to stay loyal to him. He said that even if something unexpected were to separate us, I should never forget the vow we made, and that he would fulfill this vow sooner or later. They were strange words for the morning of the wedding, but what happened afterward shows that these words were meaningful."
es_translation: "Oh, no, sir! He was too good and kind to leave me like this. All morning he told me that, no matter what happened, I must be faithful; and that even if something unforeseen occurred that separated us, I should always remember that I was committed to him, and that he would claim his commitment sooner or later. It seemed like a strange speech for a wedding morning, but what has happened since then gives it meaning."

en: “Quite an interesting study, that maiden,” he observed. “I found her more interesting than her little problem, which, by the way, is rather a trite one. You will find parallel cases, if you consult my index, in Andover in ’77, and there was something of the sort at The Hague last year. Old as is the idea, however, there were one or two details which were new to me. But the maiden herself was most instructive.”
vi: “Cô gái này quả là một trường hợp nghiên cứu rất lí thú”, anh nhận xét. “Tôi thấy bản thân cô ta còn thú vị hơn cái vấn đề nhỏ nhặt của cô ta, mà nhân đây tôi xin nói luôn là cái vấn đề đó đã cũ rích rồi. Anh sẽ thấy nhiều trường hợp tương tự nếu anh tra cứu trong cuốn danh mục của tôi, ở Andover vào năm 1877 và một chuyện kiểu như vậy ở thành phố Hague của Hà Lan hồi năm ngoái. Ý tưởng thì cũ lắm rồi, tuy nhiên vẫn có một vài chi tiết mới mẻ đối với tôi. Thế nhưng điều đáng học hỏi nhất chính là bản thân cô ta.”
tr: "Hayli ilginç bir çalışma olacak bu," diye söze girdi. "Kızın kendisi, önemsiz küçük sorunundan daha ilginç.
