Fihristime bakarsan, 1977'de Andover'de ve geçen yıl da Lahey'de buna benzer vakaların yaşandığını görürsün. Esasında fikir eski olmasına rağmen benim için tamamen yeni bir iki ayrıntı var. Kızın kendisi yeteri kadar bilgi verdi.
es: "Un estudio bastante interesante, el de esa joven", observó. "La encontré más interesante que su pequeño problema, que, por cierto, es bastante trivial. Encontrará casos paralelos, si consulta mi índice, en Andover en el 77, y hubo algo parecido en La Haya el año pasado. Sin embargo, por muy antigua que sea la idea, había uno o dos detalles que eran nuevos para mí. Pero la propia doncella fue muy instructiva".
vi_translation: “This girl is indeed a very interesting case study,” he remarked. “I find her more intriguing than her trivial problem, which I must say is already quite old. You will find many similar cases if you look through my catalog, in Andover in 1877 and a similar incident in The Hague, Netherlands, last year. The idea is very old, but there are still a few details that are new to me. However, the most valuable thing to learn is herself.”
tr_translation: "This is going to be quite an interesting study," he began. "The girl herself is more interesting than her insignificant little problem. If you look at my index, you'll see that similar cases occurred in Andover in 1977 and in The Hague last year. Although the idea is old, there are a couple of details that are completely new to me. The girl herself provided enough information."
es_translation: "A rather interesting study, that of the young woman," he observed. "I found her more interesting than her little problem, which, by the way, is quite trivial. You will find parallel cases, if you consult my index, in Andover in '77, and there was something similar in The Hague last year. However, no matter how old the idea is, there were one or two details that were new to me. But the maid herself was very instructive."

en: “How is the glass? Twenty-nine, I see. No wind, and not a cloud in the sky. I have a caseful of cigarettes here which need smoking, and the sofa is very much superior to the usual country hotel abomination. I do not think that it is probable that I shall use the carriage to-night.”
vi: “Hôm nay phong vũ biểu chỉ bao nhiêu? Tôi thấy là hai mươi chín[98]. Trời lặng gió và cũng chẳng có một đám mây. Ở đây, tôi có một hộp thuốc lá đầy ắp đang cần người hút và một cái ghế dài vô cùng thoải mái so với một khách sạn nông thôn tầm thường. Tôi không nghĩ là mình cần đổi một cỗ xe ngựa vào tối nay.”
tr: "Barometre ne diyormuş bakalım? Hım, yirmi dokuz. Havada ne bulut, ne de rüzgâr var. Cebimde keyifle içilecek bir paket sigara var ve şu kanepe alışıldık kır pansiyonlarındaki ufacık divanlardan daha geniş ve rahat. Bu gece arabanıza ihtiyacım olmayacak.
es: " ¿Qué tal está el vaso? Veintinueve, por lo que veo. No hay viento ni una nube en el cielo. Tengo aquí una caja de cigarrillos que hay que fumar, y el sofá es muy superior a la habitual abominación de los hoteles de campo. No creo que sea probable que utilice el carruaje esta noche".
vi_translation: “What does the barometer read today?” “I see it is twenty-nine[98].” “The sky is calm and there isn’t a single cloud.” “Here, I have a box of cigarettes full and in need of a smoker, and a bench that is extremely comfortable compared to an ordinary country hotel.” “I don't think I need to trade for a carriage tonight.”
tr_translation: "What does the barometer say, let's see? Hmm, twenty-nine. There is neither cloud nor wind in the air. There is a pack of cigarettes in my pocket to be enjoyed, and this couch is wider and more comfortable than the tiny sofas in usual country inns. I won't need your car tonight."
es_translation: "How is the glass? Twenty-nine, from what I see. There is no wind nor a cloud in the sky. I have here a box of cigarettes that need to be smoked, and the sofa is far superior to the usual abomination of country hotels. I don't think it's likely that I'll use the carriage tonight."

en: “Is a tall man, left-handed, limps with the right leg, wears thick-soled shooting-boots and a grey cloak, smokes Indian cigars, uses a cigar-holder, and carries a blunt pen-knife in his pocket. There are several other indications, but these may be enough to aid us in our search.”
vi: “Đó là một người cao lớn, thuận tay trái, chân phải đi khập khiễng, đi ghệt săn đế dày và mặc áo khoác xám, hút xì gà Ấn Độ, có dùng ống đót và đem theo một con dao nhíp cùn trong túi. Còn vài dấu hiệu nữa nhưng bấy nhiêu cũng đủ để giúp chúng ta tìm ra hung thủ.”
tr: "Uzun boylu bir adam, hem solak, hem de sağ ayağı topallıyor. Ökçeleri kalın bir av çizmesi giyiyor, gri renkte bir paltosu var, Hint purosu içerken ağızlık kullanıyor ve cebinde eski bir çakı taşıyor. Başka işaretler de var ama bu saydıklarımız bize yeter.
es: "Es un hombre alto, zurdo, cojea con la pierna derecha, lleva botas de tiro de suela gruesa y una capa gris, fuma puros indios, utiliza un portapuros y lleva una navaja roma en el bolsillo. Hay varios indicios más, pero estos pueden ser suficientes para ayudarnos en nuestra búsqueda."
vi_translation: “He is a tall man, left-handed, limps on his right leg, wears thick-soled hunting gaiters and a gray coat, smokes Indian cigars, uses a pipe, and carries a dull pocket knife in his pocket. There are a few more signs, but this much is enough to help us find the culprit.”
tr_translation: "A tall man, both left-handed and limping on his right foot. He wears thick-heeled hunting boots, has a gray coat, uses a holder while smoking an Indian cigar, and carries an old pocketknife in his pocket. There are other signs, but what we have mentioned is enough for us."
es_translation: "He is a tall man, left-handed, limps with his right leg, wears thick-soled riding boots and a gray cloak, smokes Indian cigars, uses a cigar holder, and carries a blunt knife in his pocket." "There are several more clues, but these may be enough to help us in our search."

en: “Quite so. That was the word the man uttered, and of which his son only caught the last two syllables. He was trying to utter the name of his murderer. So and so, of Ballarat.”
vi: “Ballarat.” “Đúng thế. Đó là từ nạn nhân đã thốt ra mà con trai ông ta chỉ nghe được có hai âm cuối. Ông ta đã gắng sức nói ra tên của kẻ giết người gì gì đó, Ballarat.”
tr: "Tamam. Aslında adamın söylediği şey buydu ama oğlu sadece son hecesini duyabildi. Babası ise katilin adını söylemeye çalışıyordu. Yani Ballaratlı bilmem kim!
es: "Ballarat". "Exactamente". Esa fue la palabra que pronunció el hombre, y de la que su hijo sólo captó las dos últimas sílabas. Intentaba pronunciar el nombre de su asesino. Fulano de tal, de Ballarat".
vi_translation: “That's right. Those were the words uttered by the victim, and his son only heard the last two syllables. He struggled to say the name of the murderer, something like Ballarat.”
tr_translation: "Okay. Actually, that's what the man said, but his son could only hear the last syllable. His father, however, was trying to say the name of the killer. So, someone from Ballarat!"
es_translation: "Exactly." That was the word the man uttered, and from which his son only caught the last two syllables. He was trying to pronounce the name of his murderer. So-and-so, from Ballarat."

en: “And one who was at home in the district, for the pool can only be approached by the farm or by the estate, where strangers could hardly wander.”
vi: “Và là một người sống ở vùng này vì chỉ có thể đến hồ bằng cách đi qua trang trại hoặc là từ điền trang, người từ nơi khác đến thì hiếm khi nào lang thang tới tận đó.”
tr: "Ve bu bölgeden biri olmalı, çünkü göle ya çiftlikten, ya da çevresindeki araziden gidiliyor ve bu bölgelere de yabancılar kolaylıkla giremiyor.
es: "Y uno que estaba en su casa en el distrito, ya que al estanque sólo se puede llegar por la granja o por la finca, donde los extraños difícilmente podrían deambular".
vi_translation: “And as someone who lives in this area, because you can only reach the lake by passing through the farm or from the estate, outsiders rarely wander all the way there.”
tr_translation: "And it must be someone from this area, because the lake is accessed either from the farm or the surrounding land, and strangers cannot easily enter these areas."
es_translation: "And one who was at home in the district, since the pond can only be reached through the farm or the estate, where strangers could hardly wander."

en: “The impression of his right foot was always less distinct than his left. He put less weight upon it. Why? Because he limped—he was lame.”
vi: “Vết chân phải của hắn luôn mờ hơn vết chân trái. Hắn dồn ít trọng lượng hơn vào bên đó. Tại sao? Vì hắn đi khập khiễng, hắn bị thọt.”
tr: "Sağ ayağının izi hep sol ayağının izinden daha belirsizdi. O ayağın üzerine daha az ağırlık veriyordu. Neden? Çünkü topallıyordu.
es: "La impresión de su pie derecho era siempre menos clara que la del izquierdo. Ponía menos peso en él. ¿Por qué? Porque cojeaba, era cojo".
vi_translation: "His right footprint is always fainter than his left footprint. He puts less weight on that side. Why? Because he limps, he is lame."
tr_translation: "The print of his right foot was always less distinct than that of his left foot. He was putting less weight on that foot. Why? Because he was limping."
es_translation: "The impression of his right foot was always less clear than that of his left foot. He put less weight on it. Why? Because he limped, he was lame."

en: “You were yourself struck by the nature of the injury as recorded by the surgeon at the inquest. The blow was struck from immediately behind, and yet was upon the left side. Now, how can that be unless it were by a left-handed man? He had stood behind that tree during the interview between the father and son. He had even smoked there. I found the ash of a cigar, which my special knowledge of tobacco ashes enables me to pronounce as an Indian cigar. I have, as you know, devoted some attention to this, and written a little monograph on the ashes of 140 different varieties of pipe, cigar, and cigarette tobacco. Having found the ash, I then looked round and discovered the stump among the moss where he had tossed it. It was an Indian cigar, of the variety which are rolled in Rotterdam.”
vi: “Chính anh đã ngạc nhiên về tình trạng vết thương được phẫu thuật viên ghi chép lại tại cuộc điều tra. Cú đánh được giáng trực tiếp từ phía sau nhưng lại ở bên trái. Đấy, làm thế nào để thực hiện được trừ phi người ra đòn là một kẻ thuận tay trái? Hắn đã đứng sau gốc cây trong khi người cha nói chuyện vớí con trai. Thậm chí hắn còn hút thuốc ở đó nữa. Tôi tìm thấy tàn của một điếu xì gà, kiến thức đặc biệt về các loại tàn thuốc lá đã cho phép tôi khẳng định đó là một điếu xì gà Ấn Độ. Như anh biết đấy, tôi đã chú ý đến đề tài này và đã viết một chuyên khảo ngắn về tàn thuốc của một trăm bốn mươi loại tẩu, xì gà và thuốc lá. Sau khi tìm thấy tàn thuốc, tôi bèn nhìn xung quanh và phát hiện ra một mẩu thuốc mà hắn vứt lên đám rêu. Đó là một điếu xì gà Ấn Độ, loại được cuốn ở Rotterdam.”
tr: "Adli tıbbın raporuna göre yaralanma şekli seni bile biraz şaşırtmıştı. Darbe adamın tam arkasından gelmiş ama kafatasının sol tarafına. Böyle birşey solak biri tarafından değil de kim yapabilir ki! "Katil, babayla oğul arasındaki tartışma sırasında ağacın arkasına saklanmış. Hatta orada bir puro bile içmiş. Tütünler hakkındaki bilgilerime dayanarak, bulduğum külün bir Hint purosuna ait olduğunu gördüm. Bu konuda bazı çalışmalarım olduğunu biliyorsun. Hatta 140 farklı pipo, puro ve sigara tütünü hakkında bir makalem bile vardır. Külü bulduktan sonra çevreye baktım ve yosunların arasında izmaritini de buldum. Rotterdam'da sarılan Hint purolarından biriydi.
es: "Usted mismo se sorprendió por la naturaleza de la lesión tal y como la registró el cirujano en la investigación. El golpe fue dado inmediatamente por detrás, y sin embargo fue en el lado izquierdo. Ahora, ¿cómo puede ser eso a menos que haya sido por un hombre zurdo? Había estado detrás de ese árbol durante la entrevista entre el padre y el hijo. Incluso había fumado allí. Encontré la ceniza de un puro, que mi especial conocimiento de las cenizas de tabaco me permite afirmar que es un puro indio. Como usted sabe, he dedicado cierta atención a esto, y he escrito una pequeña monografía sobre las cenizas de 140 variedades diferentes de tabaco de pipa, puro y cigarrillo. Tras encontrar la ceniza, miré a mi alrededor y descubrí el tocón entre el musgo donde lo había arrojado. Era un puro indio, de los que se enrollan en Rotterdam".
vi_translation: “It was you who was surprised by the condition of the wound recorded by the surgeon during the investigation. The blow was delivered directly from behind but on the left side. How could that be done unless the person delivering the blow was left-handed? He was standing behind the tree while the father was talking to his son. He even smoked there too. I found the remains of a cigar, and my special knowledge of tobacco ashes allowed me to confirm that it was an Indian cigar. As you know, I have paid attention to this topic and have written a short monograph on the ashes of one hundred and forty types of pipes, cigars, and cigarettes. After finding the ashes, I looked around and discovered a cigarette butt that he had thrown onto the moss. It was an Indian cigar, the type rolled in Rotterdam.”
tr_translation: "According to the forensic report, the manner of the injury had even surprised you a bit. The blow had come from directly behind the man but to the left side of his skull. Who could have done such a thing if not a left-handed person! "The killer hid behind the tree during the argument between the father and the son. He even smoked a cigar there. Based on my knowledge about tobaccos, I saw that the ash I found belonged to an Indian cigar. You know I have done some work on this subject. I even have an article about 140 different pipe, cigar, and cigarette tobaccos. After finding the ash, I looked around and found the butt among the moss. It was one of the Indian cigars rolled in Rotterdam."
es_translation: "You yourself were surprised by the nature of the injury as recorded by the surgeon in the investigation. The blow was struck immediately from behind, and yet it was on the left side. Now, how can that be unless it was by a left-handed man? He had been behind that tree during the interview between the father and the son. He had even smoked there. I found the ash of a cigar, which my special knowledge of tobacco ashes allows me to assert is an Indian cigar. As you know, I have devoted some attention to this, and I have written a small monograph on the ashes of 140 different varieties of pipe, cigar, and cigarette tobacco. After finding the ash, I looked around and discovered the stump among the moss where he had thrown it. It was an Indian cigar, the kind that are rolled in Rotterdam."

en: “I could see that the end had not been in his mouth. Therefore he used a holder. The tip had been cut off, not bitten off, but the cut was not a clean one, so I deduced a blunt pen-knife.”
vi: “Tôi có thể thấy là mẩu thuốc trước đó không bị ngậm trong miệng. Vậy là hắn có dùng đót, đầu mẩu thuốc bị cắt chứ không phải bị cắn rời, nhưng vết cắt không sắc gọn, từ đó tôi suy ra là hắn có một con dao đã cùn.
tr: "Puroyu inceledim; ağıza girecek kısmı ıslanmamıştı. Demek ki ağızlık kullanıyordu. Puronun ucu ısırılmamış, dip kısmından kesilmişti. Ama kesilen yer düzgün olmadığı için bunun kör bir çakıyla kesildiği sonucuna vardım.
es: "Pude ver que el extremo no había estado en su boca. Por lo tanto, utilizó un portapuros. La punta había sido cortada, no mordida, pero el corte no era limpio, por lo que deduje que se trataba de un cortaplumas romo."
vi_translation: "I can see that the previous cigarette butt was not held in the mouth. So he used a cigarette holder, the butt was cut rather than bitten off, but the cut was not clean, from which I deduce that he had a blunt knife."
tr_translation: "I examined the cigar; the part that goes into the mouth was not wet. That means he was using a mouthpiece. The tip of the cigar was not bitten off; it was cut from the base. But since the cut was not smooth, I concluded that it was made with a dull knife."
es_translation: "I could see that the end had not been in his mouth. Therefore, he used a cigar holder. The tip had been cut, not bitten, but the cut was not clean, so I deduced that it was a blunt penknife."

en: “And why did you wish to see me?” He looked across at my companion with despair in his weary eyes, as though his question was already answered.
vi: “Và tại sao ông lại muốn gặp tôi?” Ông ta nhìn bạn tôi, vẻ tuyệt vọng ánh lên trong đôi mắt mệt mỏi như thể câu hỏi của ông ta đã được trả lời.
tr: "Peki, beni neden görmek istediniz?" Sanki sorduğu sorunun cevabı verilmiş gibi, yorgun ve umutsuz gözlerle Holmes'a bakıyordu.
es: "¿Y por qué querías verme?" Miró a mi compañero con desesperación en sus ojos cansados, como si su pregunta ya estuviera contestada.
vi_translation: “And why do you want to meet me?” He looked at my friend, a look of despair shining in his tired eyes as if his question had already been answered.
tr_translation: "So, why did you want to see me?" As if the answer to his question had already been given, he looked at Holmes with tired and hopeless eyes.
es_translation: "And why did you want to see me?" He looked at my companion with desperation in his tired eyes, as if his question had already been answered.

en: The man who entered was young, some two-and-twenty at the outside, well-groomed and trimly clad, with something of refinement and delicacy in his bearing. The streaming umbrella which he held in his hand, and his long shining waterproof told of the fierce weather through which he had come. He looked about him anxiously in the glare of the lamp, and I could see that his face was pale and his eyes heavy, like those of a man who is weighed down with some great anxiety.
vi: Chàng trai bước vào hãy còn trẻ, cùng lắm chỉ khoảng hai mươi hai, ăn mặc chỉnh tề và chải chuốt với phong thái tao nhã và lịch thiệp. Nước chảy thành dòng trên chiếc dù trong tay anh ta và tấm áo mưa dài loang loáng nước cho thấy anh ta vừa đi dưới thời tiết thật là khủng khiếp. Trong ánh sáng chói lòa của ngọn đèn, anh ta nhìn quanh với vẻ bồn chồn và tôi có thể trông thấy khuôn mặt xanh tái với đôi mắt đau buồn như một người đang bị đè nặng dưới một mối lo âu to lớn.
tr: İçeri iyi giyimli ve zarif görünümlü genç bir adam girdi. Yirmi iki yaşında ya var, ya yoktu. Üstünden sular akan şemsiyesi ve uzun parlak yağmurluğu, dışarıda ne kadar kötü bir hava olduğunu gösteriyordu. Lambanın ışığında, endişeli gözleri ve solgun yüzü belli oluyordu. Bir şeyden korktuğu belliydi.
es: El hombre que entró era joven, de unos veinticinco años de edad, bien arreglado y bien vestido, con algo de refinamiento y delicadeza en su porte. El paraguas que sostenía en la mano y su largo y brillante impermeable indicaban el feroz clima por el que había pasado. Miró ansiosamente a su alrededor bajo el resplandor de la lámpara, y pude ver que su rostro estaba pálido y sus ojos pesados, como los de un hombre agobiado por una gran ansiedad.
vi_translation: The young man who entered was still very young, at most about twenty-two, dressed neatly and groomed with an elegant and courteous demeanor. Water flowed in streams on the umbrella in his hand and the long raincoat glistening with water showed that he had just walked through truly terrible weather. In the glaring light of the lamp, he looked around anxiously and I could see his pale face with sorrowful eyes like someone weighed down by a great worry.
tr_translation: A well-dressed and elegant-looking young man entered. He was either twenty-two years old or close to it. His umbrella, dripping with water, and his long, shiny raincoat indicated how bad the weather was outside. In the light of the lamp, his anxious eyes and pale face were noticeable. It was clear that he was afraid of something.
es_translation: The man who entered was young, about twenty-five years old, well-groomed and well-dressed, with a certain refinement and delicacy in his demeanor. The umbrella he held in his hand and his long, shiny raincoat indicated the fierce weather he had endured. He looked around anxiously under the glow of the lamp, and I could see that his face was pale and his eyes heavy, like those of a man burdened by great anxiety.

en: “I signed the paper as directed, and the lawyer took it away with him. The singular incident made, as you may think, the deepest impression upon me, and I pondered over it and turned it every way in my mind without being able to make anything of it. Yet I could not shake off the vague feeling of dread which it left behind, though the sensation grew less keen as the weeks passed and nothing happened to disturb the usual routine of our lives. I could see a change in my uncle, however. He drank more than ever, and he was less inclined for any sort of society. Most of his time he would spend in his room, with the door locked upon the inside, but sometimes he would emerge in a sort of drunken frenzy and would burst out of the house and tear about the garden with a revolver in his hand, screaming out that he was afraid of no man, and that he was not to be cooped up, like a sheep in a pen, by man or devil. When these hot fits were over, however, he would rush tumultuously in at the door and lock and bar it behind him, like a man who can brazen it out no longer against the terror which lies at the roots of his soul. At such times I have seen his face, even on a cold day, glisten with moisture, as though it were new raised from a basin.
vi: Tôi kí vào tờ giấy theo lời dặn và ông luật sư cầm nó đi. Sự việc kì lạ này, như ông có thể thấy, đã gây cho tôi một ấn tượng vô cùng sâu sắc và tôi cứ suy nghĩ, nghiền ngẫm đủ đường về nó mà vẫn không sao làm sáng tỏ được. Tôi cũng không thể nào giũ bỏ cảm giác sợ hãi mơ hồ mà nó để lại, dù rằng cái cảm giác đó mờ nhạt dần sau nhiều tuần trôi qua mà không có điều gì xáo trộn cuộc sống hằng ngày của bác cháu tôi. Tuy vậy, tôi có thể nhận thấy một sự thay đổi ở bác tôi. Bác uống rượu nhiều hơn và không muốn tiếp xúc với bất cứ ai. Hầu như bác chỉ ở lì trong phòng mình, khóa cửa bên trong, nhưng đôi khi bác xuất hiện trong cơn say bí tỉ, đùng đùng ra khỏi nhà và lồng lộn đi lại khắp vườn, tay cầm khẩu súng lục, miệng hét lên rằng bác chẳng sợ đứa nào cả và không ai dù là người hay quỷ dữ có thể giam chân bác nhốt như một con cừu trong bãi quây. Tuy nhiên, khi những cơn nóng giận đó nguôi ngoai thì bác lại cuống cuồng chạy vào phòng rồi chốt và khóa chặt cửa lại như một người không còn đủ sức đương đầu với nỗi sợ hãi kinh hoàng nằm sâu trong gốc rễ linh hồn của ông. Vào những lúc như thế, tôi thấy mặt bác bóng nhẫy mồ hôi dù trời lạnh, như thể bác vừa úp mặt vào chậu nước vậy.
tr: "Söylendiği gibi imzaladım ve avukat vasiyetnameyi alarak gitti. Tahmin edeceğiniz gibi bu garip olay üzerimde derin bir etki yarattı ama olanları defalarca enine boyuna düşünmeme rağmen işin içinden çıkamadım. Ondan sonra bilemediğim bir korku benliğimi kapladı. Gerçi haftalar geçtikçe etkisi hafifledi ve günlük hayatın rutini devam etti ama amcamda değişiklikler olmaya başladığını fark ediyordum. Eskisinden daha çok içmeye ve toplumdan daha da çok uzaklaşmaya başlamıştı. Zamanının çoğunu, kapısını içeriden kilitlediği tavan arasındaki odasında geçiriyordu. Ama bazen, sarhoş gibi çılgınca odadan fırlıyor, elinde tabancası, evin etrafında dört dönüyordu. Bahçeye fırlıyor ve kimseden korkmadığını, hiç kimseye koyun gibi boyun eğmeyeceğini söylüyordu. Bu nöbetler geçtikten sonra hışımla yine odasına dönüyor ve kapıyı içeriden kilitliyordu. Ruhunun derinliklerindeki korkuya teslim olan bir adam evinin efendisi olamazdı. Böyle zamanlarda, en soğuk günlerde bile, yüzü terden sırılsıklam oluyordu.
es: "Firmé el papel como se me indicó, y el abogado se lo llevó. El singular incidente me causó, como usted puede pensar, la más profunda impresión, y reflexioné sobre él y le di todas las vueltas en mi mente sin poder sacar nada en claro. Sin embargo, no pude deshacerme de la vaga sensación de temor que me dejó, aunque la sensación se hizo menos aguda a medida que pasaban las semanas y no ocurría nada que perturbara la rutina habitual de nuestras vidas. Sin embargo, pude ver un cambio en mi tío. Bebía más que nunca, y estaba menos dispuesto a cualquier tipo de sociedad. Pasaba la mayor parte del tiempo en su habitación, con la puerta cerrada por dentro, pero a veces salía en una especie de frenesí de embriaguez e irrumpía en la casa y recorría el jardín con un revólver en la mano, gritando que no temía a nadie y que no debía ser encerrado, como una oveja en un corral, por el hombre o el diablo. Sin embargo, cuando estos arrebatos terminaban, se abalanzaba tumultuosamente sobre la puerta y la cerraba con llave tras de sí, como un hombre que ya no puede hacer frente al terror que le invade el alma. En esos momentos he visto su rostro, incluso en un día frío, brillar de humedad, como si estuviera recién salido de una palangana.
vi_translation: I signed the paper as instructed, and the lawyer took it away. This strange event, as you can see, left an incredibly deep impression on me, and I kept thinking and pondering over it in every possible way but still couldn't clarify it. I also couldn't shake off the vague sense of fear it left behind, even though that feeling gradually faded after many weeks passed without anything disrupting the daily life of my uncle and me. However, I could notice a change in my uncle. He drank more and didn't want to interact with anyone. He mostly stayed in his room, locking the door from the inside, but sometimes he would appear in a drunken rage, storming out of the house and pacing furiously around the garden, holding a pistol and shouting that he wasn't afraid of anyone and that no one, whether human or demon, could confine him like a sheep in a pen. However, when those fits of anger subsided, he would rush back into his room, bolting and locking the door tightly like someone who no longer had the strength to face the terrifying fear rooted deep in his soul. At such times, I would see his face glistening with sweat despite the cold weather, as if he had just plunged his face into a basin of water.
tr_translation: "As stated, I signed it and the lawyer took the will and left. As you might guess, this strange event had a profound effect on me, but despite thinking about it over and over again, I couldn't make sense of it. After that, an unknown fear enveloped me. Although its effect diminished as weeks passed and the routine of daily life continued, I noticed changes in my uncle. He started drinking more than before and distancing himself even further from society. He spent most of his time in the attic room, which he locked from the inside. But sometimes, he would burst out of the room like a madman, as if drunk, with a gun in his hand, pacing around the house. He would rush into the garden and declare that he was not afraid of anyone and would not submit to anyone like a sheep. After these fits, he would storm back to his room and lock the door from the inside again. A man who surrenders to the fear deep within his soul cannot be the master of his house. At such times, even on the coldest days, his face would be drenched in sweat.
es_translation: "I signed the paper as instructed, and the lawyer took it away. The singular incident caused me, as you can imagine, the deepest impression, and I reflected on it and turned it over in my mind without being able to make anything clear of it. However, I could not shake off the vague feeling of fear it left me with, although the sensation became less acute as the weeks passed and nothing happened to disturb the usual routine of our lives. Nevertheless, I could see a change in my uncle. He drank more than ever, and was less inclined to any kind of company. He spent most of his time in his room, with the door locked from the inside, but sometimes he would come out in a sort of drunken frenzy and storm through the house and roam the garden with a revolver in his hand, shouting that he feared no one and that he should not be locked up, like a sheep in a pen, by man or devil. However, when these outbursts ended, he would rush tumultuously to the door and lock it behind him, like a man who can no longer face the terror that invades his soul. At those moments I have seen his face, even on a cold day, shine with moisture, as if he had just come out of a basin.

en: “It is really two days since you had the letter. We should have acted before this. You have no further evidence, I suppose, than that which you have placed before us—no suggestive detail which might help us?”
vi: “Hai ngày đã trôi qua kể từ khi anh nhận được lá thư. Lẽ ra chúng ta cần phải hành động từ trước. Tôi cho rằng ngoài những thứ mà anh đã cho chúng tôi xem thì anh không có thêm bằng chứng nào khác - không có chi tiết nào có thể giúp chúng tôi?”
tr: "Mektubu aldığınızdan bu yana iki gün geçmiş. Daha önce davranmalıydın. Sanırım bu anlattıklarınızdan başka ekleyeceğiniz bir şey yok.
es: "Hace realmente dos días que recibió la carta. Deberíamos haber actuado antes. Supongo que no tiene más pruebas que las que nos ha presentado, ningún detalle sugestivo que pueda ayudarnos".
vi_translation: "Two days have passed since you received the letter." "We should have acted earlier." "I assume that besides what you have shown us, you have no other evidence - no additional details that could help us?"
tr_translation: "It has been two days since you received the letter. You should have acted sooner. I suppose there is nothing more you can add to what you have already told."
es_translation: "It's really been two days since he received the letter. We should have acted sooner. I suppose he has no more evidence than what he has presented to us, no suggestive detail that could help us."

en: “Do not lose an instant. And, above all, take care of yourself in the meanwhile, for I do not think that there can be a doubt that you are threatened by a very real and imminent danger. How do you go back?”
vi: “Đừng bỏ phí một giây. Và điều quan trọng nhất là trong thời gian này anh cần phải tự bảo vệ mình vì không còn nghi ngờ gì nữa, anh đang bị một mối nguy rất thật và gần kề đe dọa. Anh về nhà bằng phương tiện gì?”
tr: "Hiç zaman kaybetmeyin. Bu arada, hepsinden önemlisi, kendinize çok dikkat edin, çünkü gerçekten büyük bir tehlikeyle karşı karşıya olduğunuzdan hiç kuşkum kalmadı. Eve nasıl döneceksiniz?
es: "No pierda ni un instante. Y, sobre todo, cuídese mientras tanto, pues no creo que pueda haber duda de que está usted amenazado por un peligro muy real e inminente. ¿Cómo se vuelve?"
vi_translation: “Don't waste a second. And the most important thing is that during this time you need to protect yourself because without a doubt, you are being threatened by a very real and imminent danger. How are you getting home?”
tr_translation: "Don't waste any time. Meanwhile, above all, take great care of yourself, because I have no doubt that you are facing a really great danger. How will you get home?"
es_translation: "Don't waste a single moment. And, above all, take care of yourself in the meantime, as I don't think there can be any doubt that you are threatened by a very real and imminent danger. How do you go back?"

en: “I searched the Dundee records, and when I found that the barque Lone Star was there in January, ’85, my suspicion became a certainty. I then inquired as to the vessels which lay at present in the port of London.”
vi: “Tôi lại tìm trong các hồ sơ về cảng Dundee và khi nhận thấy là tàu Lone Star có cập cảng đó vào tháng 1 năm 1885, mối nghi ngờ của tôi đã được khẳng định, tiếp theo tôi lại hỏi thăm về những con tàu đang đậu tại cảng London.”
tr: "Dundee'den kalkan gemileri inceledim. Lone Star gemisinin, 85 yılının Ocak ayında orada olduğunu görünce bütün şüphelerim doğrulanmış oldu. Sonra, şu an Londra limanında bulunan gemileri araştırdım.
es: "Busqué en los registros de Dundee, y cuando encontré que la barca Lone Star estaba allí en enero del 85, mi sospecha se convirtió en una certeza. Entonces indagué sobre los buques que se encontraban en ese momento en el puerto de Londres".
vi_translation: "I searched through the records of Dundee port and when I found that the Lone Star ship docked there in January 1885, my suspicion was confirmed. Next, I inquired about the ships currently docked at London port."
tr_translation: "I examined the ships departing from Dundee. When I saw that the Lone Star ship was there in January of '85, all my doubts were confirmed. Then, I researched the ships currently in the London port."
es_translation: "I searched the Dundee records, and when I found that the Lone Star barque was there in January '85, my suspicion turned into a certainty. Then I inquired about the ships that were in the port of London at that time."

en: But there was no great difficulty in the first stage of my adventure. Upper Swandam Lane is a vile alley lurking behind the high wharves which line the north side of the river to the east of London Bridge. Between a slop-shop and a gin-shop, approached by a steep flight of steps leading down to a black gap like the mouth of a cave, I found the den of which I was in search. Ordering my cab to wait, I passed down the steps, worn hollow in the centre by the ceaseless tread of drunken feet; and by the light of a flickering oil-lamp above the door I found the latch and made my way into a long, low room, thick and heavy with the brown opium smoke, and terraced with wooden berths, like the forecastle of an emigrant ship.
vi: Giai đoạn đầu của cuộc phiêu lưu chẳng có gì khó khăn. Hẻm Upper Swandam là một lối đi gớm ghiếc nằm khuất sau những cầu tàu cao dọc bờ bắc của con sông đến tận phía đông cầu London. Nằm giữa một cửa hàng bán quần áo may sẵn rẻ tiền và một tiệm rượu là dãy bậc thang dốc đứng dẫn xuống một khoảng trống tối đen trông như một miệng hang, đó chính là cái tiệm hút mà tôi cần tìm. Dặn xe đứng đợi xong, tôi bước xuống những bậc thềm đã mòn trũng ở chính giữa bởi bước chân qua lại liên tục của những con nghiện, và nhờ ánh sáng lập lòe của ngọn đèn dầu treo trên cửa mà tôi nhìn thấy cái then cài rồi lần bước vào một căn phòng dài và thấp, dày đặc khói thuốc phiện màu nâu với những chiếc giường gỗ kê trên thềm nhà giống như trong khoang của một chiếc tàu di dân.
tr: İlk hedef afyon tekkesiydi pek tabii. İşin bu aşamasında fazla bir güçlükle karşılaştığım söylenemez. Bayan Whitney'in sözünü ettiği Yukarı Swandan Sokağı, nehrin kuzey yakasını Londra Köprüsü sayesinde doğu yakasına bağlayan bir merkez bölgedeydi. Üstelik rıhtımın arka taraflarında ve alabildiğine pis bir sokak olduğunu da hatırlatmak isterim. Afyonkeşlerin bu makbul mekânının bir mezbeleliğe benzediğine ilişkin peşin bir yargım vardı en baştan. Nihayet aradığım adrese gelmiştik. Arabacıya beklemesini söylediğimde iki bina arasında sıkışıp kalmış ve merdivenlerle inilen bir mahzeni andıran karanlık ve kuytu bir yerin önündeydik. Sarhoşların, ayyaşların ve keşlerin ayakları altında ezilip çürümüş merdivenlerden aşağı indiğim yer pek de iç açıcı değildi. Bir gaz lambasının ışığı altında zar zor seçebildiğim bir kapı kolu gideceğim yönü işaret eder gibiydi. İçerisinin de dışarıdan kalır bir yanı yoktu. Kendinizi uzun yolculuğa çıkmış sürgün gemilerindeki göçmen koğuşlarında zannedebilirdiniz. Yüksek tavanlı olmayan bir odada yerlerde boylu boyunca uzayan yatakların arasında kesif bir afyon kokusu ve dumanlı hava sizi karşılıyordu.
es: Pero no hubo grandes dificultades en la primera etapa de mi aventura. Upper Swandam Lane es un vil callejón que se esconde detrás de los altos muelles que bordean la orilla norte del río, al este del puente de Londres. Entre una tienda de productos de limpieza y una tienda de ginebra, a la que se accede por una empinada escalera que conduce a un hueco negro como la boca de una cueva, encontré la guarida que buscaba. Ordené a mi taxi que esperara, bajé los escalones, desgastados en el centro por la incesante pisada de los pies ebrios; y a la luz de una vacilante lámpara de aceite sobre la puerta encontré el pestillo y me abrí paso a una habitación larga y baja, espesa y pesada por el humo marrón del opio, y adornada con literas de madera, como el puente de proa de un barco de emigrantes.
vi_translation: The initial stage of the adventure was not difficult at all. Upper Swandam Lane is a vile alley hidden behind the tall docks along the north bank of the river, extending to the east of London Bridge. Between a cheap ready-made clothing store and a liquor shop lies a steep staircase leading down to a dark void resembling a cave entrance, which is the opium den I needed to find. After instructing the cab to wait, I descended the steps, worn and hollowed in the middle by the constant passage of addicts, and by the flickering light of the oil lamp hanging at the door, I saw the latch and then made my way into a long, low room, thick with brown opium smoke, with wooden beds arranged on the floor like in the cabin of an immigrant ship.
tr_translation: The first target was, of course, the opium den. At this stage of the job, it can't be said that I encountered much difficulty. The Upper Swandan Street mentioned by Mrs. Whitney was in a central area that connected the north bank of the river to the east bank thanks to London Bridge. Moreover, I should remind you that it was a filthy street behind the wharf. From the very beginning, I had a preconceived notion that this reputable place for opium addicts resembled a dump. Finally, we had arrived at the address I was looking for. When I told the driver to wait, we were in front of a dark and secluded place squeezed between two buildings, resembling a basement accessed by stairs. The place I descended to, down the stairs rotted and crushed under the feet of drunks, alcoholics, and addicts, was not very pleasant. Under the light of an oil lamp, a door handle that I could barely make out seemed to point the way I was to go. The inside was no different from the outside. You might have thought you were in the immigrant dormitories of exile ships on a long journey. In a room without a high ceiling, between the beds stretching out on the floor, a dense opium smell and smoky air greeted you.
es_translation: But there were no great difficulties in the first stage of my adventure. Upper Swandam Lane is a vile alley that hides behind the tall docks lining the north bank of the river, east of London Bridge. Between a cleaning products shop and a gin shop, accessed by a steep staircase leading to a black hole like the mouth of a cave, I found the lair I was looking for. I ordered my cab to wait, descended the steps, worn in the center by the incessant tread of drunken feet; and by the light of a flickering oil lamp above the door, I found the latch and made my way into a long, low room, thick and heavy with the brown smoke of opium, and adorned with wooden bunks, like the foredeck of an emigrant ship.

en: “Good heavens! I thought it was Wednesday. It is Wednesday. What d’you want to frighten a chap for?” He sank his face onto his arms and began to sob in a high treble key.
vi: “Trời đất ơi! Tôi cứ nghĩ mới là thứ tư chứ. Hôm nay là thứ tư mà. Anh hù dọa bạn bè như thế để làm gì?” Anh ta gục mặt lên hai cánh tay và bắt đầu rưng rức khóc nức nở.
tr: Cuma, 19 Haziran. Ooo… Ben Çarşamba zannediyordum. Yoksa beni korkutmaya mı çalışıyorsun Watson? Çarşamba günündeyiz, değil mi? Bu sırada yüzünü elleriyle gizlemeye çalışarak hüngür hüngür ağlıyordu.
es: "¡Santo cielo! Pensé que era miércoles. Es miércoles. ¿Para qué quieres asustar a un hombre?" Hundió la cara en sus brazos y comenzó a sollozar en un tono agudo.
vi_translation: “Oh my God! I thought today was Wednesday. Today is Wednesday, isn't it?” “Why do you scare your friends like that?” He buried his face in his arms and began to sob uncontrollably.
tr_translation: ─ Friday, June 19. ─ Ooo… I thought it was Wednesday. Or are you trying to scare me, Watson? It is Wednesday, isn't it? During this time, he was sobbing uncontrollably, trying to hide his face with his hands.
es_translation: "Good heavens!" "I thought it was Wednesday." "It is Wednesday." "Why do you want to scare a man?" He buried his face in his arms and began to sob in a high-pitched tone.

en: We made our way downstairs as quietly as possible, and out into the bright morning sunshine. In the road stood our horse and trap, with the half-clad stable-boy waiting at the head. We both sprang in, and away we dashed down the London Road. A few country carts were stirring, bearing in vegetables to the metropolis, but the lines of villas on either side were as silent and lifeless as some city in a dream.
vi: Chúng tôi lần mò xuống cầu thang thật khẽ khàng và bước ra ngoài trong ánh nắng rực rỡ của buổi bình minh. Con ngựa và hành lí của chúng tôi đã đứng sẵn trên đường, cậu bé giữ ngựa quần áo còn xộc xệch đang đợi bên đầu ngựa. Cả hai chúng tôi nhảy lên xe và phóng vụt đi xuôi theo đường London. Một vài chiếc xe bò vùng quê đang lăn bánh, chở rau quả về phía thủ đô nhưng những dãy biệt thự hai bên đường hãy còn yên lặng và vô hồn như một thành phố đang chìm trong mơ.
tr: Elimizden geldiği kadarıyla sessiz olmaya çalışarak aşağı kata indik ve sabah güneşine çıktık birlikte. Arabayı hazırlamış olan kâhya yarı giyinik bir şekilde bizi bekliyordu. Az sonra arabanın içinde Londra'ya doğru yol almaya başlamıştık bile. Arka kısımlarındaki sebzeleri şehre ulaştırmaya çalışan birkaç yük arabasını saymazsak, yolun her iki tarafında dizilmiş köşkler derin bir sessizlik içinde henüz uyanmamış görünüyordu.
es: Bajamos las escaleras lo más silenciosamente posible y salimos al brillante sol de la mañana. En el camino estaban nuestro caballo y el carro, con el mozo de cuadra medio vestido esperando a la cabeza. Nos subimos a él y salimos corriendo por la carretera de Londres. Algunos carros de campo se movían, llevando verduras a la metrópoli, pero las líneas de villas a ambos lados estaban tan silenciosas y sin vida como una ciudad en un sueño.
vi_translation: We carefully made our way down the stairs and stepped outside into the brilliant sunlight of dawn. Our horse and luggage were already on the road, with the boy holding the horse, his clothes still disheveled, waiting by the horse's head. Both of us jumped into the carriage and sped off down the London road. A few countryside carts were rolling by, carrying vegetables towards the capital, but the rows of villas on either side of the road were still silent and lifeless, like a city in a dream.
tr_translation: We went downstairs as quietly as we could and stepped into the morning sunlight together. The half-dressed butler who had prepared the car was waiting for us. Soon, we were already on our way to London in the car. Except for a few freight wagons trying to deliver vegetables to the city, the mansions lined up on both sides of the road seemed to be still asleep in deep silence.
es_translation: We went down the stairs as quietly as possible and stepped out into the bright morning sun. On the way were our horse and cart, with the half-dressed stable boy waiting at the head. We got on it and rushed down the road to London. Some farm carts were moving, carrying vegetables to the metropolis, but the rows of villas on either side were as silent and lifeless as a city in a dream.

en: “Yes, it is all we can do to make him wash his hands, and his face is as black as a tinker’s. Well, when once his case has been settled, he will have a regular prison bath; and I think, if you saw him, you would agree with me that he needed it.”
vi: “Phải, dù đã cố gắng hết sức nhưng chúng tôi cũng chỉ bắt được hắn rửa tay, còn mặt hắn vẫn đen như mặt thợ hàn vậy. Vâng, khi nào giải quyết xong vụ của hắn thì hắn sẽ phải tắm thường xuyên theo chế độ nhà tù; ông mà trông thấy hắn thì chắc ông cũng sẽ đồng ý với tôi.”
tr: Evet, öyle… Hiç olmazsa ellerini yıkasın diye ne kadar üstelersek üsteleyelim yıkamıyor pis herif. Şu davası görülsün de onu bir içeri atalım. O zaman görür gününü. Onu hapiste iyice yıkarlar umarım.
es: "Sí, es todo lo que podemos hacer para que se lave las manos, y su cara es tan negra como la de un calderero. Bueno, cuando se haya resuelto su caso, tendrá un baño regular en la cárcel; y creo que, si lo vieras, estarías de acuerdo conmigo en que lo necesita."
vi_translation: "Yes, even though we tried our best, we could only get him to wash his hands, but his face is still as black as a welder's." "Yes, once his case is resolved, he will have to bathe regularly according to the prison regime; if you saw him, you would probably agree with me."
tr_translation: ─ Yes, that's right… No matter how much we insist for him to at least wash his hands, that filthy guy doesn't wash them. Let his case be seen so we can throw him inside. Then he'll get what he deserves. I hope they give him a good wash in prison.
es_translation: "Yes, it's all we can do to get him to wash his hands, and his face is as black as a tinker’s." "Well, when his case is resolved, he'll have a regular bath in jail; and I think, if you saw him, you would agree with me that he needs it."

en: Never in my life have I seen such a sight. The man’s face peeled off under the sponge like the bark from a tree. Gone was the coarse brown tint! Gone, too, was the horrid scar which had seamed it across, and the twisted lip which had given the repulsive sneer to the face! A twitch brought away the tangled red hair, and there, sitting up in his bed, was a pale, sad-faced, refined-looking man, black-haired and smooth-skinned, rubbing his eyes and staring about him with sleepy bewilderment. Then suddenly realising the exposure, he broke into a scream and threw himself down with his face to the pillow.
vi: Trong đời tôi chưa bao giờ được trông thấy một cảnh tượng như thế. Khuôn mặt của người đàn ông bị tróc ra dưới miếng bọt biển như một mảnh vỏ bong ra khỏi thân cây. Màu da nâu bẩn thỉu biến mất. Cả vết sẹo gớm ghiếc nổi bật vắt ngang mặt và cái môi méo tạo ra vẻ mặt đáng ghét của hắn cũng chẳng còn tăm tích! Một cú giật mạnh kéo theo mớ tóc đỏ rối bù và giờ đây, ngồi trên giường là một người đàn ông khá đẹp trai, mặt tai tái đượm buồn, mái tóc đen và làn da nhẵn nhụi đang dụi mắt và nhìn quanh phòng với vẻ ngái ngủ, hoang mang. Rồi, bất chợt nhận ra là mình đang bị quan sát, anh ta hét lên một tiếng và buông mình nằm xuống, úp mặt vào gối.
tr: Bu, büyük bir şaşkınlık anıydı. Dilencinin çirkin suratı süngerin değmesiyle birlikte aniden değişmeye başladı. Tıpkı kabuğundan soyulan bir ağaç gibi… O çirkin surattaki değişim görülmeye değerdi. Kirden pis bir kahverengiye dönüşmüş suratın rengi değişirken, korkunç yara izi ve tavşan dudak da düzelmişti. Kızıl saçların da değiştiğini görünce merakla ortaya çıkan yeni surata bakmaya başlamıştık. Ortaya bu kez biraz soluk benizli, siyah saçlı, ürkek ve tedirgin bakışlarıyla yeni bir yüz çıkmıştı. Gözlerini ovuşturan adam olan biteni anlayamamanın verdiği telaşla uyku mahmurluğunu üzerinden atmaya çalışıyordu. Bütün bunları anlaması ve uyku mahmurluğundan kurtulması o kadar uzun sürmedi. Bu anda suçüstü yakalanmış gibi attığı küçük bir çığlığın ardından, yüzünü yeniden uyandığı yastığa gömmüştü. Sanki yüzünü kimseye göstermek istemiyor gibiydi. Vay canına…
es: Nunca en mi vida había visto un espectáculo semejante. La cara del hombre se desprendió bajo la esponja como la corteza de un árbol. Se esfumó el tosco tinte marrón. También había desaparecido la horrible cicatriz que lo atravesaba y el labio torcido que le daba una repulsiva mueca al rostro. Una sacudida apartó la enmarañada cabellera roja, y allí, sentado en su cama, había un hombre pálido, de rostro triste y aspecto refinado, de pelo negro y piel suave, que se frotaba los ojos y miraba a su alrededor con somnoliento desconcierto. Luego, al darse cuenta de la exposición, rompió en un grito y se arrojó con la cara hacia la almohada.
vi_translation: In my life, I had never seen a scene like that. The man's face peeled off under the sponge like a piece of bark coming off a tree. The dirty brown skin disappeared. The hideous scar running across his face and the twisted lip that gave him a hateful look were also gone without a trace! A strong pull took off the messy red hair, and now, sitting on the bed was a rather handsome man, pale-faced with sadness, black-haired and smooth-skinned, rubbing his eyes and looking around the room with a sleepy, bewildered expression. Then, suddenly realizing he was being watched, he let out a scream and threw himself down, face buried in the pillow.
tr_translation: It was a moment of great astonishment. As the sponge touched the beggar's ugly face, it suddenly began to change. Just like a tree being peeled of its bark... The transformation on that ugly face was worth seeing. As the color of the face, which had turned a filthy brown from dirt, changed, the horrible scar and harelip also healed. When we saw that the red hair was also changing, we began to look curiously at the new face that emerged. This time, a new face with a somewhat pale complexion, black hair, and timid and anxious eyes appeared. The man, rubbing his eyes, was trying to shake off the drowsiness with the panic of not understanding what was happening. It didn't take him long to understand all this and shake off the drowsiness. At that moment, as if caught red-handed, he let out a small scream and buried his face back into the pillow he had woken up on. It was as if he didn't want to show his face to anyone. ─ Wow…
es_translation: Never in my life had I seen such a spectacle. The man's face came off under the sponge like the bark of a tree. The coarse brown tint vanished. The horrible scar that crossed it and the twisted lip that gave his face a repulsive grimace had also disappeared. A shake removed the tangled red hair, and there, sitting on his bed, was a pale man with a sad face and refined appearance, with black hair and smooth skin, rubbing his eyes and looking around with sleepy bewilderment. Then, realizing the exposure, he broke into a scream and threw himself face down onto the pillow.

en: “Well, you can imagine how hard it was to settle down to arduous work at £ 2 a week when I knew that I could earn as much in a day by smearing my face with a little paint, laying my cap on the ground, and sitting still. It was a long fight between my pride and the money, but the dollars won at last, and I threw up reporting and sat day after day in the corner which I had first chosen, inspiring pity by my ghastly face and filling my pockets with coppers. Only one man knew my secret. He was the keeper of a low den in which I used to lodge in Swandam Lane, where I could every morning emerge as a squalid beggar and in the evenings transform myself into a well-dressed man about town. This fellow, a Lascar, was well paid by me for his rooms, so that I knew that my secret was safe in his possession.
vi: Thế đấy, các ông có thể thấy tôi đã cảm thấy khó khăn thế nào khi phải bám víu lấy một công việc nặng nhọc với mức lương hai bảng mỗi tuần trong khi tôi biết rằng mình có thể kiếm được bấy nhiêu tiền chỉ trong một ngày bằng cách bôi bẩn lên mặt, đặt cái mũ lên nền đất và ngôi yên một chỗ. Đó là cuộc đấu tranh lâu dài giữa lòng kiêu hãnh và tiền bạc, nhưng cuối cùng thì đồng crown đã chiến thắng và tôi bỏ hẳn nghề phóng viên để ra ngồi ngày này sang ngày khác ở cái góc mà tôi đã chọn ngay từ hôm đầu, khơi gợi lòng thương hại bằng bộ mặt gớm ghiếc và nhét đầy những đồng xu vào túi. Chỉ có một người biết được bí mật của tôi. Hắn là chủ của cái tiệm hút rẻ tiền mà tôi vẫn thường thuê ở hẻm Swandam; mỗi buổi sáng tôi lại xuất hiện trong điệu bộ một tên ăn mày bẩn thỉu và chiều xuống thì trở về để hóa thân thành một người ăn mặc bảnh bao dạo phố. Gã người Ấn được tôi trả tiền thuê phòng hậu hĩ vì thế tôi biết rằng bí mật của tôi sẽ được hắn giữ kín.
tr: Oldukça basit sayılabilecek bir makyaj sayesinde dilencilikten oldukça iyi para kazanılacağını bir kez keşfetmiş bulunuyordum. Basit bir makyaj sonucunda büründüğüm dilencilik sayesinde şapkamı önüme koyarak bir günde kazandığım parayı, ancak bir hafta köpek gibi çalışarak kazanabiliyordum. Gururum mu para mı, savaşı ne yazık ki para kazandı. Muhabirliği bırakarak dilenciliğe başladım. Bu küçük sırrımı sadece bir tek kişi biliyordu. Tahmin edebileceğiniz gibi, Swandam Sokağı'nda her sabah beyefendi kılığında yukarı çıktığım dilenci kılığında aşağı indiğim, akşamları da tam tersini yaptığım dairenin sahibi Lascar… Bu adama da iyi para vererek susturmayı başarıyordum.
es: "Bien, puedes imaginar lo duro que fue establecerme en un arduo trabajo de dos libras a la semana cuando sabía que podía ganar lo mismo en un día untando mi cara con un poco de pintura, poniendo mi gorra en el suelo y quedándome quieto. Fue una larga lucha entre mi orgullo y el dinero, pero al final ganaron los dólares, y me deshice de los informes y me senté día tras día en el rincón que había elegido al principio, inspirando lástima con mi rostro espantoso y llenando mis bolsillos de cobres. Sólo un hombre conocía mi secreto. Era el guardián de un antro bajo en el que solía alojarme en Swandam Lane, donde todas las mañanas podía salir como un mendigo escuálido y por las noches transformarme en un hombre bien vestido de la ciudad. Este tipo, un Lascar, estaba bien pagado por mí por sus habitaciones, por lo que sabía que mi secreto estaba a salvo en su poder.
vi_translation: That's how it is, gentlemen, you can see how difficult it was for me to cling to a heavy job with a salary of two pounds a week while knowing that I could earn that much in just one day by smearing dirt on my face, placing a hat on the ground, and sitting still. It was a long struggle between pride and money, but in the end, the crown won, and I completely abandoned my job as a reporter to sit day after day at the corner I had chosen from the first day, evoking pity with my hideous face and filling my pockets with coins. Only one person knew my secret. He was the owner of the cheap opium den I used to rent in Swandam Lane; every morning I would appear in the guise of a filthy beggar and by evening return to transform into a well-dressed gentleman strolling the streets. The Indian fellow to whom I paid a generous room rent, so I knew that my secret would be kept by him.
tr_translation: I had discovered that quite good money could be made from begging thanks to a relatively simple makeup. Thanks to the simple makeup that transformed me into a beggar, I could earn in one day by putting my hat in front of me what I could only earn in a week by working like a dog. My pride or money, unfortunately, money won the battle. I quit journalism and started begging. Only one person knew this little secret of mine. As you might guess, the owner of the apartment on Swandam Street, where I went up every morning in the guise of a gentleman and came down in the guise of a beggar, and did the opposite in the evenings, Lascar... I managed to keep this man quiet by paying him well.
es_translation: "Well, you can imagine how hard it was to settle into a tough job for two pounds a week when I knew I could earn the same in a day by smearing my face with a bit of paint, putting my cap on the ground, and standing still. It was a long struggle between my pride and the money, but in the end, the dollars won, and I got rid of the reports and sat day after day in the corner I had chosen at the beginning, inspiring pity with my ghastly face and filling my pockets with coppers. Only one man knew my secret. He was the keeper of a low den where I used to lodge in Swandam Lane, where every morning I could go out as a scrawny beggar and at night transform into a well-dressed man of the city. This fellow, a Lascar, was well paid by me for his rooms, so I knew my secret was safe in his hands.

en: “Well, very soon I found that I was saving considerable sums of money. I do not mean that any beggar in the streets of London could earn £ 700 a year—which is less than my average takings—but I had exceptional advantages in my power of making up, and also in a facility of repartee, which improved by practice and made me quite a recognised character in the City. All day a stream of pennies, varied by silver, poured in upon me, and it was a very bad day in which I failed to take £ 2.
vi: Chỉ một thời gian ngắn sau đó, tôi nhận ra mình đã dành dụm được một số tiền đáng kể. Tôi không có ý nói là mọi người ăn xin trên những con phố của London đều có thể kiếm được bảy trăm bảng một năm - mà chừng đó còn kém hơn mức thu nhập trung bình của tôi - nhưng tôi có những thế mạnh đặc biệt nhờ kĩ năng hóa trang và cả năng khiếu ứng đối lanh lẹ, những lợi điểm này ngày càng được cải thiện trong quá trình hành nghề và giúp tôi trở thành một nhân vật nổi bật trong khu City. Suốt cả ngày, một dòng suối tiền xu, có khi là những đồng bạc, cứ tuôn trào lên tôi và chỉ có những ngày tệ hại nhất tôi mới không kiếm đủ hai bảng.
tr: Kısa sürede önemli bir para kazanabileceğimi fark ettim. Bu sokaklarda yılda 700 Sterlin kazanmak öyle her dilencinin harcı değildir. Bu miktar üstelik benim yıllık ortalama kazancımdan bile aşağıdadır. Makyajımın çok iyi olması ve oyunculuk deneyimlerim sayesinde bir zaman sonra şehirde tanınan bir dilenci olmayı başarmıştım. Her gün bu zavallı görünümüm sayesinde yüzlerce Peni şapkamda toplanıyordu. Öyle ki kazancımın günde iki Sterlin'den aşağı düşmesi durumunda işlerin iyi olmadığını düşünmeye başlıyordum.
es: "Bien, muy pronto descubrí que estaba ahorrando sumas considerables de dinero. No quiero decir que cualquier mendigo de las calles de Londres pudiera ganar 700 libras al año -que es menos de lo que yo ganaba de media-, sino que yo tenía ventajas excepcionales en mi capacidad para maquillarme, y también en una facilidad de réplica, que mejoraba con la práctica y me convertía en un personaje bastante reconocido en la City. Durante todo el día me llegó un torrente de peniques, variados por la plata, y era un día muy malo en el que no me llevaba dos libras.
vi_translation: Only a short time later, I realized that I had saved up a considerable amount of money. I'm not saying that everyone begging on the streets of London can make seven hundred pounds a year - which is still less than my average income - but I have special strengths thanks to my disguise skills and quick-wittedness, advantages that have improved over the course of my career and helped me become a prominent figure in the City. All day long, a stream of coins, sometimes even silver ones, would pour in, and only on the worst days did I fail to make at least two pounds.
tr_translation: I realized that I could make a significant amount of money in a short time. Earning 700 pounds a year on these streets is not something every beggar can achieve. This amount is even below my average annual income. Thanks to my excellent makeup and acting experience, I eventually managed to become a well-known beggar in the city. Every day, hundreds of pennies were collected in my hat thanks to my pitiful appearance. So much so that if my earnings fell below two pounds a day, I would start to think that things were not going well.
es_translation: "Well, very soon I discovered that I was saving considerable sums of money. I don't mean that any beggar on the streets of London could earn 700 pounds a year -which is less than what I averaged-, but rather that I had exceptional advantages in my ability to disguise myself, and also in a quick wit, which improved with practice and made me a fairly recognized character in the City. Throughout the day, a torrent of pennies came to me, varied by silver, and it was a very bad day when I didn't make two pounds.

en: “So much so,” I remarked, “that of the last six cases which I have added to my notes, three have been entirely free of any legal crime.”
vi: “Nhiều là đằng khác”, tôi nhận xét. “Trong số sáu vụ gần đây nhất mà tôi ghi chép lại thì có đến ba vụ hoàn toàn không vi phạm pháp luật.
tr: "Hem de çok," dedim. "Defterime geçirdiğim son altı maceranın üçünde, kanunen bir suç işlenmemişti.
es: "Tanto es así", comenté, "que de los últimos seis casos que he añadido a mis notas, tres han estado totalmente libres de cualquier delito legal".
vi_translation: “On the contrary, quite a few,” I remarked. “Out of the last six cases that I have recorded, three did not involve any violation of the law at all.”
tr_translation: "A lot," I said. "In three of the last six adventures I recorded in my notebook, no crime had been committed by law."
es_translation: "So much so," I commented, "that of the last six cases I have added to my notes, three have been completely free of any legal crime."

en: “He brought round both hat and goose to me on Christmas morning, knowing that even the smallest problems are of interest to me. The goose we retained until this morning, when there were signs that, in spite of the slight frost, it would be well that it should be eaten without unnecessary delay. Its finder has carried it off, therefore, to fulfil the ultimate destiny of a goose, while I continue to retain the hat of the unknown gentleman who lost his Christmas dinner.”
vi: “Anh ta đem cả chiếc mũ lẫn con ngỗng đến chỗ tôi vào buổi sáng Giáng sinh vì anh ta biết rằng tôi quan tâm đến cả những vấn đề nhỏ nhặt nhất. Con ngỗng được chúng tôi giữ lại cho đến tận sáng nay, khi mà tuy trời khá lạnh nhưng đã xuất hiện những dấu hiệu cho thấy phải ăn thịt nó ngay chứ không thể chần chừ thêm nữa. Người vớ được nó đã đem hóa kiếp rồi, còn tôi vẫn giữ chiếc mũ của một quý ông vô danh đã đánh mất nó trong đêm Giáng sinh.
tr: "Böyle eften püften problemlerle bile ilgilendiğimi bildiği için, Noel sabahı, şapkayla kazı bana getirdi. Havanın epey soğuk olmasına rağmen, artık daha fazla geciktirilmeden yenmesi gerektiğini düşünerek kazı Peterson'a verdim. Noel ziyafetini kaybeden meçhul adamın şapkası da bende kaldı.
es: "Me trajo tanto el sombrero como el ganso en la mañana de Navidad, sabiendo que hasta los problemas más pequeños me interesan. El ganso lo retuvimos hasta esta mañana, cuando hubo indicios de que, a pesar de la ligera helada, sería bueno que se comiera sin demora innecesaria. Su buscador se lo ha llevado, por tanto, para cumplir el destino final de un ganso, mientras que yo sigo reteniendo el sombrero del caballero desconocido que perdió su cena de Navidad."
vi_translation: “He brought both the hat and the goose to me on Christmas morning because he knew that I was interested in even the smallest matters. We kept the goose until this morning, when, although it was quite cold, there were signs that we had to cook it immediately and could not delay any longer. The person who found it has already prepared it, while I still have the hat of an unknown gentleman who lost it on Christmas Eve.”
tr_translation: "Because he knew that I even dealt with such trivial problems, on Christmas morning, he brought me the hat and the goose. Despite the weather being quite cold, I thought it should be eaten without further delay and gave the goose to Peterson. The hat of the unknown man who lost his Christmas feast also remained with me."
es_translation: "He brought me both the hat and the goose on Christmas morning, knowing that even the smallest problems interest me. We kept the goose until this morning, when there were indications that, despite the slight frost, it would be good to eat it without unnecessary delay. Its seeker has taken it, therefore, to fulfill the final destiny of a goose, while I continue to retain the hat of the unknown gentleman who lost his Christmas dinner."

en: Our visitor gave a rather shamefaced laugh. “Shillings have not been so plentiful with me as they once were,” he remarked. “I had no doubt that the gang of roughs who assaulted me had carried off both my hat and the bird. I did not care to spend more money in a hopeless attempt at recovering them.”
vi: Người khách khẽ cười với vẻ ngượng ngùng. “Độ này tôi không còn dư dả tiền bạc như trước”, ông ta nói. “Tôi cũng chắc mẩm rằng bọn du côn tấn công tôi đã đem cả chiếc mũ lẫn con ngỗng đi. Tôi không muốn phải chi tiền để thử làm một việc vô vọng là tìm kiếm hai món đó.”
tr: Misafirimiz biraz utangaç bir edayla güldü. "Eskisi kadar paralı biri değilim artık," dedi. "Bana saldıran serserilerin şapkamı da kazı da aldıklarını düşünmüştüm. Onları bulmaya yönelik umutsuz bir çabayla daha fazla para harcamak istemedim.
es: Nuestro visitante soltó una carcajada algo avergonzada. "Los chelines ya no son tan abundantes para mí como antes", comentó. "No tenía ninguna duda de que la banda de rufianes que me asaltó se había llevado tanto mi sombrero como el pájaro. No me interesaba gastar más dinero en un intento desesperado de recuperarlos".
vi_translation: The guest smiled shyly. “These days, I am not as financially well-off as before,” he said. “I am quite certain that the thugs who attacked me took both the hat and the goose.” “I do not want to spend money on a futile attempt to search for those two items.”
tr_translation: Our guest laughed with a slightly shy demeanor. "I'm not as wealthy as I used to be anymore," he said. "I thought the thugs who attacked me had also taken my hat and my money. I didn't want to spend more money in a desperate attempt to find them."
es_translation: Our visitor let out a somewhat embarrassed laugh. "Shillings are not as abundant for me as they used to be," he remarked. "I had no doubt that the gang of ruffians who assaulted me had taken both my hat and the bird. I wasn't interested in spending more money in a desperate attempt to recover them."

en: “Now, then, mister,” said he, with his head cocked and his arms akimbo, “what are you driving at? Let’s have it straight, now.”
vi: “Này, ông kia”, ông ta kêu lên, đầu ngẩng cao và hai tay chống nạnh, “ông muốn gì đây? Nói thẳng ra xem.”
tr: Eli belinde satıcı, kafasını ileri uzatarak meydan okurcasına "Pekâlâ, bayım," dedi, "amacınız ne? Açıkça söyleyin de bilelim.
es: "Entonces, señor", dijo, con la cabeza ladeada y los brazos en alto, "¿a qué quiere llegar? Aclaremos las cosas, ahora".
vi_translation: "Hey, you there," he shouted, head held high and hands on hips, "what do you want? Speak plainly."
tr_translation: The vendor, with his hands on his hips, thrust his head forward defiantly and said, "Alright, sir, what is your purpose? Speak plainly so we can understand."
es_translation: "So, sir," he said, with his head tilted and arms raised, "what are you getting at? Let's clear things up now."

en: “Warm! You’d be as warm, maybe, if you were as pestered as I am. When I pay good money for a good article there should be an end of the business; but it’s ‘Where are the geese?’ and ‘Who did you sell the geese to?’ and ‘What will you take for the geese?’ One would think they were the only geese in the world, to hear the fuss that is made over them.”
vi: “Nổi nóng à? Ông cũng sẽ nổi nóng như thế nếu cứ bị quấy rầy như tôi. Khi tôi đã trả tiền đầy đủ cho một món hàng tốt thì coi như xong; đằng này lại còn hỏi han, ‘Này, ngỗng đâu hết rồi?’ rồi lại ‘ông bán ngỗng cho ai đấy?’ với cả ‘ông bán ngỗng được bao nhiêu tiền?’ Làm gì mà nhặng xị cả lên, ai nghe lại tưởng trên đời chỉ có bấy nhiêu ngỗng không bằng.
tr: "Sinirlenmek ha? Benim gibi rahatsız edilseydiniz siz de sinirlenirdiniz bayım. İyi bir mala iyi bir para ödedim mi benim işim biter. Ama birileri çıkıp da, ‘Kazlar nerede?', ‘Kazları kime sattın?', ‘Karşılığında ne aldın?' gibi sorular sorarsa cinlerim tepeme çıkar. Çıkarılan yaygarayı duyan da dünyada onlardan başka kaz yokmuş sanır.
es: "¡Caliente! Tú estarías igual de caliente, tal vez, si te molestaran tanto como a mí. Cuando pago un buen dinero por un buen artículo, debería acabarse el asunto; pero se trata de "¿Dónde están los gansos?" y "¿A quién le vendiste los gansos?" y "¿Cuánto quieres por los gansos? Uno pensaría que son los únicos gansos del mundo, al escuchar el alboroto que se hace por ellos."
vi_translation: “Angry? You would be just as angry if you were constantly bothered like I am. When I have paid in full for a good item, that's the end of it; but then people keep asking, ‘Hey, where are the geese?’ and ‘Who did you sell the geese to?’ and ‘How much did you sell the geese for?’ Why make such a fuss, anyone would think there were only that many geese in the world.”
tr_translation: "Getting angry, huh? If you were disturbed like I was, you would get angry too, sir. Once I pay a good price for a good product, my business is done. But if someone comes up and asks questions like, 'Where are the geese?', 'To whom did you sell the geese?', 'What did you get in return?', it drives me crazy. Anyone hearing the commotion would think there were no other geese in the world."
es_translation: "Hot!" "You would be just as hot, maybe, if you were bothered as much as I am." "When I pay good money for a good item, that should be the end of it; but it's all 'Where are the geese?' and 'Who did you sell the geese to?' and 'How much do you want for the geese?' One would think they are the only geese in the world, listening to the fuss made over them."

en: “Precisely so. Head attendant at the Hotel Cosmopolitan. Pray step into the cab, and I shall soon be able to tell you everything which you would wish to know.”
vi: “Đúng vậy. Ông là trưởng nhóm phục vụ của khách sạn Cosmopolitan. Xin hãy vui lòng bước lên xe và tôi sẽ kể cho ông nghe những gì ông muốn biết.”
tr: "Elbette! Cosmopolitan Oteli'nden. Rica ederim arabaya binin de, size öğrenmek istediğiniz her şeyi hemen anlatayım.
es: "Precisamente. Jefe de personal del Hotel Cosmopolitan. Por favor, suba al taxi y pronto podré contarle todo lo que desee saber".
vi_translation: “That's right. You are the head of the service team at the Cosmopolitan Hotel. Please step into the car and I will tell you what you want to know.”
tr_translation: "Of course! From the Cosmopolitan Hotel. Please get in the car, and I will immediately tell you everything you want to know."
es_translation: "Precisely. Chief of staff at the Cosmopolitan Hotel. Please, get in the taxi and soon I will be able to tell you everything you want to know."

en: “Yes, and a most remarkable bird it proved. I don’t wonder that you should take an interest in it. It laid an egg after it was dead—the bonniest, brightest little blue egg that ever was seen. I have it here in my museum.”
vi: “Đúng vậy, và là một con ngỗng rất khác thường. Tôi không hề ngạc nhiên nếu ông quan tâm đến nó. Sau khi chết, nó còn đẻ được một quả trứng, một quả trứng màu xanh nhỏ xíu sáng lấp lánh và tuyệt đẹp mà chưa ai từng thấy. Tôi hãy còn giữ nó trong bảo tàng của mình.”
tr: Ne kazmış değil mi! Ona bu kadar ilgi göstermenize şaşırmıyorum. Öldükten sonra küçük bir yumurta çıkardı; mavi renkte şimdiye kadar görülmüş en güzel, en parlak yumurta. Onu burada, kendi müzemde saklıyorum.
es: "Sí, y resultó ser un pájaro muy notable. No me sorprende que se interese por ella. Puso un huevo después de muerto, el huevo azul más bonito y brillante que jamás se haya visto. Lo tengo aquí en mi museo".
vi_translation: “That's right, and it was a very unusual goose. I wouldn't be surprised if you were interested in it. After it died, it laid an egg, a tiny, sparkling, beautiful blue egg that no one had ever seen before. I still keep it in my museum.”
tr_translation: What a dig, right! I'm not surprised you show so much interest in it. After it died, it produced a small egg; the most beautiful, brightest blue egg ever seen. I keep it here, in my own museum."
es_translation: "Yes, and it turned out to be a very remarkable bird. I'm not surprised that you are interested in it. It laid an egg after it died, the most beautiful and shiny blue egg that has ever been seen. I have it here in my museum."

en: “The family was at one time among the richest in England, and the estates extended over the borders into Berkshire in the north, and Hampshire in the west. In the last century, however, four successive heirs were of a dissolute and wasteful disposition, and the family ruin was eventually completed by a gambler in the days of the Regency. Nothing was left save a few acres of ground, and the two-hundred-year-old house, which is itself crushed under a heavy mortgage. The last squire dragged out his existence there, living the horrible life of an aristocratic pauper; but his only son, my stepfather, seeing that he must adapt himself to the new conditions, obtained an advance from a relative, which enabled him to take a medical degree and went out to Calcutta, where, by his professional skill and his force of character, he established a large practice. In a fit of anger, however, caused by some robberies which had been perpetrated in the house, he beat his native butler to death and narrowly escaped a capital sentence. As it was, he suffered a long term of imprisonment and afterwards returned to England a morose and disappointed man.
vi: “Đã có thời dòng họ này được xếp vào hàng giàu có bậc nhất nước Anh và những điền trang của họ trải dài qua các ranh giới đến tận Berkshire ở phía bắc và Hampshire ở phía tây. Tuy nhiên, đến thế kỉ vừa rồi, bốn thế hệ liên tiếp đã chơi bời phóng đãng và tiêu xài phung phí, để rồi cuối cùng dòng họ ấy hoàn toàn suy tàn bởi một con bạc trong thời kì Nhiếp chính[114].” “Gia sản chẳng còn gì ngoại trừ vài mẫu đất và một căn nhà đã hai trăm năm tuổi, mà căn nhà này cũng đã đem ra cầm cố. Người điền chủ cuối cùng đã mòn mỏi sống cuộc đời thảm hại của một nhà quý tộc nghèo túng ở đó, nhưng người con trai duy nhất của ông, tức là cha dượng tôi, đã nhận ra mình phải thích nghi với hoàn cảnh mới. Ông được một người bà con cho vay một món tiền giúp ông học lên cao và lấy được tấm bằng bác sĩ rồi đi Calcutta, ở đó, nhờ vào tay nghề và tính cách mạnh mẽ, ông đã mở được một phòng khám lớn. Tuy nhiên, trong một lần cả giận mất khôn vì vài vụ trộm xảy ra trong nhà, ông đã đánh viên quản gia người bản xứ đến chết và suýt thì lĩnh án tử hình.
tr: "Bu aile, bir zamanlar İngiltere'nin en zenginleri arasında yer alıyormuş, ama geçen yüzyılda tüm serveti har vurup harman savuran dört kardeş yüzünden felaketlere sürüklenmiş. Sonunda bir kumarbaz, ailenin yıkımına neden olan darbeyi vurmuş. Birkaç dönüm arazi ve ağır ipotek altındaki iki yüzyıllık bir evden başka bir şey kalmamış geriye. Roylott'ların son temsilcisi, yoksul bir asil olmanın verdiği utançla hayatını o evde tamamladı. Tek oğlu, yani benim üvey babam, bu yeni koşullara boyun eğmemiş, bir akrabadan borç istemiş. Bu parayla tıp eğitimini tamamlayıp Kalküta'ya gitmiş. İyi bir doktormuş ama haris bir adammış. Kısa zamanda muayenehanesi çok iyi işlemeye başlamış. Fakat bir gün, evinde meydana gelen bir hırsızlık nedeniyle öfkeye kapılıp yerli uşağını döverek öldürmüş; bu yüzden de darağacından kıl payı kurtulmuş. Uzun yıllar hapiste kaldıktan sonra hayata küskün ve zalim bir adam olarak Londra'ya dönmüş.
es: "La familia fue en su día una de las más ricas de Inglaterra, y sus propiedades se extendían por las fronteras de Berkshire, en el norte, y Hampshire, en el oeste. Sin embargo, en el siglo pasado, cuatro herederos sucesivos tuvieron una disposición disoluta y derrochadora, y la ruina de la familia fue finalmente completada por un jugador en los días de la Regencia. No quedó nada más que unos pocos acres de tierra y la casa bicentenaria, que está aplastada por una pesada hipoteca. El último terrateniente arrastró su existencia allí, viviendo la horrible vida de un indigente aristocrático; pero su único hijo, mi padrastro, viendo que debía adaptarse a las nuevas condiciones, obtuvo un adelanto de un pariente, que le permitió obtener un título de médico y se fue a Calcuta, donde, por su habilidad profesional y su fuerza de carácter, estableció una gran práctica. Sin embargo, en un ataque de ira provocado por algunos robos que se habían perpetrado en la casa, mató a golpes a su mayordomo nativo y se libró por poco de una condena a la pena capital. Así las cosas, sufrió una larga condena en prisión y después regresó a Inglaterra como un hombre malhumorado y decepcionado”.
vi_translation: “There was a time when this family was considered one of the wealthiest in England, and their estates stretched across boundaries to Berkshire in the north and Hampshire in the west. However, by the last century, four successive generations had indulged in debauchery and squandered their wealth, until finally the family was completely ruined by a gambler during the Regency period[114].” “The estate had nothing left except for a few acres of land and a two-hundred-year-old house, which had already been mortgaged. The last landowner had lived out his miserable life as a poor nobleman there, but his only son, my stepfather, realized he had to adapt to the new circumstances. He borrowed some money from a relative to help him pursue higher education and obtain a medical degree, then went to Calcutta, where, thanks to his skills and strong character, he opened a large clinic. However, in a fit of rage over a few thefts in the house, he beat the native butler to death and narrowly escaped a death sentence. In that situation, he had to serve a long prison sentence and then returned to England, becoming a gloomy and disheartened man.
tr_translation: "This family was once among the wealthiest in England, but in the past century, it was driven to ruin by four siblings who squandered all the fortune. In the end, a gambler delivered the blow that led to the family's downfall. All that remained were a few acres of land and a two-century-old house heavily mortgaged. The last representative of the Roylotts completed his life in that house, burdened by the shame of being a poor noble. His only son, my stepfather, did not submit to these new circumstances and borrowed money from a relative. With this money, he completed his medical education and went to Calcutta. He was a good doctor but a greedy man. In a short time, his practice began to thrive. But one day, enraged by a theft in his home, he beat his native servant to death; he narrowly escaped the gallows because of this. After spending many years in prison, he returned to London as a bitter and cruel man.
es_translation: "The family was once one of the richest in England, and their properties extended to the borders of Berkshire in the north and Hampshire in the west. However, in the last century, four successive heirs had a dissolute and wasteful disposition, and the family's ruin was finally completed by a gambler in the Regency days. Nothing remained but a few acres of land and the two-hundred-year-old house, which is burdened by a heavy mortgage. The last landowner dragged out his existence there, living the horrible life of an aristocratic pauper; but his only son, my stepfather, seeing that he had to adapt to the new conditions, obtained an advance from a relative, which allowed him to obtain a medical degree and went to Calcutta, where, through his professional skill and strength of character, he established a large practice. However, in a fit of rage provoked by some thefts that had been perpetrated in the house, he beat his native butler to death and narrowly escaped a capital punishment sentence. As things stood, he suffered a long prison sentence and then returned to England as a moody and disappointed man."

en: “That was what the county coroner asked me at the inquiry. It is my strong impression that I heard it, and yet, among the crash of the gale and the creaking of an old house, I may possibly have been deceived.”
