vi: “Pháp y viên của hạt cũng hỏi tôi câu đó tại buổi thẩm vấn. Tôi có cảm giác rất rõ là mình đã nghe thấy những tiếng động ấy, tuy nhiên giữa tiếng ồn của cơn bão và những tiếng cót két phát ra từ căn nhà cũ thì cũng có thể tôi đã nghe lầm.
tr: "Bunu bana mahkemedeki yargıç da sorgulamada sordu. Duyduğuma eminim ama yine de fırtınanın gürültüsü ve eski evimizin çatırdama seslerinin arasında başka bir sesle karıştırmış olabilirim.
es: "Eso fue lo que me preguntó el forense del condado en la investigación. Tengo la firme impresión de que lo oí, y sin embargo, entre el estruendo del vendaval y el crujido de una casa vieja, es posible que me hayan engañado."
vi_translation: "The county coroner also asked me that question during the interrogation. I have a very clear feeling that I heard those sounds, but amidst the noise of the storm and the creaking sounds from the old house, it is possible that I misheard."
tr_translation: "The judge in the court also asked me this during the interrogation. I'm sure I heard it, but I might have mixed it up with another sound amidst the noise of the storm and the creaking of our old house."
es_translation: "That was what the county coroner asked me during the investigation. I have a strong impression that I heard it, and yet, between the roar of the gale and the creaking of an old house, it is possible that I was deceived."

en: “As it happens, he spoke of coming into town to-day upon some most important business. It is probable that he will be away all day, and that there would be nothing to disturb you. We have a housekeeper now, but she is old and foolish, and I could easily get her out of the way.”
vi: “Tình cờ làm sao, ông ấy có nói là hôm nay sẽ đi lên London để thu xếp một số công việc rất quan trọng. Có thể ông ấy sẽ phải vắng nhà cả ngày và sẽ chẳng có gì quấy rầy các ông. Hiện giờ chúng tôi có một người quản gia nhưng bà ấy đã già và rất ngờ nghệch, tôi có thể dễ dàng dụ bà ấy ra khỏi nhà.
tr: "Ne tesadüf, bugün olur çünkü dr Roylott önemli birkaç işini halletmek için şehre indi. Büyük ihtimalle eve geç döner. Sizi rahatsız edecek hiçbir şey olmaz. Evde şu anda bir hizmetçimiz var, ama kadın çok yaşlı ve kafası pek çalışmaz. Onu rahatlıkla yolumuzdan uzak tutabilirim.
es: "Resulta que ha hablado de venir hoy a la ciudad por un asunto muy importante. Es probable que esté fuera todo el día, y que no haya nada que te moleste. Ahora tenemos un ama de llaves, pero es vieja y tonta, y podría quitarla de en medio fácilmente."
vi_translation: "By chance, he mentioned that he would be going to London today to take care of some very important business. He might be away all day and there will be nothing to disturb you. Currently, we have a housekeeper, but she is old and very naive; I can easily lure her out of the house."
tr_translation: "What a coincidence, it happens today because Dr. Roylott went to the city to take care of some important business. He will probably return home late. There will be nothing to disturb you. We currently have a servant at home, but she is very old and not very sharp. I can easily keep her out of our way."
es_translation: "It turns out that he talked about coming to the city today for a very important matter. It is likely that he will be out all day, and that there will be nothing to bother you. Now we have a housekeeper, but she is old and foolish, and I could easily get her out of the way."

tr: "Ucu bir tele bile bağlanmamış. Bakın bu çok ilginç işte! Gördüğünüz gibi ufak vantilatörün üzerindeki bir çengele takılmış.

tr: "Bu iyi geldi!" dedi. "Şu başparmağıma bir bakar mısınız doktor? Daha doğrusu başparmağımın vaktiyle bulunduğu yere.
es: "¡Así está mejor!", dijo. "Y ahora, doctor, tal vez sea usted tan amable de atender mi pulgar, o más bien el lugar donde estaba mi pulgar".
vi_translation: "It's better now!" he said. "And now, doctor, perhaps you could take a look at my thumb, or rather where my thumb used to be."
tr_translation: "This felt good!" he said. "Doctor, could you please take a look at my thumb? Or rather, where my thumb used to be."
es_translation: "That's better!" he said. "And now, doctor, perhaps you would be so kind as to attend to my thumb, or rather the place where my thumb used to be."

en: “You must know,” said he, “that I am an orphan and a bachelor, residing alone in lodgings in London. By profession I am a hydraulic engineer, and I have had considerable experience of my work during the seven years that I was apprenticed to Venner & Matheson, the well-known firm, of Greenwich. Two years ago, having served my time, and having also come into a fair sum of money through my poor father’s death, I determined to start in business for myself and took professional chambers in Victoria Street.
vi: “Các ông cần biết rằng”, anh ta nói, “tôi không còn cha mẹ và chưa lập gia đình, hiện đang sống một mình trong nhà trọ ở London. Tôi hành nghề kĩ sư thủy lực và đã thu được khá nhiều kinh nghiệm sau bảy năm tập sự cho Venner & Matheson, một công ty nổi tiếng ở Greenwich. Hai năm trước, khi đã hết thời gian tập sự và được hưởng một món tiền thừa kế kha khá sau khi cha tôi mất, tôi quyết định sẽ mở công ty riêng và thuê văn phòng hành nghề trên phố Victoria.
tr: "Evvela bilmelisiniz ki, Londra'da tek başına yaşayan yetim ve bekâr biriyim ben. Su mühendisiyim ve yedi yıldır da Greenwich'teki ünlü Venner & Matheson firmasında çalışıyorum. İki yıl önce ihtisas yaptım; zavallı babamın ölümüyle elime para geçince, kendi işimi kurmaya karar verdim ve Victoria Caddesi'nde bir yazıhane tuttum.
es: "Deben saber -dijo- que soy huérfano y soltero, y que vivo solo en Londres. De profesión soy ingeniero hidráulico, y he tenido una considerable experiencia en mi trabajo durante los siete años que estuve como aprendiz en Venner & Matheson, la conocida firma de Greenwich. Hace dos años, después de haber cumplido mi tiempo, y habiendo conseguido una buena suma de dinero por la muerte de mi pobre padre, decidí empezar a trabajar por mi cuenta y alquilé un despacho profesional en Victoria Street.
vi_translation: “You need to know,” he said, “that I no longer have parents and am not married, currently living alone in a boarding house in London. I work as a hydraulic engineer and have gained quite a bit of experience after seven years of apprenticeship with Venner & Matheson, a renowned company in Greenwich. Two years ago, when my apprenticeship ended and I received a considerable inheritance after my father passed away, I decided to start my own company and rent an office on Victoria Street.
tr_translation: "First of all, you should know that I am an orphan and a bachelor living alone in London. I am a water engineer and have been working for the famous Venner & Matheson firm in Greenwich for seven years. Two years ago, I specialized; when I received money after my poor father's death, I decided to start my own business and rented an office on Victoria Street.
es_translation: "You should know," he said, "that I am an orphan and single, and that I live alone in London. By profession, I am a hydraulic engineer, and I have had considerable experience in my work during the seven years I spent as an apprentice at Venner & Matheson, the well-known firm in Greenwich. Two years ago, after completing my apprenticeship, and having received a good sum of money from the death of my poor father, I decided to start working on my own and rented a professional office on Victoria Street.

en: “‘We have judged it best that you should come late. It is to recompense you for any inconvenience that we are paying to you, a young and unknown man, a fee which would buy an opinion from the very heads of your profession. Still, of course, if you would like to draw out of the business, there is plenty of time to do so.’
vi: ‘Chúng tôi thấy rằng ông đến vào lúc khuya là tốt nhất. Và để đền bù cho những điều bất tiện nếu có, chúng tôi sẽ trả cho ông, một người trẻ tuổi và không có tiếng tăm, số tiền thù lao ngang với mức tham vấn của những chuyên gia hàng đầu trong ngành của ông. Tuy vậy, nếu ông muốn rút khỏi công việc này thì tất nhiên là vẫn còn kịp.
tr: " ‘Geç saatte gelmenizi özellikle istiyoruz. Aslında işinin doruğuna ulaşmış meslektaşlarınıza ödenecek parayı sizin gibi genç ve tanınmamış bir beyefendiye vermemizin sebebi de bu zaten. Ama isterseniz vazgeçebilirsiniz, henüz hiç birşey için geç değil tabii.
es: " 'Hemos considerado que es mejor que venga tarde. Es para recompensarle por cualquier inconveniente que le estamos pagando a usted, un hombre joven y desconocido, unos honorarios que comprarían una opinión de los mismos jefes de su profesión. Pero, por supuesto, si quiere retirarse del negocio, tiene tiempo de sobra para hacerlo'".
vi_translation: ‘We find that it is best for you to arrive late at night. And to compensate for any inconvenience, we will pay you, a young and unknown individual, a fee equivalent to the consultation rates of the top experts in your field. However, if you wish to withdraw from this job, it is of course still possible.’
tr_translation: " 'We specifically want you to come at a late hour. In fact, the reason we are paying you, a young and unknown gentleman, instead of your colleagues who have reached the peak of their careers, is precisely this. But if you want, you can back out; it's not too late for anything yet, of course.'
es_translation: " 'We have considered that it is better for you to come late. It is to compensate you for any inconvenience that we are paying you, a young and unknown man, fees that would buy an opinion from the very heads of your profession. But, of course, if you want to withdraw from the business, you have plenty of time to do so'".

en: “I glanced at the books upon the table, and in spite of my ignorance of German I could see that two of them were treatises on science, the others being volumes of poetry. Then I walked across to the window, hoping that I might catch some glimpse of the country-side, but an oak shutter, heavily barred, was folded across it. It was a wonderfully silent house. There was an old clock ticking loudly somewhere in the passage, but otherwise everything was deadly still. A vague feeling of uneasiness began to steal over me. Who were these German people, and what were they doing living in this strange, out-of-the-way place? And where was the place? I was ten miles or so from Eyford, that was all I knew, but whether north, south, east, or west I had no idea. For that matter, Reading, and possibly other large towns, were within that radius, so the place might not be so secluded, after all. Yet it was quite certain, from the absolute stillness, that we were in the country. I paced up and down the room, humming a tune under my breath to keep up my spirits and feeling that I was thoroughly earning my fifty-guinea fee.
vi: Tôi liếc qua mấy cuốn sách nằm trên bàn và dù chẳng biết một chữ tiếng Đức, tôi vẫn có thể nhận ra hai trong số đó là những chuyên luận khoa học, còn mấy cuốn khác là những tập thơ. Rồi tôi bước lại gần cửa sổ, hi vọng sẽ được nhìn thấy khung cảnh đồng quê, thế nhưng một cánh cửa chớp bằng gỗ sồi với những chấn song chắc chắn đã che kín nó. Đó là một căn nhà rất tĩnh lặng. Ngoài một chiếc đồng hồ cũ kêu tích tắc ở đâu đó trong hành lang thì mọi thứ đều câm lặng như chết. Một cảm giác lo lắng mơ hồ bắt đầu len vào lòng tôi. Những người Đức này là ai, tại sao họ lại sống trong căn nhà lạ lùng, tách biệt này? Và đây là đâu? Tôi đang ở cách Eyford khoảng mười dặm, chỉ biết thế thôi, ngoài ra đang ở hướng bắc, nam, đông hay tây thì tôi hoàn toàn mù tịt. Về vấn đề này, xét cho cùng thì Readỉng và có lẽ là cả những thị trấn lớn khác nữa đều nằm trong tầm bán kính này nên có thể ngôi nhà cũng không đến nỗi quá hẻo lánh. Tuy nhiên, dựa vào sự tĩnh mịch tuyệt đối thì có thể biết chắc rằng chúng tôi đang ở một vùng nông thôn. Tôi đi đi lại lại trong phòng, ngân nga nho nhỏ một giai điệu để giữ vững tinh thần và cảm thấy như mình đã lĩnh trọn vẹn món thù lao năm mươi guinea rồi.
tr: "Masanın üzerindeki kitaplara bir göz attım. Almanca bilmem ama, bunların içinden sadece iki tanesi bilimle ilgiliydi, diğerleri şiir kitaplarıydı. Manzarayı merak edip dışarısını görebilmek için pencereye yanaştım, ama meşeden yapılma panjurlar sımsıkı kapalıydı. Ev çok sessizdi. Holün bir yerinde, yüksek sesle tik tak eden eski bir saatin sesini duyabiliyordum sadece. Huzursuz olmaya başladım. Kimdi bu Almanlar ve bu gözden ırak garip yerde neden yaşıyorlardı? Burası neresiydi? Eyford'dan on mil uzaktaydım; tek bildiğim buydu. Kuzeye mi, güneye mi, doğuya mı yoksa batıya mı düşüyordu, bu konuda hiçbir fikrim yoktu. Reading ve büyük ihtimalle diğer büyük kasabalar da on millik bir çevre içinde kalıyordu, yani burası belki de sandığım kadar tenha bir yer değildi. Yine de etraftaki sessizliğe bakınca şehir dışında olduğumuz kesindi. Odanın içinde, bir aşağıya bir yukarıya dolanıyor, moralimi düzeltmek için kendi kendime sessizce bir şarkı mırıldanıyordum; elli Gine'yi hak etmiştim doğrusu.
es: "Eché un vistazo a los libros que había sobre la mesa y, a pesar de mi ignorancia del alemán, pude ver que dos de ellos eran tratados de ciencia y los otros eran volúmenes de poesía. Luego me acerqué a la ventana, con la esperanza de poder vislumbrar el campo, pero una persiana de roble, fuertemente enrejada, estaba plegada sobre ella. Era una casa maravillosamente silenciosa. Había un viejo reloj que sonaba con fuerza en algún lugar del pasillo, pero por lo demás todo estaba mortalmente quieto. Una vaga sensación de inquietud comenzó a invadirme. ¿Quiénes eran estos alemanes y qué hacían viviendo en este extraño y apartado lugar? ¿Y dónde estaba el lugar? Estaba a unos quince kilómetros de Eyford, eso era todo lo que sabía, pero no tenía ni idea de si estaba al norte, al sur, al este o al oeste. Además, Reading, y posiblemente otras grandes ciudades, se encontraban en ese radio, por lo que el lugar podría no estar tan aislado, después de todo. Sin embargo, estaba bastante seguro, por la absoluta quietud, de que estábamos en el campo. Me paseé de un lado a otro de la habitación, tarareando una melodía en voz baja para mantener el ánimo y sintiendo que me estaba ganando a pulso mis honorarios de cincuenta guineas."
vi_translation: I glanced over the books lying on the table and, despite not knowing a word of German, I could still recognize that two of them were scientific treatises, while the others were poetry collections. Then I walked closer to the window, hoping to see the countryside, but an oak shutter with sturdy bars had completely covered it. It was a very quiet house. Aside from an old clock ticking somewhere in the hallway, everything was as silent as death. A vague sense of anxiety began to creep into my heart. Who were these Germans, and why did they live in this strange, isolated house? And where was this place? I was about ten miles from Eyford, that much I knew, but whether I was to the north, south, east, or west, I had no idea. Regarding this matter, after all, Reading and perhaps other large towns as well were within this radius, so the house might not be too remote. However, based on the absolute stillness, it was certain that we were in a rural area. I paced back and forth in the room, humming a tune softly to keep my spirits up and felt as if I had already fully earned the fifty guinea fee.
tr_translation: "I glanced at the books on the table. I don't know German, but only two of them were about science, the others were poetry books. Curious about the view, I moved to the window to see outside, but the oak shutters were tightly closed. The house was very quiet. In some part of the hall, I could only hear the loud ticking of an old clock. I started to feel uneasy. Who were these Germans and why were they living in this secluded, strange place? Where was this place? I was ten miles away from Eyford; that was all I knew. Whether it was to the north, south, east, or west, I had no idea. Reading and probably other large towns were also within a ten-mile radius, so maybe this place wasn't as remote as I thought. Yet, looking at the silence around, it was clear we were outside the city. Inside the room, I paced up and down, quietly humming a song to lift my spirits; I truly deserved the fifty Guineas.
es_translation: "I glanced at the books on the table and, despite my ignorance of German, I could see that two of them were science treatises and the others were volumes of poetry. Then I approached the window, hoping to catch a glimpse of the countryside, but an oak shutter, heavily barred, was folded over it. It was a wonderfully silent house. There was an old clock that chimed loudly somewhere in the hallway, but otherwise everything was deathly quiet. A vague sense of unease began to creep over me. Who were these Germans and what were they doing living in this strange and secluded place? And where was the place? It was about fifteen kilometers from Eyford, that was all I knew, but I had no idea whether it was to the north, south, east, or west. Moreover, Reading, and possibly other large cities, were within that radius, so the place might not be so isolated after all. However, I was quite sure, from the absolute stillness, that we were in the countryside. I paced back and forth across the room, humming a tune softly to keep my spirits up and feeling that I was earning my fifty-guinea fee."

en: “‘But, madam,’ said I, ‘I have not yet done what I came for. I cannot possibly leave until I have seen the machine.’
vi: ‘Nhưng, thưa bà,’ tôi nói. ‘Tôi vẫn chưa thực hiện công việc mà tôi đã đến đây để làm. Tôi không thể bỏ đi khi chưa trông thấy cỗ máy.
tr: "Ama hanımefendi," dedim, "henüz görevimi tamamlamadım. Makineyi görmeden gidemem ki...
es: "'Pero, señora' -dije-, 'todavía no he hecho lo que he venido a hacer. No puedo irme hasta que haya visto la máquina'".
vi_translation: ‘But, madam,’ I said. ‘I still haven't done the work I came here to do. I cannot leave without seeing the machine.’
tr_translation: "But ma'am," I said, "I haven't completed my task yet. I can't leave without seeing the machine..."
es_translation: "'But, madam,' I said, 'I still haven't done what I came to do. I can't leave until I have seen the machine'".

en: “I felt angry at having been tricked by so elaborate a story as that which he had told me. ‘I was admiring your fuller’s-earth,’ said I; ‘I think that I should be better able to advise you as to your machine if I knew what the exact purpose was for which it was used.’
vi: Tôi tức giận vì bị lừa gạt bởi câu chuyện tinh vi mà ông ta đã bịa ra. ‘Tôi đang ngắm nhìn mớ đất tẩy màu của ông’, tôi đáp, ‘tôi nghĩ mình có thể tư vấn tốt hơn cho ông về cỗ máy này nếu tôi được biết chính xác mục đích sử dụng của nó.
tr: "Bana anlattığı saçma hikâyeye inandığım için kızmıştım. ‘Hayranlıkla, killi toprağın kalitesini seyrediyordum,' dedim. ‘Makinenin gerçekte neye yaradığını bilsem size daha iyi öneride bulunurdum.
es: "Me sentí enfadado por haber sido engañado con una historia tan elaborada como la que me había contado. Estaba admirando su tierra de batán -dije-. Creo que podría aconsejarle mejor sobre su máquina si supiera para qué se utiliza exactamente.
vi_translation: I am angry because I was deceived by the sophisticated story he made up. ‘I am looking at your bleached land,’ I replied, ‘I think I can give you better advice about this machine if I know exactly what it is used for.’
tr_translation: "I was angry because I believed the ridiculous story he told me. 'I was admiring the quality of the clay soil,' I said. 'If I knew what the machine was actually for, I would give you better advice.'
es_translation: "I felt angry for having been deceived with such an elaborate story as the one he had told me. I was admiring your fulling mill land - I said -. I think I could advise you better about your machine if I knew exactly what it is used for.

en: “The instant that I uttered the words I regretted the rashness of my speech. His face set hard, and a baleful light sprang up in his grey eyes.
vi: Vừa dứt lời, tôi chợt thấy hối hận ngay vì đã không suy nghĩ kĩ trước khi nói. Mặt ông ta đanh lại và đôi mắt xám lóe lên tia nhìn độc địa.
tr: "Bunu söyler söylemez o kadar sert konuştuğuma pişman oldum. Albay suratını astı, dumanlı gözlerinde uğursuz bir ışık belirdi.
es: "En el instante en que pronuncié estas palabras me arrepentí de la imprudencia de mi discurso. Su rostro se endureció y en sus ojos grises surgió una luz torva.
vi_translation: As soon as I finished speaking, I immediately regretted not thinking carefully before I spoke. His face hardened and his gray eyes flashed with a malicious look.
tr_translation: "As soon as I said it, I regretted speaking so harshly. The Colonel frowned, a sinister light appeared in his smoky eyes.
es_translation: "The moment I uttered these words, I regretted the imprudence of my speech. His face hardened and a grim light appeared in his gray eyes.

en: “I was shaken but not hurt by the fall; so I picked myself up and rushed off among the bushes as hard as I could run, for I understood that I was far from being out of danger yet. Suddenly, however, as I ran, a deadly dizziness and sickness came over me. I glanced down at my hand, which was throbbing painfully, and then, for the first time, saw that my thumb had been cut off and that the blood was pouring from my wound. I endeavoured to tie my handkerchief round it, but there came a sudden buzzing in my ears, and next moment I fell in a dead faint among the rose-bushes.
vi: Tôi bị chấn động bởi cú ngã nhưng không bị thương; do đó tôi nhổm dậy và cố hết sức chạy vào giữa những bụi cây vì tôi biết mối nguy hiểm còn đang cận kề. Tuy nhiên, trong lúc đang chạy thì bất thình lình tôi bị choáng váng và buồn nôn kinh khủng. Tôi liếc nhìn xuống bàn tay hãy còn đang đau nhói và bấy giờ mới thấy ngón tay cái của mình đã bị cắt rời và máu đang tuôn ra từ vết thương. Tôi gắng sức buộc khăn mùi soa quanh chỗ bị thương nhưng tai tôi chợt ù đi và liền sau đó, tôi ngã xuống bất tỉnh giữa những bụi hoa hồng.
tr: "Oldukça sarsılmıştım ama hiçbir yerim incinmemişti. Hâlâ tehlikede olduğumun farkındaydım, onun için ayağa kalktım ve tüm gücümle çalıların arasına daldım. Koşarken, birdenbire şiddetli bir baş dönmesi ve mide bulantısı hissettim. Acıyla zonklayan elime baktım ve ilk defa o zaman baş parmağımın olmadığını ve yaramdan kan fışkırdığını gördüm. Mendille sarmaya uğraştıysam da kulaklarım ansızın çınlamaya başladı, o anda gül fidanlarının arasına düşüp bayıldım.
es: "La caída me sacudió, pero no me lastimó; así que me levanté y corrí entre los arbustos tan fuerte como pude, pues comprendí que estaba lejos de estar fuera de peligro. Sin embargo, de repente, mientras corría, me sobrevino un mareo y un malestar mortales. Miré mi mano, que palpitaba dolorosamente, y entonces, por primera vez, vi que me habían cortado el pulgar y que la sangre brotaba de mi herida. Intenté atar mi pañuelo alrededor de la herida, pero de repente sentí un zumbido en los oídos, y al momento siguiente caí desmayado entre los rosales.
vi_translation: I was shaken by the fall but not injured; thus, I got up and tried my best to run into the bushes because I knew the danger was still close. However, while running, I suddenly felt dizzy and terribly nauseous. I glanced down at my still throbbing hand and only then saw that my thumb had been severed and blood was pouring from the wound. I tried to tie a handkerchief around the injury, but my ears suddenly rang, and immediately after, I collapsed unconscious among the rose bushes.
tr_translation: "I was quite shaken, but I wasn't hurt anywhere. I was still aware that I was in danger, so I got up and plunged into the bushes with all my strength. While running, I suddenly felt a severe dizziness and nausea. I looked at my hand, throbbing with pain, and for the first time, I saw that my thumb was missing and blood was gushing from my wound. Though I tried to wrap it with a handkerchief, my ears suddenly started ringing, and at that moment, I fell among the rose bushes and fainted.
es_translation: "The fall shook me, but it did not hurt me; so I got up and ran through the bushes as hard as I could, for I understood that I was far from being out of danger. However, suddenly, as I was running, a deadly dizziness and nausea overcame me. I looked at my hand, which was throbbing painfully, and then, for the first time, I saw that my thumb had been cut off and that blood was gushing from my wound. I tried to tie my handkerchief around the wound, but suddenly I felt a buzzing in my ears, and the next moment I fell unconscious among the rose bushes.

en: “There you are,” said he. “That circle is drawn at a radius of ten miles from the village. The place we want must be somewhere near that line. You said ten miles, I think, sir.”
vi: Ông ta nói, “Đây, vòng tròn này có bán kính là mười dặm tính từ ngôi làng. Ngôi nhà mà ta muốn tìm phải nằm ở đâu đó gần đường thẳng này. Ông đã nói là mười dặm, đúng không?”
tr: "İşte burası," dedi, "kasabanın etrafında on millik bir yarıçap. Aradığımız yer bu çemberin dışına yakın bir yer olmalı. Sanırım on mil demiştiniz, öyle değil mi bayım.
es: "Ahí está", dijo. "Ese círculo está dibujado en un radio de diez millas desde el pueblo. El lugar que queremos debe estar en algún lugar cerca de esa línea. Usted dijo diez millas, creo, señor".
vi_translation: He said, “Here, this circle has a radius of ten miles from the village. The house we are looking for must be somewhere near this line. You said ten miles, right?”
tr_translation: "Here it is," he said, "a ten-mile radius around the town. The place we're looking for should be somewhere near the edge of this circle. I believe you said ten miles, didn't you, sir."
es_translation: "There it is," he said. "That circle is drawn within a radius of ten miles from the town. The place we want must be somewhere near that line. You said ten miles, I believe, sir."

en: “Oh, yes, you can. This is my point.” He placed his finger in the centre of the circle. “This is where we shall find them.”
vi: “Ồ, có chứ, có thể lắm. Đây là điểm tôi chọn.” Anh đặt ngón tay vào chính giữa vòng tròn. “Đây là nơi ta sẽ tìm thấy bọn chúng.”
tr: "Ama yanılıyorsunuz," dedi Holmes. "İşte benim yerim şurası," diyerek parmağını dairenin tam merkezine koydu. "İşte, onları burada bulacağız.
es: "Oh, sí, se puede. Este es mi punto". Colocó su dedo en el centro del círculo. "Aquí es donde los encontraremos".
vi_translation: "Oh, yes, it's quite possible." "This is the spot I've chosen." He placed his finger in the center of the circle. "This is where we will find them."
tr_translation: "But you are mistaken," said Holmes. "Here is my place," he said, placing his finger right in the center of the circle. "Here, we will find them."
es_translation: "Oh, yes, it can be done. This is my point." He placed his finger in the center of the circle. "This is where we will find them."

en: “Indeed, it is a likely ruse enough,” observed Bradstreet thoughtfully. “Of course there can be no doubt as to the nature of this gang.”
vi: “Quả thật khả năng chúng dùng thủ đoạn này cùng lớn lắm”, Bradstreet thận trọng nhận xét. “Tất nhiên là không còn nghi ngờ gì về bản chất của băng đảng này!”
tr: "Tamam, şimdi numarayı anladım," dedi Bradstreet, düşünceli bir şekilde. "Çetenin yaptığı şey gün gibi âşıkâr.
es: "En efecto, es una argucia bastante probable", observó Bradstreet pensativo. "Desde luego, no puede haber ninguna duda sobre la naturaleza de esta banda".
vi_translation: “Indeed, the likelihood of them using this method is quite high,” Bradstreet cautiously remarked. “Of course, there is no longer any doubt about the nature of this gang!”
tr_translation: "Alright, now I understand the trick," said Bradstreet thoughtfully. "What the gang did is as clear as day."
es_translation: "Indeed, it is quite a likely ruse," observed Bradstreet thoughtfully. "Of course, there can be no doubt about the nature of this gang."

en: “We have known for some time that a clever gang was at work,” said the inspector. “They have been turning out half-crowns by the thousand. We even traced them as far as Reading, but could get no farther, for they had covered their traces in a way that showed that they were very old hands. But now, thanks to this lucky chance, I think that we have got them right enough.”
vi: “Chúng tôi có biết về một băng đảng khôn khéo đang hoạt động”, ông thanh tra nói. “Chúng đã sản xuất ra cả ngàn đồng nửa crown. Thậm chí chúng tôi đã từng lần theo dấu vết của chúng đến tận Reading nhưng không thể làm được gì hơn vì bọn chúng đã xóa dấu vết bằng những cách thức chứng tỏ chúng là những tay lão luyện. Nhưng giờ thì, nhờ vào dịp may này, tôi nghĩ rằng ta chắc chắn sẽ tóm được chúng.
tr: "Son zamanlarda kurnaz bir çetenin bu işin içinde olduğunu biliyorduk," dedi Müfettiş. "Binlerce madeni parayı piyasaya sürdüler. Reading'e kadar izlerini takip ettik ama izlerini büyük bir ustalıkla silmiş oldukları için maalesef daha ileri gidememiştik. Bu da işlerinin ehli olduklarım gösteriyor. Ama şimdi, elimize geçen bu güzel fırsat sayesinde yakalarına yapışabileceğiz"
es: "Hace tiempo que sabemos que una banda astuta estaba trabajando", dijo el inspector. "Han estado produciendo medias coronas por miles. Incluso les seguimos la pista hasta Reading, pero no pudimos llegar más lejos, porque habían cubierto sus huellas de una manera que demostraba que eran gente muy veterana. Pero ahora, gracias a esta afortunada casualidad, creo que hemos acertado de pleno".
vi_translation: “We are aware of a cunning gang operating,” the inspector said. “They have produced thousands of half crowns. We even tracked them to Reading, but we couldn't do anything more because they erased their traces in ways that prove they are seasoned professionals. But now, thanks to this opportunity, I think we will definitely catch them.”
tr_translation: "We knew that a cunning gang was involved in this lately," said the Inspector. "They circulated thousands of coins in the market. We tracked them as far as Reading, but unfortunately, we couldn't go any further because they had erased their tracks with great skill. This shows that they are experts in their field. But now, thanks to this great opportunity that has come our way, we will be able to catch them."
es_translation: "We have known for some time that a cunning gang was at work," said the inspector. "They have been producing half-crowns by the thousands. We even tracked them to Reading, but we couldn't get any further because they had covered their tracks in a way that showed they were very experienced people. But now, thanks to this fortunate coincidence, I think we have hit the mark."

en: “Oh, you mean the little problem of the Grosvenor Square furniture van. That is quite cleared up now—though, indeed, it was obvious from the first. Pray give me the results of your newspaper selections.”
vi: “Ồ, ý anh muốn nói đến vụ chiếc xe chở đồ ở quảng trường Grosvenor chứ gì? Vụ đó đã được làm sáng tỏ rồi - mà thật ra nó đã khá rõ ràng ngay từ đầu. Anh hãy đưa tôi xem những gì mà anh đã chọn ra từ đống báo đi nào.”
tr: "Şu Grosvenor'daki taşıma arabası meselesinden mi bahsediyorsun? O küçük mesele halloldu bile; zaten ilk andan belliydi ne olduğu! Zahmet olmazsa, gazetelerden derlediklerini okuyabilir misin?
es: "Oh, te refieres al pequeño problema del furgón de muebles de Grosvenor Square. Eso ya está aclarado, aunque, de hecho, era obvio desde el principio. Por favor, dame los resultados de tu selección de periódicos".
vi_translation: "Oh, you mean the case of the delivery truck at Grosvenor Square? That case has already been clarified - in fact, it was quite clear from the beginning. Show me what you have picked out from the pile of newspapers."
tr_translation: "Are you talking about the carriage issue at Grosvenor? That little matter has already been resolved; it was obvious from the start what it was! If it's not too much trouble, could you read what you've gathered from the newspapers?"
es_translation: "Oh, you mean the little problem with the furniture van in Grosvenor Square. That has already been clarified, although, in fact, it was obvious from the beginning. Please, give me the results of your newspaper selection."

en: “But it needs a great deal of supplementing before anyone could offer an opinion. I think that I may arrive at my facts most directly by questioning you.”
vi: “Nhưng trước khi có thể đưa ra ý kiến thì tôi cần thêm khá nhiều chi tiết bổ sung. Tôi nghĩ rằng cách trực tiếp nhất để có thể xác lập các dữ kiện là đặt ra vài câu hỏi với ngài.”
tr: "Ama bir varmak için bundan fazlası gerekiyor. Size yönelteceğim sorulara vereceğiniz cevaplarla bir sonuca ulaşmayı umuyorum.
es: "Pero necesita muchos detalles antes de que alguien pueda ofrecer una opinión. Creo que puedo llegar a mis conclusiones más fácilmente preguntándole a usted".
vi_translation: “But before I can give an opinion, I need quite a lot of additional details. I think the most direct way to establish the facts is to ask you a few questions.”
tr_translation: "But it takes more than this to reach a destination. I hope to reach a conclusion with the answers you will give to the questions I will ask you."
es_translation: "But it needs many details before anyone can offer an opinion. I think I can reach my conclusions more easily by asking you."

en: “Yes, her father brought her over for this last London season. I met her several times, became engaged to her, and have now married her.”
vi: “Phải, cha nàng đưa nàng đến London vào mùa xã giao[126] vừa rồi. Tôi có gặp nàng vài lần, rồi cầu hôn và giờ thì đã cưới nàng.
tr: "Evet. Babası en son Londra'ya gelirken onu da getirmişti. Birkaç kez buluştuk, nişanlandık ve şimdi de evliyiz.
es: "Sí, su padre la trajo para esta última temporada en Londres. La vi varias veces, me comprometí con ella y ahora me he casado con ella".
vi_translation: “Yes, her father brought her to London during the last social season[126]. I met her a few times, then proposed and now we are married.”
tr_translation: "Yes. Her father brought her along the last time he came to London. We met a few times, got engaged, and now we are married."
es_translation: "Yes, her father brought her for this last season in London. I saw her several times, got engaged to her, and now I have married her."

en: “No. They were found floating near the margin by a park-keeper. They have been identified as her clothes, and it seemed to me that if the clothes were there the body would not be far off.”
vi: “Ông đã mò được chúng ở hồ Serpentine à?” “Không. Một người gác công viên đã nhìn thấy chúng nổi lềnh bềnh ở mép hồ. Chúng đã được xác nhận là y phục của cô ta và theo tôi, nếu quần áo được tìm thấy ở đó thì hẳn là thi thể cũng ở gần đấy thôi.”
tr: "Hayır. Parkın bir köşesinde bulduk. Onun elbiseleri olduğunu anlayınca da cesedin uzakta olamayacağını düşündüm.
es: "No. Fueron encontrados flotando cerca de la orilla por un cuidador del parque. Han sido identificadas como sus ropas, y me pareció que si las ropas estaban allí el cuerpo no estaría muy lejos."
vi_translation: “Did you find them at the Serpentine Lake?” "No." "A park ranger saw them floating at the edge of the lake." "They have been confirmed as her clothes, and in my opinion, if the clothes were found there, then the body must be nearby."
tr_translation: "No. We found it in a corner of the park. When I realized they were her clothes, I thought the body couldn't be far away."
es_translation: "No. They were found floating near the shore by a park caretaker. They have been identified as his clothes, and it seemed to me that if the clothes were there, the body wouldn't be very far away."

en: “By the same brilliant reasoning, every man’s body is to be found in the neighbourhood of his wardrobe. And pray what did you hope to arrive at through this?”
vi: “Dựa vào cái lập luận tài ba ấy thì hẳn là xác của mọi người đều được tìm thấy không xa tủ quần áo của họ. Xin ông vui lòng cho biết là ông hi vọng sẽ thu được điều gì từ những thứ này?”
tr: "Aynı parlak akıl yürütmeyle, her insanın cesedi gardırobunun yakınlarında bulunur diyebiliriz. Rica etsem söyler misiniz, bununla nereye varmak istiyorsun?
es: "Por el mismo brillante razonamiento, el cuerpo de todo hombre se encuentra en las cercanías de su armario. ¿Y a qué esperaba llegar con esto?"
vi_translation: “Based on that brilliant argument, surely everyone's body would be found not far from their wardrobe. Could you please tell me what you hope to gain from these things?”
tr_translation: "With the same brilliant reasoning, we could say that every person's corpse is found near their wardrobe. Could you please tell me, where are you going with this?"
es_translation: "By the same brilliant reasoning, the body of every man is located near his wardrobe. And what was he hoping to achieve with this?"

en: My friend rose lazily from his armchair and stood with his hands in the pockets of his dressing-gown, looking over my shoulder. It was a bright, crisp February morning, and the snow of the day before still lay deep upon the ground, shimmering brightly in the wintry sun. Down the centre of Baker Street it had been ploughed into a brown crumbly band by the traffic, but at either side and on the heaped-up edges of the footpaths it still lay as white as when it fell. The grey pavement had been cleaned and scraped, but was still dangerously slippery, so that there were fewer passengers than usual. Indeed, from the direction of the Metropolitan Station no one was coming save the single gentleman whose eccentric conduct had drawn my attention.
vi: Bạn tôi uể oải rời khỏi chiếc ghế bành và đứng nhìn qua vai tôi, hai tay thọc vào túi áo choàng ngủ. Hôm đó là một buổi sáng tháng 2 sáng sủa và khô lạnh, lớp tuyết rơi xuống từ hôm trước vẫn còn đọng lại trên mặt đất, lấp lánh dưới ánh mặt trời mùa đông. Dọc theo chính giữa phố Baker, tuyết đã bị xe cộ xới lên thành một dải vụn xốp màu nâu, nhưng tuyết ở hai bên đường thì hãy còn trắng tinh như vừa rơi xuống. Vỉa hè màu xám đã được quét dọn sạch sẽ và cào bớt tuyết nhưng hãy còn khá trơn trượt và nguy hiểm nên vắng khách bộ hành qua lại hơn mọi ngày. Thật vậy, từ hướng nhà ga Metropolitan đến đây chẳng có một ai ngoại trừ người đàn ông đơn độc có hành vi kì quái khiến tôi phải chú ý đó.
tr: Dostum, koltuğundan ağır hareketlerle kalktı ve elleri sabahlığının cebinde, omzumun üzerinden bakmaya başladı. Bulutsuz, serin bir Şubat sabahıydı ve dünden kalma karlar yeri kalın bir örtü gibi kaplamış, kış güneşinin altında parlıyordu. Baker Sokağı'nın ortasındaki karlar trafik yüzünden erimişti ama kaldırımların dipleri hâlâ bembeyazdı. Gri kaldırımlar temizlenmiş ve küreklenmişti ama tehlikeli derecede kaygan oldukları için fazla yaya yoktu. Aslında, garip davranışları dikkatimi çeken beyefendinin dışında, Metropolitan İstasyonu yönünden gelen kimse yoktu.
es: Mi amigo se levantó perezosamente de su sillón y se quedó con las manos en los bolsillos de su bata, mirando por encima de mi hombro. Era una brillante y fresca mañana de febrero, y la nieve del día anterior todavía yacía profundamente en el suelo, brillando con fuerza bajo el sol invernal. En el centro de Baker Street, el tráfico la había convertido en una franja marrón y grumosa, pero a ambos lados y en los bordes amontonados de los senderos seguía siendo tan blanca como cuando cayó. El pavimento gris había sido limpiado y raspado, pero seguía siendo peligrosamente resbaladizo, por lo que había menos pasajeros que de costumbre. De hecho, desde la dirección de la Estación Metropolitana no venía nadie, salvo el único caballero cuya excéntrica conducta había llamado mi atención.
vi_translation: My friend sluggishly got up from the armchair and stood looking over my shoulder, hands thrust into the pockets of his dressing gown. It was a bright and cold February morning, the snow that had fallen the day before still lingered on the ground, sparkling under the winter sun. Along the middle of Baker Street, the snow had been churned up by vehicles into a brown, crumbly strip, but the snow on either side of the road remained pristine as if it had just fallen. The gray sidewalks had been swept clean and the snow scraped off, but they were still quite slippery and dangerous, so there were fewer pedestrians than usual. Indeed, from the direction of the Metropolitan station, there was no one except for the solitary man with the peculiar behavior that caught my attention.
tr_translation: My friend got up from his chair with slow movements and, with his hands in the pockets of his dressing gown, began to look over my shoulder. It was a cloudless, cool February morning and the snow from the previous day covered the ground like a thick blanket, sparkling under the winter sun. The snow in the middle of Baker Street had melted due to traffic, but the edges of the sidewalks were still completely white. The gray sidewalks had been cleaned and shoveled, but because they were dangerously slippery, there were few pedestrians. In fact, besides the gentleman whose strange behavior caught my attention, there was no one coming from the direction of the Metropolitan Station.
es_translation: My friend lazily got up from his armchair and stood with his hands in the pockets of his robe, looking over my shoulder. It was a bright and fresh February morning, and the snow from the previous day still lay deeply on the ground, shining brightly under the winter sun. In the center of Baker Street, the traffic had turned it into a brown and lumpy strip, but on both sides and on the piled edges of the paths, it remained as white as when it fell. The gray pavement had been cleaned and scraped, but it was still dangerously slippery, so there were fewer pedestrians than usual. In fact, from the direction of the Metropolitan Station, no one was coming, except for the one gentleman whose eccentric behavior had caught my attention.

en: He was a man of about fifty, tall, portly, and imposing, with a massive, strongly marked face and a commanding figure. He was dressed in a sombre yet rich style, in black frock-coat, shining hat, neat brown gaiters, and well-cut pearl-grey trousers. Yet his actions were in absurd contrast to the dignity of his dress and features, for he was running hard, with occasional little springs, such as a weary man gives who is little accustomed to set any tax upon his legs. As he ran he jerked his hands up and down, waggled his head, and writhed his face into the most extraordinary contortions.
vi: Ông ta khoảng năm mươi tuổi, cao to, bệ vệ, mặt to, đậm nét và dáng vẻ uy nghi, ông ta mặc một bộ y phục tối màu nhưng có kiểu dáng sang trọng, gồm một chiếc áo măng tô màu đen, cái mũ mới tinh, đôi ghệt màu nâu gọn gàng và chiếc quần màu xám ngọc trai cắt rất khéo. Thế nhưng hành vi của ông ta lại tương phản đến nực cười với vẻ ngoài đường hoàng ấy vì ông ta đang chạy rất nhanh, đôi lúc lại hơi tập tễnh như kiểu của một người rất mệt vì không quen bắt đôi chân làm việc. Vừa chạy ông ta vừa vung vẫy hai tay, lúc lắc cái đầu và khuôn mặt thì nhăn nhó trông vô cùng kì dị.
tr: Elli yaşlarında, uzun boylu, şişmanca bir adamdı. Güçlü bir ifadesi ve kendinden emin bir yapısı vardı. Siyah frakı, parlak şapkası, şık kahverengi tozlukları ve gri pantolonuyla zengin ama iç karartıcı bir stilde giyinmişti. Ama davranışları, giysileri ve görünümüne aykırıydı. Yorgun olmasına rağmen koşmakta kararlı biri gibi ara sıra hızla ileri atılıyor, sonra yine yavaşlıyordu. Koşarken ellerini aşağıya yukarıya sallıyor; kafasını bir o yana, bir bu yana yatırıyor ve yüzünü en olmadık şekillere sokuyordu.
es: Era un hombre de unos cincuenta años, alto, corpulento e imponente, con un rostro macizo y fuertemente marcado y una figura imponente. Iba vestido con un estilo sombrío pero rico, con levita negra, sombrero brillante, polainas marrones y pantalones grises perlados bien cortados. Sin embargo, sus acciones contrastaban absurdamente con la dignidad de su vestimenta y sus rasgos, ya que corría con fuerza, dando de vez en cuando pequeños brincos, como los que da un hombre cansado que está poco acostumbrado a exigir a sus piernas. Mientras corría, sacudía las manos hacia arriba y hacia abajo, movía la cabeza y retorcía la cara en las más extraordinarias contorsiones.
vi_translation: He was about fifty years old, tall, stout, with a broad, prominent face and a dignified appearance. He wore a dark, stylish outfit consisting of a black overcoat, a brand-new hat, neat brown gaiters, and well-tailored pearl gray trousers. However, his behavior was absurdly at odds with his stately appearance, as he was running very fast, occasionally limping slightly like someone who was very tired and unaccustomed to making his legs work. As he ran, he waved his arms, shook his head, and his face contorted in a very bizarre manner.
tr_translation: He was a tall, somewhat stout man in his sixties. He had a strong expression and a confident demeanor. With his black tailcoat, shiny hat, stylish brown gaiters, and gray trousers, he was dressed in a rich yet gloomy style. But his behavior was contrary to his clothes and appearance. Despite being tired, he occasionally lunged forward as if determined to run, then slowed down again. While running, he swung his hands up and down; tilted his head from side to side, and contorted his face into the most unlikely shapes.
es_translation: He was a man of about fifty years, tall, corpulent, and imposing, with a massive and strongly marked face and an imposing figure. He was dressed in a somber but rich style, with a black frock coat, shiny hat, brown gaiters, and well-cut pearl gray trousers. However, his actions absurdly contrasted with the dignity of his attire and features, as he ran vigorously, occasionally taking small leaps, like those of a tired man unaccustomed to demanding much from his legs. As he ran, he shook his hands up and down, moved his head, and twisted his face into the most extraordinary contortions.

en: “Yes; I rather think he is coming to consult me professionally. I think that I recognise the symptoms. Ha! did I not tell you?” As he spoke, the man, puffing and blowing, rushed at our door and pulled at our bell until the whole house resounded with the clanging.
vi: “Phải, tôi nghĩ là ông ta đang đến đây để hỏi ý kiến chuyên môn của tôi. Tôi nhận ra những biểu hiện này, Ha! Tôi đã nói với anh rồi mà, thấy chưa?” Trong lúc anh nói, người đàn ông đang thở hổn hển nọ đã lao nhanh đến cửa nhà chúng tôi và kéo mạnh dây chuông cho đến khi tiếng chuông vang rền khắp nhà.
tr: Herhalde bana danışmak istiyor. Sanırım bu belirtileri daha önce de gördüm. İşte! Dememiş miydim?" O bunları söylerken adam oflaya puflaya kapımıza kadar koşmuş ve evi ayağa kaldıracak kadar şiddetle zile asılmıştı.
es: "Sí; más bien creo que viene a consultarme profesionalmente. Creo que reconozco los síntomas. ¿No se lo he dicho?" Mientras hablaba, el hombre, resoplando y soplando, se abalanzó sobre nuestra puerta y tiró del timbre hasta que toda la casa resonó con el tintineo.
vi_translation: "Yes, I think he's coming here to seek my professional advice. I recognize these signs, Ha! I told you so, didn't I?" As he spoke, the panting man rushed to our door and yanked the bell pull until the sound echoed throughout the house.
tr_translation: He probably wants to consult with me. I think I've seen these symptoms before. There! Didn't I say so?" While he was saying these, the man had run to our door, huffing and puffing, and had rung the bell so violently that it could have woken up the entire house.
es_translation: "Yes; rather, I think he comes to consult me professionally. I think I recognize the symptoms. Didn't I tell you?" While he was speaking, the man, puffing and blowing, rushed to our door and pulled the bell until the whole house resonated with the jingling.

en: “You have come to me to tell your story, have you not?” said he. “You are fatigued with your haste. Pray wait until you have recovered yourself, and then I shall be most happy to look into any little problem which you may submit to me.”
vi: “Ông đến đây gặp tôi để kể câu chuyện của ông, có phải không?” Anh hỏi. “Ông đã mệt mỏi vì phải chạy vội vàng rồi. Xin ông hãy đợi một lúc để hồi phục lại rồi sau đó tôi sẽ rất vui khi được xem xét vấn đề mà ông muốn trình bày dù là chuyện nhỏ nhặt nhất.”
tr: "Bana hikâyenizi anlatmaya geldiniz, değil mi?" dedi. "Acele ettiğiniz için biraz yorulmuşsunuz. Biraz soluklanana kadar oturun. Küçük sorununuzla sonra da ilgilenebiliriz.
es: "Ha venido usted a contarme su historia, ¿no es así? "Está usted fatigado por las prisas. Le ruego que espere hasta que se haya recuperado, y entonces estaré encantado de examinar cualquier pequeño problema que me plantee".
vi_translation: “You came here to meet me to tell your story, didn't you?” he asked. “You must be tired from rushing around. Please wait a moment to recover, and then I will be very happy to consider the issue you want to present, no matter how trivial it may be.”
tr_translation: "You have come to tell me your story, haven't you?" he said. "You seem a bit tired from rushing. Take a seat until you catch your breath. We can deal with your small problem later."
es_translation: "You have come to tell me your story, haven't you?" "You are tired from the rush." "I ask you to wait until you have recovered, and then I will be delighted to examine any small problem you present to me."

en: “I feel that time is of value,” said he; “that is why I hastened here when the police inspector suggested that I should secure your co-operation. I came to Baker Street by the Underground and hurried from there on foot, for the cabs go slowly through this snow. That is why I was so out of breath, for I am a man who takes very little exercise. I feel better now, and I will put the facts before you as shortly and yet as clearly as I can.
vi: “Tôi thấy thời gian thật quý giá biết bao”, ông ta nói, “vì thế tôi vội vã đến đây sau khi được ông thanh tra cảnh sát gợi ý rằng tôi nên cầu viện sự trợ giúp của ông. Tôi đến phố Baker bằng tuyến đường sắt ngầm và hổi hả chạy bộ từ đó đến đây vì với lớp tuyết dày như thế này thì xe ngựa đi rất chậm. Đó là nguyên nhân tôi bị hụt hơi vì tôi vốn ít vận động. Giờ thì tôi đã cảm thấy khỏe hơn, và tôi sẽ cố hết sức để trình bày sự việc với các ông thật ngắn gọn mà vẫn rõ ràng.
tr: "Vakit nakittir," dedi. "Onun için polis müfettişi sizin yardımınıza başvurmamı tavsiye edince hemen size koştum. Baker Sokağı'na tramvayla geldim ve bu karda faytonlar yavaş gider diye kalan yolu yürüyerek gelmeyi tercih ettim. Herhalde pek antrenmanlı olmadığım için de nefes nefese kaldım. Şimdi daha iyiyim. Gerçekleri size kısaca ve bütün açıklığıyla anlatmaya başlayabilirim.
es: "Siento que el tiempo es valioso -dijo-; por eso me apresuré a venir aquí cuando el inspector de policía me sugirió que obtuviera su cooperación. Llegué a Baker Street en el metro y me apresuré a salir de allí a pie, porque los taxis van despacio con esta nieve. Por eso me quedé sin aliento, ya que soy un hombre que hace muy poco ejercicio. Ahora me siento mejor y le expondré los hechos con la mayor brevedad y claridad posible.
vi_translation: “I realize how precious time is,” he said, “which is why I hurried here after the police inspector suggested that I should seek your assistance. I took the underground railway to Baker Street and hurriedly ran from there to here because with such thick snow, carriages move very slowly. That is why I am out of breath, as I am not used to much physical activity. Now I feel better, and I will try my best to present the matter to you as briefly yet clearly as possible.
tr_translation: "Time is money," he said. "That's why when the police inspector advised me to seek your help, I immediately rushed to you. I came to Baker Street by tram and preferred to walk the rest of the way because carriages go slow in this snow. Probably because I'm not very fit, I was out of breath. Now I feel better. I can start telling you the facts briefly and with complete clarity.
es_translation: "I feel that time is valuable," he said, "that's why I hurried to come here when the police inspector suggested that I obtain your cooperation. I arrived at Baker Street by subway and hurried to walk out of there, because taxis go slowly in this snow. That's why I was out of breath, as I am a man who does very little exercise. Now I feel better and I will present the facts to you as briefly and clearly as possible.

en: “It is, of course, well known to you that in a successful banking business as much depends upon our being able to find remunerative investments for our funds as upon our increasing our connection and the number of our depositors. One of our most lucrative means of laying out money is in the shape of loans, where the security is unimpeachable. We have done a good deal in this direction during the last few years, and there are many noble families to whom we have advanced large sums upon the security of their pictures, libraries, or plate.
vi: Hẳn các ông cũng biết rất rõ là việc kinh doanh nhà băng thành công không chỉ phụ thuộc vào năng lực tìm kiếm những khoản đầu tư có lợi cho ngân quỹ của mình mà còn phải trông vào việc tăng cường các mối quan hệ và số lượng khách gửi tiền. Một trong những hình thức đầu tư sinh lợi nhất của chúng tôi là cho vay nếu có vật thế chấp đáng tin cậy. Trong những năm qua, chúng tôi đã thực hiện rất nhiều vụ làm ăn theo hướng này, và có nhiều gia đình quý tộc đã được chúng tôi ứng cho những số tiền lớn với vật thế chấp là các bức họa nổi tiếng, sách hoặc bát đĩa quý.
tr: "Siz de bilirsiniz ki bankacılıkta başarılı olmak için kaynaklarımıza yatırımlar bulmamız ve bağlantılarımızı artırarak daha çok müşteriye ulaşmamız gerekir. Bunun en iyi yolu da kredi vermektir ve bunun için de teminat şarttır. Son birkaç yıl içinde bu yönde çok başarılı olduk ve birçok soylu aileye, ellerindeki tablolar, kitaplıklar veya diğer eşyaları karşılığında oldukça yüklü miktarlarda krediler verdik.
es: Por supuesto, ustedes saben que el éxito de un negocio bancario depende tanto de que seamos capaces de encontrar inversiones remunerativas para nuestros fondos como de que aumentemos nuestras conexiones y el número de nuestros depositantes. Uno de nuestros medios más lucrativos para colocar el dinero es en forma de préstamos, donde la seguridad es intachable. Hemos hecho mucho en este sentido durante los últimos años, y hay muchas familias nobles a las que hemos adelantado grandes sumas en garantía de sus cuadros, bibliotecas o placas.
vi_translation: Surely, you gentlemen are well aware that successful banking business not only depends on the ability to find profitable investments for our funds but also relies on strengthening relationships and increasing the number of depositors. One of our most profitable forms of investment is lending if there is reliable collateral. Over the years, we have conducted many transactions in this manner, and many noble families have been advanced large sums by us with collateral in the form of famous paintings, books, or valuable dishes.
tr_translation: "As you know, to be successful in banking, we need to find investments for our resources and increase our connections to reach more clients. The best way to do this is by giving loans, and for that, collateral is essential. In the past few years, we have been very successful in this regard and have given substantial loans to many noble families in exchange for their paintings, libraries, or other belongings.
es_translation: Of course, you know that the success of a banking business depends both on our ability to find remunerative investments for our funds and on increasing our connections and the number of our depositors. One of our most lucrative means of placing money is in the form of loans, where the security is impeccable. We have done much in this regard over the past few years, and there are many noble families to whom we have advanced large sums against the security of their paintings, libraries, or plaques.

en: “He often had a wild way of talking, so that I thought little of what he said. He followed me to my room, however, that night with a very grave face.
vi: Nó vẫn thường ăn nói bừa bãi như thế nên tôi không quan tâm lắm. Tuy nhiên, tối hôm đó, nó bước theo tôi vào phòng riêng của tôi với vẻ mặt rất nghiêm trọng.
tr: "Hep böyle garip konuştuğu için, söylediklerinin üzerinde pek durmadım. Ama o gece benimle birlikte odama kadar geldi.
es: "A menudo tenía una forma desenfrenada de hablar, de modo que yo pensaba poco en lo que decía. Sin embargo, aquella noche me siguió hasta mi habitación con un rostro muy serio.
vi_translation: It often speaks recklessly like that, so I don't pay much attention. However, that evening, it followed me into my private room with a very serious expression.
tr_translation: "Since he always spoke so strangely, I didn't pay much attention to what he said. But that night, he came to my room with me.
es_translation: "He often had a reckless way of speaking, so I thought little of what he said. However, that night he followed me to my room with a very serious face.

en: “‘Keep your forgiveness for those who ask for it,’ he answered, turning away from me with a sneer. I saw that he was too hardened for any words of mine to influence him. There was but one way for it. I called in the inspector and gave him into custody. A search was made at once not only of his person but of his room and of every portion of the house where he could possibly have concealed the gems; but no trace of them could be found, nor would the wretched boy open his mouth for all our persuasions and our threats. This morning he was removed to a cell, and I, after going through all the police formalities, have hurried round to you to implore you to use your skill in unravelling the matter. The police have openly confessed that they can at present make nothing of it. You may go to any expense which you think necessary. I have already offered a reward of £ 1000. My God, what shall I do! I have lost my honour, my gems, and my son in one night. Oh, what shall I do!”
vi: ‘Cha hãy dành sự tha thứ ấy cho những kẻ cần đến nó’, nó trả lời và quay lưng lại với tôi với nụ cười chế nhạo. Tôi thấy rằng con trai mình đã trở nên quá chai sạn và không một lời nào của tôi có thể tác động đến nó. Chỉ còn một cách duy nhất. Tôi gọi viên thanh tra vào và giao nó cho nhà chức trách. Một cuộc lục soát được tiến hành ngay lập tức, không chỉ trên người nó mà cả trong phòng của nó cùng với mọi nơi trong nhà có thể giấu những viên đá quý; nhưng chẳng thấy tăm hơi chúng đâu cả, mà thằng con đáng ghét của tôi cũng không hề mở miệng trước mọi lời thuyết phục hay đe dọa của chúng tôi. Nó đã bị giam vào xà lim lúc sáng nay, còn về phần tôi, sau khi làm xong mọi thủ tục theo yêu cầu của cảnh sát là tôi vội vã chạy đến gặp ông ngay để cầu xin ông đem tài năng của mình ra để làm sáng tỏ vấn đề. Cảnh sát cũng thẳng thắn thú nhận là vào lúc này họ chẳng thể làm được gì. Ông đòi thù lao bao nhiêu cũng được. Tôi đã treo giải thưởng là một ngàn bảng. Chúa ơi, con phải làm gì đây? Chỉ sau một đêm, con đã mất đi danh dự, những viên đá quý và cả con trai mình. Ôi, con nên làm gì đây?”
tr: " 'Affını başkalarına sakla,' diye cevap verdi burun kıvırarak. "Söyleyeceğim hiçbir şeyin onu etkilemeyeceğini anladım. Artık tek bir çarem kalmıştı. Müfettişi çağırdım ve onu gözaltına aldılar. Odasını ve evde mücevherleri saklayabileceği her yeri aradılar ama ne bir iz bulundu, ne de benim zavallı çocuğum, bütün dil dökmelere ve tehditlere rağmen tek bir söz söyledi. Bu sabah onu bir hücreye kapattılar ve ben de bütün polis formalitelerini tamamlayıp meseleyi çözmeniz için yardım istemek üzere size koştum. Polis, açık seçik bir şekilde şu anda yapabilecekleri bir şey olmadığını itiraf etti. "Siz hiçbir harcamadan kaçınmayın Bay Holmes. Zaten 1000 sterlinlik bir ödül de koydum. Aman Tanrım, ben ne yapacağım? Bir gecede bütün şerefimi, mücevherleri ve oğlumu kaybettim. Ah, ne yapacağım ben?
es: " 'Guarda tu perdón para los que te lo piden', respondió, apartándose de mí con una mueca. Vi que estaba demasiado endurecido para que mis palabras pudieran influir en él. Sólo había un modo de hacerlo. Llamé al inspector y lo puse bajo custodia. Se registró inmediatamente no sólo su persona, sino también su habitación y todas las partes de la casa en las que podría haber ocultado las gemas; pero no se encontró ni rastro de ellas, ni el desdichado muchacho quiso abrir la boca a pesar de todas nuestras persuasiones y amenazas. Esta mañana fue trasladado a una celda, y yo, después de pasar por todas las formalidades policiales, me he apresurado a acudir a usted para implorarle que utilice su habilidad para desentrañar el asunto. La policía ha confesado abiertamente que por el momento no puede hacer nada al respecto. Puede usted hacer los gastos que considere necesarios. Ya he ofrecido una recompensa de 1. 000 libras. ¡Dios mío, qué voy a hacer! He perdido mi honor, mis joyas y mi hijo en una noche. ¡Oh, qué voy a hacer!"
vi_translation: “Father, save that forgiveness for those who need it,” he replied and turned his back on me with a mocking smile. I realized that my son had become too hardened and that no words of mine could affect him. There was only one way left. I called the inspector in and handed him over to the authorities. A search was conducted immediately, not only on him but also in his room and everywhere in the house where the jewels could be hidden; but there was no trace of them, and my detestable son did not utter a word despite all our persuasion and threats. He was locked up in a cell this morning, and as for me, after completing all the necessary procedures required by the police, I rushed to see you to beg you to use your talents to clarify the matter. The police also frankly admitted that at this moment they could do nothing. You can name your price. I have offered a reward of one thousand pounds. God, what should I do? In just one night, I have lost my honor, the jewels, and my son. Oh, what should I do?”
tr_translation: " 'Save your forgiveness for others,' he replied with a sneer. "I realized that nothing I would say would affect him. I had only one option left. I called the inspector and they took him into custody. They searched his room and every place in the house where he could hide the jewelry, but no trace was found, and my poor child, despite all the persuasion and threats, did not say a single word. This morning they locked him in a cell, and after completing all the police formalities, I rushed to you to ask for help in solving the matter. The police plainly admitted that there is nothing more they can do at this moment. "Spare no expense, Mr. Holmes. I have already offered a reward of 1000 pounds. Oh my God, what am I going to do? In one night, I lost all my honor, the jewels, and my son. Oh, what am I going to do?"
es_translation: " 'Save your forgiveness for those who ask for it,' he replied, turning away from me with a grimace. I saw that he was too hardened for my words to influence him. There was only one way to do it. I called the inspector and put him in custody. He was immediately searched, as well as his room and all parts of the house where he could have hidden the gems; but no trace of them was found, and the unfortunate boy refused to open his mouth despite all our persuasions and threats. This morning he was transferred to a cell, and I, after going through all the police formalities, hurried to you to implore you to use your skill to unravel the matter. The police have openly confessed that for the moment they can do nothing about it. You may incur any expenses you deem necessary. I have already offered a reward of 1,000 pounds. My God, what am I going to do! I have lost my honor, my jewels, and my son in one night. Oh, what am I going to do!"

en: “But I am so sure that he is innocent. You know what woman’s instincts are. I know that he has done no harm and that you will be sorry for having acted so harshly.”
vi: “Nhưng cháu chắc chắn anh ấy vô tội. Bác cũng hiểu rõ trực giác của phụ nữ mà. Cháu biết anh ấy không làm điều gì sai quấy và bác sẽ hối tiếc vì đã hành động khắt khe đến thế.”
tr: "Ama onun masum olduğuna eminim. Kadınların içgüdülerini bilirsin. Kötü bir şey yapmadığını biliyorum ve sen de ileride ona bu kadar sert davrandığın için pişman olacaksın, inan bana.
es: "Pero estoy muy segura de que es inocente. Ya sabes cómo son los instintos de las mujeres. Sé que no ha hecho ningún daño y que lamentarás haber actuado con tanta dureza".
vi_translation: “But I am certain he is innocent. You understand a woman's intuition, don't you? I know he didn't do anything wrong, and you will regret being so harsh.”
tr_translation: "But I am sure that he is innocent. You know women's instincts. I know he didn't do anything bad, and you will regret treating him so harshly in the future, believe me."
es_translation: "But I am very sure that he is innocent. You know how women's instincts are. I know he hasn't done any harm and that you will regret having acted so harshly."

en: “Yes. Her bed this morning had not been slept in, her room was empty, and a note for me lay upon the hall table. I had said to her last night, in sorrow and not in anger, that if she had married my boy all might have been well with him. Perhaps it was thoughtless of me to say so. It is to that remark that she refers in this note:
vi: “Phải. Sáng nay giường ngủ của nó phẳng phiu như chưa hề có ai nằm lên, trong phòng trống trơn và trên mặt bàn ở hành lang có một bức thư viết cho tôi. Tối hôm qua tôi có nói với nó, do đau buồn chứ không hề giận dữ, rằng nếu nó chịu cưới con trai tôi thì mọi chuyện hẳn là đã ổn thỏa với thằng bé. Có lẽ tôi đã thiếu suy nghĩ khi nói thế. Nó có nhắc đến lời nói đó trong lá thư này:
tr: "Evet. Bu sabah odasına girdiğimde, yatağının bozulmamış ve odasının boş olduğunu gördüm. Antredeki masaya benim adıma bir not bırakılmıştı. Dün gece, öfkeyle değil ama üzüntüyle, oğlumla evlenmiş olsaydı bütün bunların olmayacağını söylemiştim ona. Belki de bu yaptığım, düşüncesizce bir hareketti. Zaten notta da bundan bahsediyor:
es: "Sí. Esta mañana no había dormido en su cama, su habitación estaba vacía y una nota para mí estaba sobre la mesa del vestíbulo. Anoche le dije, con pena y no con rabia, que si se hubiera casado con mi hijo todo habría ido bien con él. Tal vez fue desconsiderado por mi parte decirlo. Es a esa observación a la que se refiere en esta nota:
vi_translation: “Yes. This morning, its bed was neat as if no one had ever slept in it, the room was empty, and there was a letter on the hallway table addressed to me. Last night, I told it, out of sorrow rather than anger, that if it agreed to marry my son, everything would have been fine with the boy. Perhaps I was thoughtless when I said that. It mentioned those words in this letter:
tr_translation: "Yes. When I entered her room this morning, I saw that her bed was untouched and her room was empty. A note was left on the table in the hallway for me. Last night, not in anger but in sadness, I told her that if she had married my son, none of this would have happened. Maybe what I did was a thoughtless act. In the note, she mentions this:
es_translation: "Yes. This morning she had not slept in her bed, her room was empty, and a note for me was on the table in the vestibule. Last night I told her, with sorrow and not with anger, that if she had married my son everything would have gone well with him. Perhaps it was inconsiderate of me to say it. It is to that remark that she refers in this note:

en: “Precisely. It was I. I found that I had my man, so I came home and changed my clothes. It was a delicate part which I had to play then, for I saw that a prosecution must be avoided to avert scandal, and I knew that so astute a villain would see that our hands were tied in the matter. I went and saw him. At first, of course, he denied everything. But when I gave him every particular that had occurred, he tried to bluster and took down a life-preserver from the wall. I knew my man, however, and I clapped a pistol to his head before he could strike. Then he became a little more reasonable. I told him that we would give him a price for the stones he held—£ 1000 apiece. That brought out the first signs of grief that he had shown. ‘Why, dash it all!’ said he, ‘I’ve let them go at six hundred for the three!’ I soon managed to get the address of the receiver who had them, on promising him that there would be no prosecution. Off I set to him, and after much chaffering I got our stones at £ 1000 apiece. Then I looked in upon your son, told him that all was right, and eventually got to my bed about two o’clock, after what I may call a really hard day’s work.”
vi: “Chính xác. Kẻ đó là tôi. Nhận thấy mình đã tìm ra tên trộm, tôi trở về nhà và thay quần áo. Đã đến lúc tôi phải thử diễn phần tế nhị của vở kịch vì tôi thấy rằng không nên khởi tố để tránh xảy ra tai tiếng và tôi cũng biết một kẻ bất lương rất tinh ranh như hắn cũng sẽ đoán được chúng ta đều bị vấn đề này trói buộc. Tôi đến gặp hắn. Tất nhiên là lúc đầu hắn phủ nhận tất cả. Nhưng khi tôi kể cho hắn nghe từng chi tiết đã xảy ra, hắn bèn thử hăm dọa và lấy vũ khí phòng thân treo trên tường xuống. Tuy nhiên, tôi vốn biết rõ đối thủ của mình nên đã gí súng vào đầu hắn trước khi hắn kịp ra đòn. Thế là hắn trở nên biết điều hơn. Tôi bảo hắn rằng chúng ta sẽ trả cho hắn một khoản tiền để lấy lại những viên đá quý mà hắn đang giữ, một ngàn bảng cho mỗi viên. Nghe vậy, mặt hắn liền lộ ra những dấu hiệu tiếc nuối. ‘Sao, mẹ kiếp!’ Hắn nói, ‘tôi đã bán chúng với giá sáu trăm cho cả ba viên!’ Tôi nhanh chóng xoay xở để có được địa chỉ của kẻ tàng trữ đồ trộm cắp đang giữ chúng bằng cách hứa sẽ không đưa hắn ra tòa. Rời khỏi nhà hắn, tôi chạy thẳng đến nhà người mua và sau một hồi lâu cò kè mặc cả, tôi đã có trong tay ba viên đá quý với giá một ngàn bảng mỗi viên. Rồi tôi ghé thăm con trai ông, báo cho anh ta biết là mọi việc đã ổn, cuối cùng là lên giường đi ngủ vào khoảng 2 giờ sáng sau một ngày làm việc mà tôi có thể nói là cực nhọc.”
tr: "Elbette. O bendim. Adamımı bulduğumu anlayınca eve dönerek kıyafetlerimi değiştirdim. Çok hassas bir noktaya gelmiştim. Bir skandal çıkmasını önlemek için resmi makamları uyandırmamak zorundaydım. Bir yandan da böyle kurnaz bir alçağın, bu meselede elimizin kolumuzun bağlı olduğunu bildiğinin farkınday-dım. Onu görmeye gittim. Tabii ki ilk başta her şeyi reddetti. Ama olanları bütün ayrıntılarıyla anlatınca duvarda asılı bastonu kaparak karşı koymaya çalıştı. Adamımı iyi tanıdığım için o daha vurmaya kalkmadan silahımı kafasına dayadım. O zaman biraz aklı başına geldi. Elindeki her taş için 1000 sterlin vereceğimizi söyledim. Bunun üzerine yüzü asıldı. 'Lanet olsun!' dedi, 'üçünü altı yüze sattım bile!' Resmi bir soruşturma açılmayacağını garanti ederek mücevherlerin yeni sahibinin adresini almayı başardım. O adrese gittim ve sıkı bir pazarlık sonucu, parça başına 1000 sterline geri aldım mücevherleri. Sonra oğlunuza uğrayarak her şeyin yolunda olduğunu anlattım ve ancak saat ikide, uzun bir günün sonunda yatağıma girebildim.
es: "Precisamente. Era yo. Me di cuenta de que tenía a mi hombre, así que volví a casa y me cambié de ropa. Fue un papel delicado el que tuve que desempeñar entonces, pues vi que había que evitar una acusación para evitar el escándalo, y sabía que un villano tan astuto vería que teníamos las manos atadas en el asunto. Fui a verle. Al principio, por supuesto, lo negó todo. Pero cuando le di todos los detalles que habían ocurrido, trató de fanfarronear y bajó un salvavidas de la pared. Sin embargo, yo conocía a mi hombre y le puse una pistola en la cabeza antes de que pudiera atacar. Entonces se volvió un poco más razonable. Le dije que le daríamos un precio por las piedras que tenía: 1. 000 libras por cada una. Eso hizo que aparecieran los primeros signos de dolor que había mostrado. Pero, ¡maldita sea! -dijo-, ¡las he dejado ir a seiscientas por las tres! No tardé en conseguir la dirección del receptor que los tenía, prometiéndole que no se le perseguiría. Me puse en contacto con él y, después de muchos rodeos, conseguí nuestras piedras a 1. 000 libras cada una. Luego vi a su hijo, le dije que todo estaba bien, y finalmente llegué a mi cama alrededor de las dos, después de lo que puedo llamar un día de trabajo realmente duro."
vi_translation: "Exactly. That person is me. Realizing that I had found the thief, I returned home and changed clothes. It was time for me to try the delicate part of the play because I felt that prosecution should be avoided to prevent scandal, and I also knew that a very cunning rogue like him would also guess that we were all bound by this issue. I went to meet him. Of course, at first, he denied everything. But when I told him every detail that had happened, he then tried to threaten and took down the self-defense weapon hanging on the wall. However, knowing my opponent well, I pointed a gun at his head before he could strike. So he became more compliant. I told him that we would pay him a sum of money to get back the jewels he was holding, one thousand pounds for each gem. Hearing that, his face immediately showed signs of regret. 'What the hell!' He said, 'I sold them for six hundred for all three!' I quickly managed to get the address of the fence holding them by promising not to take him to court. Leaving his house, I went straight to the buyer's house and after a long haggling, I had the three jewels in hand for one thousand pounds each. Then I visited your son, informed him that everything was settled, and finally went to bed around 2 AM after what I can say was a very exhausting day."
tr_translation: "Of course. That was me. When I realized I had found my man, I went home and changed my clothes. I had reached a very delicate point. To prevent a scandal, I had to avoid alerting the authorities. On the other hand, I was aware that such a cunning scoundrel knew our hands were tied in this matter. I went to see him. Of course, he denied everything at first. But when I recounted the events in detail, he grabbed a cane hanging on the wall and tried to resist. Knowing my man well, I pointed my gun at his head before he could strike. Then he came to his senses a bit. I told him we would pay £1000 for each stone he had. Upon hearing this, his face fell. 'Damn it!' he said, 'I've already sold three for six hundred!' By guaranteeing that no official investigation would be opened, I managed to get the address of the new owner of the jewels. I went to that address and, after tough negotiations, I bought the jewels back for £1000 each. Then I visited your son, told him everything was fine, and only at two o'clock, after a long day, was I able to get into my bed."
es_translation: "Precisely. It was me. I realized I had my man, so I went back home and changed clothes. It was a delicate role I had to play then, as I saw that an accusation had to be avoided to prevent scandal, and I knew that such a cunning villain would see that we had our hands tied in the matter. I went to see him. At first, of course, he denied everything. But when I gave him all the details that had occurred, he tried to bluff and took a lifebelt down from the wall. However, I knew my man and put a gun to his head before he could attack. Then he became a bit more reasonable. I told him we would give him a price for the stones he had: 1,000 pounds for each one. That made the first signs of pain appear that he had shown. But, damn it! -he said-, I let them go for six hundred for the three! It didn't take long to get the address of the receiver who had them, promising him he wouldn't be pursued. I got in touch with him and, after much haggling, got our stones at 1,000 pounds each. Then I saw his son, told him everything was fine, and finally got to my bed around two, after what I can call a really hard day's work."

en: As he spoke the door opened and a young lady entered the room. She was plainly but neatly dressed, with a bright, quick face, freckled like a plover’s egg, and with the brisk manner of a woman who has had her own way to make in the world.
vi: Anh vừa dứt lời thì cánh của mở ra và một cô gái trẻ bước vào. Cô ta ăn mặc giản dị nhưng gọn gàng, khuôn mặt lanh lợi, sáng sủa, lấm tấm tàn nhang như trứng chim choi choi, và có phong thái nhanh nhẹn của một người phụ nữ luôn phải tự xoay xở trong cuộc sống.
tr: Tam bunları söylerken kapı açıldı ve içeri genç bir bayan girdi. Gösterişsiz ama düzgün giyimi, parlak ve hareketli yüz ifadesiyle, hayatta bazı şeyleri tek başına başarmak zorunda kalmış bir kadın görüntüsü çiziyordu.
es: Mientras hablaba, la puerta se abrió y una joven entró en la habitación. Iba vestida de forma sencilla pero pulcra, con una cara brillante y rápida, pecosa como un huevo de chorlito, y con los modales enérgicos de una mujer que se ha abierto camino en el mundo.
vi_translation: As soon as he finished speaking, the door opened and a young girl stepped in. She was dressed simply but neatly, with a smart and bright face, speckled with freckles like a plover's egg, and had the brisk demeanor of a woman who always has to fend for herself in life.
tr_translation: While he was saying all this, the door opened and a young lady entered. With her modest but neat attire, and her bright and lively facial expression, she portrayed the image of a woman who had to achieve some things in life on her own.
es_translation: While he was speaking, the door opened and a young woman entered the room. She was dressed simply but neatly, with a bright and quick face, freckled like a plover's egg, and with the energetic manners of a woman who has made her way in the world.

en: “You will excuse my troubling you, I am sure,” said she, as my companion rose to greet her, “but I have had a very strange experience, and as I have no parents or relations of any sort from whom I could ask advice, I thought that perhaps you would be kind enough to tell me what I should do.”
vi: “Tôi hi vọng ông sẽ thứ lỗi cho sự quấy rầy này”, cô ta nói khi bạn tôi đứng lên chào, “nhưng có một sự việc rất lạ lùng đã xảy ra với tôi mà tôi lại chẳng có cha mẹ hay người thân nào để có thể hỏi ý kiến, vậy nên tôi mới nghĩ có lẽ ông sẽ vui lòng chỉ bảo cho tôi biết mình nên làm gì.”
tr: "Verdiğim rahatsızlığı mazur göreceğinize eminim," dedi kadın, dostum onu karşılamak için ayağa kalktığında; "çünkü başımdan çok garip bir olay geçti ve tavsiyesini alabileceğim kimsem olmadığı için sizden yardım istemeye geldim.
es: "Disculpe que la moleste, estoy segura", dijo, cuando mi acompañante se levantó para saludarla, "pero he tenido una experiencia muy extraña, y como no tengo padres ni parientes de ningún tipo a los que pueda pedir consejo, pensé que tal vez usted tendría la amabilidad de decirme qué debo hacer".
vi_translation: "I hope you will forgive this intrusion," she said as my friend stood up to greet her, "but a very strange thing has happened to me, and I have no parents or relatives to consult, so I thought perhaps you would be kind enough to advise me on what I should do."
tr_translation: "I am sure you will excuse my intrusion," said the woman as my friend stood up to greet her; "because a very strange incident happened to me and I have no one to turn to for advice, so I came to seek your help."
es_translation: "Excuse me for bothering you, I am sure," she said, when my companion stood up to greet her, "but I have had a very strange experience, and since I have no parents or relatives of any kind to whom I can ask for advice, I thought that perhaps you would be kind enough to tell me what I should do."
